item.name: 1714: The Case of the Catalans
item.comment: Rating after first play. Kinda liked it, but have played better games like this.
Tough game!

item.name: 1960: The Making of the President
item.comment:
First impression: Original game, nice mechanics, plenty of flavor. Would like to play again, therefore an 8.
Update: usually I like to buy a game I really. The urge to buy this one has dropped, so rating dropped a point as well. Bought Twilight Struggle instead, which I like better.

item.name: 2 de Mayo
item.comment:
Very quick but very good little wargame. Also good for non-wargamers like me. Left me wanting mooooooore after my first game. Soon became one of my favorite short games.
NL: Kort maar diepgaand spel voor 2. Ongelofelijk dat je in een spel dat maar 20 minuten duurt zoveel diepgang voelt.

item.name: 2010 Swedish Parliament
item.comment: Great game!

item.name: 24/7: The Game
item.comment: Decent abstract calculating game

item.name: 7 Days of Westerplatte
item.comment:
Coop, usually not my favorite genre.
Initial rating, after one tense game. This one works good enough that I'd like to play again. Maybe I should have bought it at Essen...
I liked the tenseness and the general way the game works. I also like that are some different levels of 'toughness' you can play this games. But I thought the morale swings a bit too much, and despite the options to make it harder I have some doubts about replayability. It feels like the kinda game you have to develop a 'group growth' feel for, and after that you pretty much know what to do.
If I had liked coops I would have rated this an 8. It's better than Pandemic for example.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment:
My weekly group reacted very enthusiastically about this game. They demanded another play after the first one, and another.
Remarkably fast game, nice artwork.
Thanks to the changing hands of cards and buying stuff from your neighbours it's a lot more interactive than something like race for the galaxy.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Manneken Pis
item.comment: The eight wonder. Small expansion.

item.name: A la carte
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09
This classic party game has been remade, and how!
It's not a deep game, it's silly fun. And thanks to the beautiful components and odd gameplay it's really something different. Thumbs up.
Played it with 5 (!!!) at Essen after getting the game explained by Karl-Heinz Schmiel himself in full cook's outfit was quite nice too.

item.name: Aargh!Tect
item.comment: This might be the dumbest fun game I own. Hilarious. Recommended with slightly intoxicated adults.

item.name: Abalone
item.comment:
Nice looking abstract. Good for occasional games. (I have the small version)
NL: Duw je tegenstander eruit. Leuk als tussendoortje. Alleen voor 2-spelers.

item.name: Abandon Ship
item.comment: Fun filler. One of the few Reiner Knizia games that are really fun.

item.name: Acqua Dolce
item.comment:
Bought immediately after my first play with the designer at Essen 2009.
I'd never have thought I'd be interested in a game about filling an acquarium with fish, but it turned out to be a nice filler.
Works fine as a 2-player as well.
Only thing I don't like about it: you only tried to go for a win when you're the starting player for the round.

item.name: Acquire
item.comment:
I Have a 1968 bookshelf version in mint unplayed condition. I'll probably leave it unplayed. Sept 07: added the '99 Avalon Hill version to my collection to have a "play copy".
Great classic game.
NL: Klassieker uit de jaren 60. Thema is met aandelen en overnames misschien wat saai, maar is ondanks dat wel een spannend en behoorlijk strategisch spel met milde geluksfactor. Makkelijke regels, maar lastig goed in te worden.
Goed en spannend spel.

item.name: Acquire
item.comment:
I Have 2 versions: a 1968 bookshelf version in mint unplayed condition. I'll probably leave it unplayed. The '99 Avalon Hill version is my "play copy".
Great classic game.
NL: Klassieker uit de jaren 60. Thema is met aandelen en overnames misschien wat saai, maar is ondanks dat wel een spannend en behoorlijk strategisch spel met milde geluksfactor. Makkelijke regels, maar lastig goed in te worden.
Goed en spannend spel.

item.name: Adaptoid
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09. Good looking 2-player abstract, comes with a foldable and washable board. Easy to take along.
Very nifty mechanism: the "better" your pieces get, the easier they are too kill. Very thematic game for an abstract by the way.
NL: 2 persoonsspel waarbij je elkaars "adaptoids" (een soort aanpasbare microbes) probeert op te vreten.

item.name: After Pablo
item.comment:
Bought from Nate at Spiel 2011
Initial rating after one play: brilliant thematically, valid mechanism etc. I'm not sure yet how big the advantage is of being the last player on the last turn, but all 4 players enjoyed a first session and kept talking about the game. Which is always a good sign. Want to play more.

item.name: After the Flood
item.comment:
Another great Wallace game.
NL: 3-persoons spel van Martin Wallace. In 1e instantie lijken het erg veel regels, maar het spel zit eigenlijk best logisch in elkaar.

item.name: Age of Industry
item.comment: Nice follow up to Brass. Should be easier to explain thanks to only 1 fase. Had fun during our first play.

item.name: Age of Industry Expansion #1: Japan and Minnesota
item.comment:
Bought at Spiel 2011
Good expansion board!

item.name: Age of Steam
item.comment:
Modern classic, one of my top 10 games.
NL: De moderne klassieker onder de treinspellen. Tactisch/strategisch.
Geld en ruimte is heel krap bemeten. Je moet dus goed plannen, anders win je nooit. Ik ben behoorlijk uitgekeken op simpele spellen als Ticket to ride, dus ik vind dit erg goed. Heb er een paar alternatieve borden bij.

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: America / Europe
item.comment: 2007 Essen buying spree, more maps for AoS NL: Uitbreiding: 2 andere kaarten voor Age of Steam

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Jamaica / Puerto Rico
item.comment: 18 oct 07 Essen buying spree NL: Uitbreiding: 2 andere kaarten voor Age of Steam

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Mexico & China
Age of Steam Expansion: Mongolia
item.comment: Always good to have a working 2-player map

item.name: Agents of SMERSH
item.comment: Nice storytelling cooperative game

item.name: Agricola
item.comment:
New in collection jan. 08. First german edition. Initial feeling after first two, much anticipated, plays: again, again!
Game grabs you rightaway. Combine that with the enormous amount of different setups (1-5 players, 3 different decks of cards for both occupations & attributes, each with lots of different possible starts & strategies, and a "family version" without the cards, and I can see myself playing this for years to come. It already has all the "expansions" right there in the box! Rating will probably only go up.
Update, after 10+ games I think it's a brilliant game that I can keep playing throughout the years to come with various players. It keeps you on your toes without giving you too much headache.
Update after 30+ games: Still enjoy playing this, but it's gradually losing it's charm. Downgraded half a point.
Update after 5 years: Downgraded to a 6, because I don't enjoy it that much anymore and I probably won't suggest playing this in a while.
NL: Een van de favoriete spellen van mijn medespelers. Iedereen die Puerto Rico leuk vind zou dit moeten proberen. Goed spel voor 1 tot 5 spelers, met "instelbare" moeilijkheidsgraad.

item.name: Agricola X-Deck
item.comment: NL: maffe "alien" uitbreiding voor Agricola.

item.name: Agricola Z-Deck
item.comment:
All the card expansion actually don't add much to the game. Unless you've played this game more than 50 times with the same amount of players most of the Agricola card expansion aren't needed at all.
But sometimes it's just nice to see a card you haven't seen before and think about the possibilities.
NL: de eerste reeks uitbreidingskaartjes voor Agricola.

item.name: Agricola: Farmers of the Moor
item.comment: Better than I had expected, actually changes the game, so it makes it a bit harder (probably because of the newness)

item.name: Agricola: Ö-Deck
item.comment:
more cards. Some of 'm nice, some ok. Just like the regular cards.
NL: speciale "Oostenrijkse" kaartuibreiding voor Agricola.

item.name: Agricola: Through the Seasons
item.comment:
Gives the game a nice twist.
NL: kleine uitbreiding voor Agricola

item.name: Airlines Europe
item.comment: I guess I like this game slightly more than Union Pacific. And it looks better too.

item.name: Aktienrausch
item.comment: Initial rating after 1 play. There's something unique about this short game. It seems to have a layer of debth that is uncommon in short 'filler' card games, so I wouldn't call this one a filler. I have a feeling it's possible to have (just) enough control of the market without getting crushed by the luck of the draw of the cards when getting paid. Want to play more.

item.name: Aladdin's Dragons
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09
Short, pretty fast cardgame. Works.

item.name: Alcatraz: The Scapegoat
item.comment: Good coöp with a screwage twist: one of the players will lose. Nice & nasty.

item.name: Alcazar
item.comment: OK abstract.

item.name: Alles Käse!
item.comment:
Short push your luck card game. High luck factor. Not so special.
Might be fun with kids or non-gamers. Probably best with 2 to 4 players. Don't see myself playing this with more.

item.name: American Rails
item.comment:
Brilliant variation on Chicago Express. I like it even better than the original.
Best additions: The variables start positions, and the 'competition downgrade' for cities.

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment:
New in collection dec. 07
Played this game once in the 4 years that I own it, and not even my own copy.
So despite I think it's one of the best Knizia games, I shouldn't rate it higher than I do.
NL: Klassieker van Reiner Knizia. 1 van zijn beste spellen.

item.name: Android
item.comment:
Loads & loads of info to take in before you can play. Impressive stuff, but it's a bit much.
It all falls together quite nicely though, but I don't think I'm gonna buy the game. I suspect it won't hit the table again anytime soon.
Although I liked our 4-player session, I think there are better games to play in a 5 hour session.
If this game really would have been playable in 180 minutes I'd probably rate it an 7.5 or 8.

item.name: Animal Upon Animal
item.comment:
New in collection may 2008
Fun kids dexterity game with cute parts.
My rating is for playing with adults, which is quite ok for this kind of game. Add at least one point for playing with kids. I'll probably update it when my son is old enough to play it with me...
NL: leuk behendigheids kinderspel waarbij je beesten moet stapelen.

item.name: Antics!
item.comment: Initial rating: might be the best Fragor I've played. Need to play more to see if I 'need' it in my collection.

item.name: Antike
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09. Finally got this recent classic.
Good 'Weuro'. Easy rules, highly interactive.

item.name: Antiquity
item.comment:
New in collection june 08 Ok, this one is Fiddly (yes, that's a capital F). I've spent way more than an hour punching all the various chits.
You lose terribly if you make the mistake of letting your last wood go. (Yes, I learned the hard way)
And most of the time during gameplay you're muttering "I need more food" and "I don't want all these pollution counters" between cursewords.
It can give you a headache. It's quite A.P.prone.
But it's a great game! Everything seems to work very logical together. Had to get myself this quite expensive game after just one play. Can't wait to play it again.
NL: pittig spel met veel te veel zut. maar wel erg goed! Steekt erg goed in elkaar. Ik ga eens kijken wie ik nog meer warm kan krijgen voor dit spel. Het duurt maar 3 uur tenslotte...

item.name: Antler Island
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree Fun game!
NL: Knokken, eten en wijfjes versieren, da's wat je doet om het stoerste mannetjesree van het eiland te worden.

item.name: Appels en Peren
item.comment:
Had a copy of this that came along in a cheap auction for Can't Stop.
After reading the rules I just knew I'd never like it. Let my wife give it away to someone I don't know (best way of making sure I never have to play it...
So yes, I rated this one without playing it. I had it, understood it, and decided that I never want to play it. That sounds enough like a valid opinion to me. I don't have to taste a turd to know I don't want to eat it.

item.name: Los Aprendices
item.comment: Nice game. Almost bought it after the essen testplay. Probably would have bought it, if you didn't have to exchange the special actions so much (or if it was easier to keep track of them)

item.name: Arche Opti Mix
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Another fun game from Frank & Doris. This one can give you a headache while trying to figure out which animal CAN go in a cabin with the ones already on the table, but I like it.
NL: probeer de Ark van Noach vol te laden. Alleen mogen de zware dieren niet allemaal aan 1 kant, want dan slaat de boot om, koukleumen mogen niet in 1 hok met kou liefhebbers, de carnivoren mogen niet bij de kleinere omnivoren, anders vreten ze die op, etc...

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment:
Initial rating after first 2 plays: Average euro city building game where everyone's very keen that their move doesn't support the other players too much. Due to this plus it's sometimes hard to figure out what's your best move, it's possibly a bit A.P. prone. But meanwhile it plays still reasonably fast. Gives a tensionable play within an hour.
Although I happily won my first 2 plays I'd have to play it more to see where various tactics lead, and to see how much replayvalue this has.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment:
After one solo and and one 3-player game there's still too much too learn about this game to give it a definitive rating.
+ The atmospheric factor. + Presentation of the game - Bit too dicey.
NL: cooperatief horror spel waarbij je samen probeert te voorkomen dat een oermonster wakker wordt. Ondertussen vliegen de engerds je om de oren terwijl je van alles probeert.

item.name: Armorica
item.comment:
Initial rating: Very good card game, slightly low on theme (as most card games) & gamey mechanics but with lots of decisions to make.
When you choose cards to add to your collection you have to watch: - how many cards will stay (amount of aphora) - the amount of different colours in a row (more=better) - gold tokens on cards (1 gold = 1 point) - sheep, olives and grape symbols (majority = 4 points)
So it's quite thinky for such a small short game. I like it. Tentavive rating after 2 plays with 2 & 3 players. Might go up after more plays.

item.name: Army of Frogs
item.comment:
Played 2 3-player games of a prototype version of this.Abstract game, but thanks to the nice froggy playparts and froglike movement it certainly has more "theme" than the average abstract.
But it doesn't feel as brilliantly good as Hive (yet), but at least you can play it with more than two players.
Initial prototype rating: 7 UPDATE: downgraded a point

item.name: Arriala: Canal de Garonne
item.comment: Great short game. Has a lot of depth for a short game like this. Good looking artwork, lots of interaction, interesting decisions. Want to buy this.

item.name: Ascending Empires
item.comment:
Initial thoughts after one play: This would have been a 'must buy' with an 8 rating when the board would have been flat.
But the boardpieces don't lock together good enough, providing an unwanted handicap that make the game way too luck driven. Hence the rating.

item.name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
item.comment: Ok deckbuilder. Not bad, not good. I'd rather play Trains, Core Worlds which are more interactive.

item.name: Asgard's Chosen
item.comment:
Nice variant on a deckbuilder. Have to play more to see if rating goes up or down. Played pretty crappy on my first try. But that goes nicely along with the quality of the components and the artwork....
I actually should rate this one lower, since I feel it's too expensive too what's inside the box. And that lame sticker I have to cut out myself to fix a stupid error annoys me too.
I wish this game was brought out by another publisher.

item.name: Attika
item.comment:
Initial rating: Theme is paperthin, but still an o.k. game.The luck factor in this game is a bit higher than in the average Eurogame, but is good for competetive tension.
You've got to get some small markers ready to note the building that you've played though. Should have been included in the game.

item.name: Automobile
item.comment:
Good game. Rules are relatively easy for a Wallace. Most necessary info is on the board. As usual: quite an interactive game.
The technology development has been translated cleverly into an good boardgame mechanic.

item.name: Avalam
item.comment: Decent abstract.

item.name: The Awful Green Things From Outer Space
item.comment:
New in collection jan. 08 Bought from Lajos.
Despite the fiddly continuous counterswapping this is fun for the right occasion. If you're into 60's SF B-movies, that is. This is probably THE game to play after a long night of SF movies and beer.
NL: 2-persoonsspel. 1 speelt de crew van een ruimteschip, de ander de vreselijke groene dingen. De groene dingen zien de crew uiteraard als voer. De crew heeft een berg wapens, maar de uitwerking op de aliens is pas bekend als je het hebt geprobeerd, en kan nadelig zijn. De beroerdste is dat het monster uiteenspat in kleine stukjes die allemaal blijven leven...
Beetje goedkoop uitgevoerd, maar wel grappig. Thematisch erg sterk.

item.name: Axiom
item.comment:
Great looking 3d abstract for 2. Thinking around the corner is quite difficult! Bought the new rounded version from the designer @ Essen '08.
Erg origineel 3-dimensionaal abstract spel

item.name: Babel
item.comment:
Fun to play if you like to screw the other player. To me this is a nice & nasty 2-player filler wargame... (Usually plays pretty fast)
NL: Klein spel. Als geniepige bouwmeester probeer je als eerste je piramides zo hoog mogelijk te bouwen. Liefst ten koste van je tegenstander. Alleen 2-spelers.

item.name: Backgammon
item.comment:
Seems hugely popular with some people, but not with me. It's been years since I played this. Don't mind if it stays that way.
NL: dit spel uit de oudheid vind ik eigenlijk alleen historisch interessant. Speel het hooguit als puur tijdverdrijf. Liever niet dus.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Baden-Württemberg Catan
item.comment:
I'm f*cking tired of the ridiculous amount of all these Settlers ripoffs/expansions, whatever. Klaus, you're already a millionaire, youcan live with my rating of an unplayed game. Especially if fanboys seem to give a game ridiculously high ratings without having a better clue than I have.
Yes, you can pm me to retract my rating. I'll probably won't react, unless you make good sense to me. I might retract my rating by myself, eventually. Just not now.

item.name: Bakerspeed
item.comment: Fluffy speed filler. We had fun playing it, but it's not something I need to play a lot. I'd probably never ask to play it again.

item.name: Ballonrace
item.comment: Nice nasty filler.

item.name: Ballonrennen
item.comment:
I thought this was the original, more beautiful version of the newer card game Balloon cup...
NL: prachtig uitgevoerd racespel met mooie 3D ballonnen (die op verschillende hoogtes verstelbaar zijn). Gekocht vanwege het uiterlijk.
Te weinig controle, teveel geluk. Wellicht leuk & spannend met kinderen.
item.conditiontext: Complete & good condition. Some light boxwear due to age.

item.name: Baltimore & Ohio
item.comment:
Chicago Express meets 1830. First play with 4 took 4 hours, so pretty good length for a first play for this kinda game.
Great, tense game. All 4 players were excited after this first session.
2nd game I forgot to add money chips. Session took 6 hours with the supplied paper money. Way too bloody long.
I'll only play this again with poker chips and a spreadsheet...

item.name: Bamboleo
item.comment:
If you see this game you want to play it...
NL: Erg mooi behendigheids spel waarbij je blokjes van een "zwevend" plateau moet zien te pakken zonder dat het plateau omvalt.

item.name: Bargain Hunter
item.comment: Fun enough filler.

item.name: Barons
item.comment:
After first plays with 2 and 5: good game! Want to play more. Probably best with 3 or 4 players.
The card mechanics are similar to games like San Juan / Race for the Galaxy etc. But it's a lot less 'multi-player solitaire' so I like it a lot more. If you prefer Glory to Rome to San Juan as well this is a game for you.

item.name: Barricade
item.comment:
Barricade The only reason this is still in my collection is sentimental. It's one of the first games I've ever got. Tried it again a couple of years ago: it's horrible, it just drags along.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment:
New in collection Dec.06 Fun. Still busy learning.
Board & pieces look great. I'm usually not into dice rolling, but I really enjoy this game. In a way it's like the modern day version of what Risk should have been....
Update: years later this is the game of choice for me and a friend when we're the only players of our weekly group. It's fun. Can't see why people are willing to pay so much for it now.
NL: 2-persoons knokspel met legers & monsters in Lord of the Rings sferen. Spannend en strategisch. Waarschuwing: Hierna wil je nooit meer Risk spelen.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment:
Tentative rating after 1 play.
Despite the game being more than 3 hours for this first time (played a bit too slow figuring it out) we all liked it a lot.
Game is now on my to buy list. Guess that says enough.
NL: semi cooperatief spel met een of meerdere verraders in het midden. Spannend en vol valse beschuldigingen.

item.name: Bausack
item.comment:
New in collection may 2008
Dexterity building game with tactics. Fun for the whole family, at a party, and even for non-gamers. "Take that" for real.... If you're into stuff like Pitch Car, check this one out! Loads of fun.
NL: stapelspel met tactiek. Gezellig, spannend, leuk en bij voorkeur gemeen....

item.name: Beep! Beep!
item.comment:
Really short speed filler. Over in 5 minutes...
Fun enough to keep in the collection.

item.name: Bhazum
item.comment:
Small box pure card line 13.
And again John Clowdus has invented a different cardgame with tactical mechanics that seem vaguely familiar, but feel fresh in this form.
Hard to rate right after just one game, but I'd like to play it again to try different tactics.

item.name: Big City
item.comment:
New in collection june 07. Initial rating.Although with drawing the cards of where to build gives the game a luck factor, there's still plenty of strategy and screwage potential in this game.
Game looks great with all those neat buildings! Gives you a variant of your little kids toy excitement of building a city in a mature way...
NL: Mooi uitziend (3d) bouwspel waarbij je gebouwen op zo'n manier plaats dat jij er het meest aan hebt, en ondertussen je tegenstanders dwarszit.

item.name: Big Pirate
item.comment:
Nice semi-cooperative (together against 1 pirate player) kids game. Roll and move with some tactics / choices.
fun to play with kids.

item.name: Bingo
item.comment: This is not a game. Whoever added this to our beloved Geek database should be severely spanked.

item.name: Birds on a Wire
item.comment: Bought at Essen '09. Fun filler cardgame. Cute funny artwork on the cards

item.name: Bisikle
item.comment: My son loves this, and I like to play it with him.

item.name: Bizon: De prairie beeft!
item.comment:
New in collection dec. 07
Nice small box! nice, tight & economic game, good with 2 and 3, and with 4 players if you don't mind a tiny bit of backstabbin chaos.
Not too many rules, but sort of hard too master. Slightly A.P.-prone, as with all Kramer games.
NL: Goed compact spel, duurt ook niet te lang.
Lijkt vreedzaam, maar ondertussen zit je elkaar natuurlijk best dwars, want al die andere indianen zitten verdorie achter jouw kalkoenen en bisons aan!

item.name: Blokus
item.comment:
Nice abstract that looks great when played. Simple but great gameplay. Quick game where tension rises during the game. Lots of fun with 4. Plays fast, no noticable downtime since every action might involve your plans. Can only get a bit A.P. prone towards the endgame with the wrong crowd. ("let's see, where can I still fit this part?")
One of the few multiplayer abstracts that is still nice to play after something longer/difficult/thematic. I guess I prefer this over Ingenious for a quick late-night aftergame.
Rating is only valid for 4 players though, drops at least 3 points for 2 and 3 players.
NL: kort, leuk en snel "landjepik" legspel voor 4-spelers.

item.name: Blokus 3D
item.comment: Nice enough family style abstract game. Blokus 3d.

item.name: Bloqs
item.comment:
In our first testgame we were all glad someone finally picked up the final part from the middle so the game ended. Bad sign.
Nice blocks, but too random & luckdriven.

item.name: Blox
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 play with 3: Tactical game with fairly simple rules. Plays like an abstract, no apparent theme. Unlike most abstract it has quite a luck factor in card draw.
The game looks rather dull & bland in a very boring way, despite the nice feel of the blox, and the original looking partly see-through pawn.
Gameplay isn't too bad, but nothing new either. Best thing is that it plays pretty fast, so there's not much downtime.
Nothing bad, just very mediocre. Might have been great 20 years ago. Wouldn't suggest to bring it on table, but would play if someone wanted to.

item.name: Blue Moon City
item.comment:
New in collection april 07.
Initial rating after one 2-playergame: OK Family style Eurogame. It's a Knizia, so as usual there's absolutely no connection at all between theme and gameplay. Probably not a gamer's game, but still ok to play. Initial game left me a lukewarm, probably more fun with 3 or 4, so rating might go up eventually.
Update: after buying a lot more games that I really like I don't think I can't be bothered too much with another soulless Knizia. Traded away.
NL: Tactisch spel met raar spacethema. Spel zit wel goed in elkaar, maar moet je denk ik met 3 of 4 spelen om het echt spannend te krijgen. Alleen nog maar met 2 gespeeld.

item.name: Bluff im Zoo
item.comment: Fun enough bluff filler. All bluff and metagame, but fun to play with the right players.

item.name: The BoardGameGeek Game
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09. Rules are pretty easy. Nothing too geeky there. Fairly "light" for a Richard Breese game. Somewhere between filler and slightly meaty.
Too bad you lose the theme once you start playing. It's basically just set collecting, despite the nice "shop" and familiar "boardgames", and board details.

item.name: Bobbin' Bumblebee
item.comment:
It looks cute, and basically it's fun. But the build quality is awful: the "arms" don't really fit into the base, the bee isn't sturdy.
In the version I played we found out after the game that the bee couldn't even hit one of the 4 arms honey discs...
Stay far away from this version, and get the original: Looping Louie (Stef Stuntpiloot) which is much better build, and much more fun to play thanks to the looping possibilities (and the possibility of "kids"level play)

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 play. Cardgame, fairly simple rules. Finally played it. With 3. Was fun enough, but is probably a lot more fun with more. If you're into a lot of dealmaking (like in Santiago) combined with a casual fun attitude (will probably be fun in a pub as well) you'll enjoy this one. Social game.
NL: Kaartspel waarbij je probeert zoveel mogelijk dezelfde bonen te verbouwen, want je hebt maar 2 veldjes. Je bent dus continu aan het ruilen en handelen met je tegenstanders om de juiste bonen te krijgen, anders levert je magere oogst je nooit geld op. Leuk voor een potje in kroegsfeer.

item.name: Boom Boom Balloon
item.comment: Fun party activity.

item.name: Boomtown
item.comment:
Why screw your neighbour when you can try to screw everybody?
Great game! Can't understand why it's not more popular.
NL: Erg goed kaartnaaispel. Makkelijke regels, veel pret.

item.name: Brass
item.comment:
My Wallace collection would be lacking without this one I guess...
Great game. One of Wallace's best. I like it better than Age of Industry, despite all the little extra rules. (To me it's like this one is like Steam where Age of Industry is like Railroad Tycoon)

item.name: Brettfußball
item.comment: I don't like the actual sport, so got this as my version of playing "fussball" with people that are football fans. 2-player only. Not so sure after first play that I can get into it.

item.name: Britannia
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09. Might take a while before this one hits the table (long game, needs exactly 4 players I've been told)
Finally played it after almost 5 years (and still not my copy..)
Great asymmetrical game.

item.name: Bruxelles 1893
item.comment:
Man, why is it that all Pearl games I've played so far don't feel intuitive. It's basically all mechanics, and a bit too much of them. Here's another worker placement point salad.
But interactivity is quite good in this game. Since it challenged me a lot more than the usual average Euro worker placement point salad I'd like to try again.

item.name: Buckaroo!
item.comment: Crappy kids toy.

item.name: Bullenparty
item.comment: Decent variant on 6 Nimmt/Take 5

item.name: BurgenLand
item.comment:
Okey dice game that has some tactical possibilities.
Dice usually hate me with these kinda games, so this is not something I pick to play.
Update: gave it away to a fellow geek who had it on his wishlist.

item.name: Busstop: The Boardgame
item.comment: Initial rating: Fun Filler.

item.name: Byzantium
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree Initial rating after 1 play with 3. Great looking Wallace game, first play triggered quite some rules questions, so have to play it again to give a proper rating. Which will then likely go up.
Very interesting game though, the "play for 2 sides" bit gives a special vibe to this game.
NL: Spel van Martin Wallace (Age of Steam, Railroad Tycoon, Struggle of Empires) dat geschikt is voor 2 - 4 spelers. In het oude Byzantium strijdt je om je macht uit te breiden op zowel het Byzantijnse als Arabische front.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree Including grey uzi.... Rating only valid for the right crowd, which is essential. (probably no fun & tension at all with the wrong group)
But if you do play this with the right crowd, this game is a riot. Bring it on!
NL: Je bent een gangster en je komt met de andere gangsters terug naar de schuilplaats om de poet te verdelen. Maar je vangt natuurlijk meer als je die met minder mensen verdeelt, dus bedreig je elkaar tegelijk (met een schuimrubber pistool) in de hoop dat de ander zich terugtrekt.
Na 3 kogels ben je dood, maar je hebt zelf ook maar 3 kogels om 8 rondes te overleven.
Voor de gevorderde speler zijn er individueel verschillende "superkrachten" die het de effectiviteit van je bedreigin danig kunnen beinvloeden.
Briljant hilarisch blufspel. Fantastisch met de juiste mensen.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: les Yakuzas
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree Expansion for Ca$h 'n Guns. Only played once, but with rule mistakes. Enjoyed it anyway.
NL: uitbreiding voor Ca$h 'n Guns. Je kunt nu tot 9 mensen spelen, in 3 teams. Nieuwe wapens, nieuwe "superkrachten", en vooral: nieuwe tactieken.

item.name: Cable Car
item.comment:
New version of Metro.
If it weren't for the slightly less boring shares variant it would get the same low rating. Yawn.

item.name: Caesar & Cleopatra
item.comment:
Only played it twice so far. Not bad, but not exciting either.
2-player only.
Update: after 3 years of not playing this, and not feeling like I want to, downgraded my rating by a point.
(played before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)
Update: Mathtraded away after more years of not playing it.

item.name: Café International
item.comment: NL: makkelijk vlot spel. Internationale bezoekers aan dezelfde tafels in een cafe zien te krijgen.

item.name: Café Melange
item.comment:
Hmmm, not so sure about this one after first play. I like the historical characters. But there seems to be a bit weird difference between theme and kinda take that gameplay and snowball effect. I wonder how much control you really have (at least with 4 players, this one might be better with less players)
First play was sort of enjoyable but left me with a taste of 'not as much control as it seems to suggest'. Well at least it doesn't suck like Ticket to Ride.

item.name: Camel Up
item.comment:
More fun than it ought to be. So far every game has been it's been way more fun than expected. Hence the disturbingly high rating I'm giving it. It's just been very enjoyable to play every time so far (5 times).
Fun 'family style' game. Plays fast enough to not outstay it's welcome.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: Fun if you're in for a filler without wanting too think too much. Very luck dependant. Yet it's more addictive than I'd expect it to be.

item.name: Canal Mania
item.comment: Good game! Age of Steam-lite.

item.name: Canterbury
item.comment: This is one of those games that feels 'ok' after your first game. And then after a while you don't regret not playing it again. Just a bit too 'average' for me I guess.

item.name: Caprice
item.comment: Initial thoughts after one play: I'm always fond of wooden abstracts. But I think this one is just too mediocre.

item.name: Caravelas
item.comment: Good 'family style' game where the theme fits the game. The game looks great and plays fast.
item.conditiontext: Perfect condition. Only played once. Includes the black ship expansion which makes the game better.

item.name: Caravelas: "The Black Ship"
item.comment: Small expansion that can make the game just that little bit meaner.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment:
Why does everybody seem to like this game so much?
To me this game seems to play itself. Even when I win I don't enjoy playing it. Maybe I should try this with more than 2 players? But then the downtime just increases...
Update: my rating seems to drop a point for every play...
NL: populair legspel waar ik geen klap aan vind. Ook niet als ik win, wat ik meestal doe. Extreem saai als je tegenstander lang loopt te twijfelen waar hij/zij het volgende stukje zal neerleggen en jij je dus ondertussen verveelt. Veel mensen vinden 'm blijkbaar leuk, terwijl er -tig betere spellen zijn.
item.conditiontext: Dutch version (999Games)

item.name: Carcassonne - Jagers & Verzamelaars
item.comment:
This variant is as boring as the original. I only ever play this when somebody else really wants to...
UPDATE: given away.
NL: zie mijn commentaar bij de gewone Carcassone. Geen haar beter. Thema is nu oertijd. Had net zo goed iets anders kunnen zijn. Spel weggegeven.

item.name: Carcassonne - Koning & Verkenner
item.comment: Uhm, yeah. So what?

item.name: Carolus Magnus
item.comment:
New in collection april 07 After first 3 plays: Nice game mechanism, feels different. I wonder if this one will "stay" (after a couple of plays I got rid of Clans from the same designer) For now the luck of the dice seems to be too big, so next time I'll try the variant posted here.
NL: Vlot te spelen tactisch spel met geluksfactor. Zit leuk in elkaar, weet alleen nog niet oftie ook na vaak spelen leuk blijft. Wil 'm wel eens met 3 of 4 proberen.

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment:
This is a real nice game to play with people that are "really not so much in to games". It turned a couple of my friends around to active gameplayers.
Not a "gamer's game" but usually good for a nice intermezzo.
Also quite easy to take along on holiday or to a bar, one elastic band around the boardparts, one around the cards and it fits into a big pocket.
Lightweight, but usually still tense enough & usually quite fun to play.
NL: Vlot, leuk & makkelijk uit te leggen voor 2-5 spelers. Dit is het spel wat dat vreselijke "Mens erger je niet" had moeten zijn. De "open" variant is nog aardig taktisch ook. Ook leuk spel voor beginners.

item.name: Castle
item.comment: Sold this one after a couple of plays. Not my kinda game. Just not that much fun. Quality of bits below average.

item.name: CATAN 3D Collector's Edition
item.comment:
Screwage turnaround.
This nonsensical rating will be removed as soon as the nonsensical decision to split this game from the regular version is revised.
No, it doesn't matter expansions are added. It doesn't matter this is a 'deluxe' edition with 3d tiles. An expensive marble set of chess is the same game as a cheap set of set. Or a Donald Duck version of chess. There is a versions system for these subtleties.

item.name: Cathedral
item.comment:
Got the plastic version. Fast short abstract.
Looks nice. Good enough to pull out every now and then.

item.name: The Cave
item.comment:
OK game. But I prefer K2 (and Drako) to this 'Tikal meets Lost Valley'.
Was fun to play once, but don't need it in my collection. I doubt if it got played again.
Just like Tikal and other action point games: not for the A.P. prone, because you'll spend some time counting how far you can reach, and if you can get to the base camp in enought turns.

item.name: Cave Evil
item.comment: Played a game with designer Nate at Spiel 2011. Liked it, even although I lost. Just not the kinda game my usual crowd would play, otherwise I'd have bought it...

item.name: Caylus
item.comment:
New in collection april 07. Initial rating after 1 play: since I like these kind of "various paths to victory" eurogames (Puerto Rico, Goa etc.), this one will definitely get more gameplay if I find enough players I can guide to all the various rules (without showing them the butt-ugly boxcover).
After 3 plays: mmm, not so great as I thought it would be. Okay game though.
Update march 2015: sold it. Didn't have any intention to revisit this. To me it has become 'just another euro'.
NL: Caylus is zo'n spel waarbij je elke keer weer meer keuzes zou willen maken dan je mag. En je hebt altijd te weinig geld. Zoals er zoveel spellen zijn.

item.name: Celestia
item.comment: Nice filler. Enough tension, nice amount of bluff. Decent amount of luck. Plays quite like Diamant, but with more game in it. Nice artwork.

item.name: Change Horses
item.comment:
OK family style filler. Nothing really special, but it looks good enough and has enough interactivity. And thanks to the 'hidden' information (who want's which horse to be last) it's good for some fun.
Plays fast enough too. And although it's basically abstract I think the horsies are fun playing pieces.

item.name: Chase
item.comment:
Print & play version. feb 07
Have to learn this one a bit better to improve tactics. Feels a bit too random at this point. Rating might increase though.
NL: soort dammen/schaken met dobbelstenen, waarbij de waardes van de stenen het aantal zetten bepalen wat je er mee kunt doen. Ben er nog niet uit of het een diep strategisch spel of gewoon een leuk tactisch tussendoortje is.

item.name: Cheesy Gonzola
item.comment:
Adds some stuff to Chateau Roquefort: a 5th player, the cheesy Gonzalez figure, and some extra tiles. Interesting stuff that makes the game more interesting for kids that are a little older.
The most essential bit from this expansion is the box: finally you can store all the stuff you need to play the basic game in this expansion box. Saves a lot of setup time.
You really want this expansion if you own the basic game.
NL: uitbreiding voor Kaaskasteel.

item.name: Chez Geek
item.comment:
30-6-07 present, looks fun, but definitely needs to be played in the right mood. After initial first 2 plays: more fun than anticipated. Fun might wear off, but as you get to know the cards better, the playing speed increases considerably, so that might compensate for it.
Definitely a "take that" game. Better with beer. Rating is conservatively low, might go up if the next games are still fun.
NL: leuk kaartspel voor minimaal 4 spelers en minimaal een kratje bier. Niet spelen als je geen Engels beheerst. Moet een beetje vlot gespeeld worden, dan wordt het behoorlijk grappig.

item.name: Chicago Express
item.comment:
I really like this game, I'd love to play it more often.
Easy rules, fast gameplay, 'deep' game. That's the best way for getting gamer games like this actually on the table. The only reason I don't play this more often is because I own sibling American Rails which is even superior.
In a way this game in the same vein as Steel Driver. Despite having similar principles (players are shareholders, companies can extend thanks to the money the shareholders paid for their shares) it's quite different in gameplay.

item.name: China Topf
item.comment: Fun kids dexterity game. Usual good Haba quality. Reasonably fun with adults as well. Rating: 8 for kids, 6 for adults. Looking for a copy.

item.name: Chinatown
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 play with 4: what a blast!
If you're into negotiating games, this should be high on your want-list if you don't own it yet. Bought the reissue immediately after first play. Easy rules, explained in a minute. Enough depth to be a gamers game though. And Tons of Fun. Rating WILL go up if it stays this good after multiple plays.
NL: Onderhandelspel voor 4 of 5 spelers. Wie is de meest gehaaide Chinese centensleurder door zaken op te bouwen of te verhandelen. Waarbij eigenlijk alles wel onderhandelbaar is. Geweldig leuk met de juiste mensen.

item.name: Circus Train (First Edition)
item.comment:
Initial rating after two plays, one solo, one two player:
Optimization game with luck factor. I'm not yet sure whether I'm going to really like this or not so much.
I had fun with my soloplay, and I enjoyed my 2-player as well. But my wife remarked she didn't enjoy it that much, since the luck factor seems to be pretty high where stuff shows up, and you're basically running (ehr 'training'?) around chasing the best bits. She might be right, not sure yet.
It's thematically allright, and the mechanism of wages makes it harder.

item.name: Cité
item.comment:
Initial rating after one game: This game felt better than I expected it to be. Maybe it's the various 'realistic' resources. Yes, I like those 'cumbersome' pieces of cloth.
Good euro. Possible buy. I like the open trade possibilities. Not to be played with players that 'don't wanna trade' or play the friendly 'trade one for one' way in Settlers of Catan, because then it will become the same kinda multiplayer solitaire Settlers is with those kinda players.
One complaint: can somebody please slap that graphic designer for putting the English bits on the player aids in the same colour as the background? Are you mad? Who wants to read darker yellow on lighter yellow or darker green on lighter green?

item.name: La Città
item.comment:
Even after quite some years and quite some plays, I still like this game a lot. Choices, choices...
There should be an easier way of marking how many civilians and food you have. Counting them every round is not so satisfying.
Klassieker. Fantastisch spel, zitten wel veel priegelburgertjes in die je elke ronde telt....

item.name: The City
item.comment:
I wanted to buy this game after one play, so I guess I like it.
Fast enough to be deemed 'quick filler' but decent enough gameplay to count as a 'real game'. thumbs up bang for the buck factor.
I actually think I prefer this to San Juan and Race for the Galaxy: it's as multiplayer solitaire as both of them, but it's so much quicker to play that I don't get bothered as much by it. Less rules as well. One of those 'let's concentrate on individual races to see who's the quickest' games. But this one is pretty fast, so it's over before you're bored.

item.name: City Tycoon
item.comment: Initial rating after one play: more fun than I expected. Rating might go up after multiple plays. Might buy this.

item.name: Civilization
item.comment:
Great game. Only disadvantage is getting 5/6 players willing to play it all day long... I guess it's gonna take a while before this classic gets played again. (Finding a mint unpunched version was irresistable.)
NL: Lang spel waarin elke speler een beschaving opbouwt. Bij voorkeur met minimaal 4 spelers te doen (liefst 7) die een regenachtige zondag over hebben.

item.name: Clans
item.comment: After first play: ooh joy, this seems original. After couple more plays: mmm, every game feels the same. The "original" we-all-play-the-same-colours factor looses it's shine.After even more plays: this game plays itself. Traded. Gameplay really seemed original and fun at first, but gameplay feels too random after a while.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.comment:
Yes, it is similar to like Space Hulk. And yes it scratches that itch better. I think there is way more 'game' in this than in Space Hulk.
UPDATE: after playing this game more than 10 times I like it better with every play. Improved my rating.
Anyone reading this can make me a decent offer on my 3rd edition Space Hulk still in shrink (I played other people's copies twice) I'll probably don't need it anymore.

item.name: Claustrophobia: De Profundis
item.comment: Good expansion. More stuff to do, more scenarios.

item.name: Coconuts
item.comment: Simple dexterity game, but one that's really fun to play.

item.name: Coda
item.comment:
Mediocre filler, mainly stayed in it's box after a couple of plays. Player with the best lucky guess usually wins. Yawn.
Here in Holland it's called "Da Vinci Code". Since it has nothing to do with either the book or the movie I consider this as a very unhealthy commercial move. Which is why I downgraded my rating by 1 point for unappropriate tacked on theme.
july 07 Update: gave it away.

item.name: Cold War: CIA vs KGB
item.comment: Okeyish card game. Takes too long for what it is though.

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment: Decent card game. Better than the big box Zooloretto that only adds fluff, shelfspace and gamelength.

item.name: Colossal Arena
item.comment: NL: Gokken & knokken.

item.name: Colt Express
item.comment: Fun filler

item.name: Concordia
item.comment:
Although the theme isn't really strong in this game I enjoyed the gameplay a lot in my first play.
Rules are pretty straighforward, no little exceptions, but still enough opportunities to try out various tactics & strategies. And the outcome of the game WILL be determined a lot by the way people are playing it, there's room enough for the 'groupthink' metagame, which I like.
Made it to my 'consider buying it' list after one play.

item.name: Confucius
item.comment:
Initial rating: subtle and diverse game, with loads of stuff to do and good interaction. Similar to Martin Wallace games in a way. Good game with some original mechanisms!
NL: Goed spel waarbij je op subtiele wijze probeert jouw "familie" de beste te laten zijn qua machtsinvloed.

item.name: Confusion: Espionage and Deception in the Cold War
item.comment:
Stratego done right...
Beautifully made, good 'old-style' game. Easy rules, good playtime/tension ratio (not too long, not too short)

item.name: Conquest of Paradise
item.comment:
Initial rating, only played it once yet. I really like the way the tension builds: first everyone is happily exploring. But after a while you feel an urge to start a war with your neighbours, because otherwise it might get hard to win the game.
I like the separate designers notebook with all the additional background info.
NL: pittig spel waarbij je in Polynesia je stam probeert uit te breiden door in bootjes eilanden te ontdekken, en in een later stadium je buurman te lijf te gaan...

item.name: Conquistador
item.comment:
Initial rating after one play. Probably will go up.
It's funny to see how quite a couple of the same mechanics from El Grande offer such a different feel. Nice game, only played the basic version, curious about the "advanced" game.
NL: de "opvolger" van El Grande van dezelfde makers.

item.name: Container
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree. Version with wooden AND plastic containers
Initial rating after 1 3-player & 1 5-player game: Very interactive economic game. Need to play this a lot more to find out the various strategies.
UPDATE after 4 plays: raised my rating half a point. But only for 5 (or minimal 4) players. Still can't seem to get a grip on this game, but I like it anyway. Very interactive.
NL: wow, dit is anders! Je maakt spullen die je aan anderen te koop biedt, de spullen die je van anderen koopt biedt je weer te koop aan om te verschepen, en de spullen die jij weer gekocht hebt en verscheept biedt je weer te koop aan op de eindbestemming. Na 2x spelen wil ik 'm erg graag weer doen om te kijken wat voor strategien je er op los kunt laten.
Mooi vormgegeven op een moderne en toch ouderwetse manier.

item.name: Container: The Second Shipment
item.comment: Makes the original game longer but with even more options. Nice addition.

item.name: Coolympics
item.comment:
on loan from Michael & Audrey.
Pretty mediocre kids game. Roll & move combined with a little dexterity. Easy with 2, a lot harder with 3, probably too frustrating with 4.

item.name: Core Worlds
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 play. Race for the galaxy meets.... (well, I've never played Dominion because I'm not interested in it)
this game definitely has more interaction than Race for the Galaxy, and not so much shuffling as I'm told Dominion has.
Good deckbuilding game. I like it

item.name: Coup
item.comment: Great little bluffing filler.

item.name: Court of the Medici
item.comment: Not sure what to think of this yet. Usually a bad sign after 3 plays. Need to play again.

item.name: CO₂
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 session. I like this game, upgraded it to my wishlist from my 'try before buy' list. Rating will probably go up after multiple plays.
I can see why this game isn't for everyone: it's hard to get a real feeling of control. In that way I can see why people compare it to Container (a game which I also enjoy a lot).
Love the theme. In a way it's comparable to real life: everybody knows somethings happening, but we're not really doing our utmost best to counter effects, since we're all going for our own goals.

item.name: Crazy Creatures of Dr. Doom
item.comment: Short filler. Nothing special

item.name: Croc!
item.comment: My son likes this. And I like to play it with him. Some fun to be had with adults as well.

item.name: Crokinole
item.comment:
Great dexterity game. Would love to have it, if the boards weren't so expensive.
UPDATE: bought a 'cheap' board from Mayday. Quality not too good, but at least I got my own board now.

item.name: Cronberg
item.comment:
Free print, cut & play version. Played twice with 2 players. Won't likely play this again: Quite one dimensional game, pretty boring and below average. I don't give extra rating points for free games, especially not for this one because I'd never buy this anyway.
UPDATE: Threw it away in the trash. Felt good about it.
item.conditiontext: Print 'n Play version: if you want it, you can HAVE it. Could come as a free extra in a trade.

item.name: Cuba
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Great looking worker placement Eurogame. Initial rating: Good fun, better than Pillars of the Earth.
NL: Uit de categorie "zoveel mogelijkheden, maar zo weinig keuzes". Beter dan De Kathedraal.

item.name: Cubiko
item.comment:
This is a very silly & stupid game. Great fun if you're into silly & funny games, otherwise not so...
Can be a riot at the right time. Basically it's a sort of Yahtzee with a healthy dose of ridiculousness added.

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: Good game, nice minis & artwork. It's quite possible that it drags along too long with players that are too eager or attentive.

item.name: D'r Af
item.comment:
Early Splotter racing game. Way less fiddly than their later games, but already with that "weird Splotter twist". This is probably their variant of "fun filler game". I like it.
NL: maf racespel waarbij de spelduur afhankelijk is van de lengte van de tafel waar je op speelt. De bedoeling is om als eerste van de tafel af te racen. Yup.
Ondertussen zit je elkaar dwars door allerlei narigheid in te zetten in de per beurt te bouwen route.

item.name: Dammen
item.comment:
Haven't played this in ages, and don't feel the urge...
NL: Dammen. Tja. Heb zoveel leukere/betere abstracte spellen in mijn collectie dat ik deze niet zonodig hoef te spelen.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Dampfross
item.comment: Although this is basic a fun game, it hasn't aged too well. The first half of the game runs along nice & smooth, but the second half can get a bit tedious when you keep rollin' cities that are already out of the game.

item.name: Darwinci
item.comment:
Basically an abstract game. Bones could have been anything (roads, waterways whatever)
I don't understand why there's no cheatcheats standard with this game.
I'm doubtfull if gameplay improves with multiple play. Bit meh.

item.name: Das Zepter von Zavandor
item.comment:
New in collection sept 07. Nice surprise gift from a familiar vendor to make up for some missing communication after a fault in a previous bought game.
Economic game with a fantasy theme. Weird combination. Rulebook from hell.
I had the first German edition that needs lots of paste ups and helping printouts (to solve errors).
No wonder it took more than a year to hit the table. It's a bit of a miracle I got to play it at all. Took (too) much time to get that 1st game going. Game itself is ok though. I might even say 'good' if the theme fitted the game, which it doesn't, and if the game was shorter. I don't mind long games, but for the length this takes there are a lot of games that deliver more.
UPDATE: Traded away, bought the original (Outpost)
NL: Als leerling tovenaar probeer je op allerlei vlakken vooruit te komen. Puur economisch spel in een ander jasje. Zit wel goed in elkaar.

item.name: De Bezeten Fles
item.comment:
De Bezeten Fles. Fairly ok little filler. Probably works best with beer & pretzels. And I would probably rate this one higher I my girlfriend liked this one as well, or if i find other people to play this with.
I can imagine this one can get tense with the right group.
Update: not too much beer with the pretzels though, otherwise you'll mess around with the amount of cards that get traded & changed all the time.
NL: kaartspel, waarbij je slagen moet halen. Maar degene die slag haalt krijgt ook de fles, en je wilt absoluut niet als laatste blijven zitten met die duvelse fles!

item.name: De Kathedraal
item.comment:
De Kathedraal. Great looking game. But after 4 plays I don't have the urge to play it again. Rating will probably go down even more eventually? "Game plays itself a bit too much" if you're a gamesnob.
UPDATE: Traded away after 4 plays...
NL: mooi uitgevoerd bordspel waarbij de spelers gezamenlijk een kathedraal bouwen. En uiteraard gaat het erom dat jij daar meer aan bijdraagt dan de anderen.
item.conditiontext:
Game has only been played 4 times. Good condition, no boxwear, stains or whatever. Looks like new.
Dutch 999 version. Game comes with the (German) extra cards from Spielbox.
UPDATE: Traded away.

item.name: De Kolonisten van Catan - Steden & Ridders (uitbreidingsset voor 5 of 6 spelers)
item.comment:
And again: this should have been in the original Cities & Knights box for the price tag of the original expansion. Klaus has ripped me off...
NL: voor als je echt tijd over hebt, kun je Kolonisten: steden & ridders ook met 5 en 6 spelers doen. Lagere waardering omdat ik er niet meer zo voor te porren ben om 3 uur over dit spel te doen...
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Deep Sea Adventure
item.comment: Very enjoyable filler. Simple rules, loads of fun. Backstabbing opportunities.

item.name: Defenders of the Realm
item.comment: Interesting coop with fantasy battle theme. Apparently light rulewise, but hard to win.

item.name: Deluxe Camping
item.comment:
Go camping! Fun & fast screw your neighbour game. Great filler game. Most strategic with 2, best with 3, and most chaotic fun with 4.
I love the thematic approach of this nasty area majority. Just make sure the asshole stays with your neighbours and score the pool...
NL: Wie pikt het asociaalst de mooiste en grootste plekjes in op de camping. Schijt aan de buren!

item.name: Demarrage
item.comment:
Demarrage / Homas Tours
New in collection jan. 08 Bought from Lajos.
Initial rating: Nice game. Might be the best roll and move around thanks to the follow rules, the various roads etc. Family fun.
NL: Wielerspel. Leuk om te doen als alternatief voor Tour de France kijken...
item.conditiontext:
Original rare Homas tours version for trade for rare or out of print game. Check my wishlist.
Complete, some boxwear, nothing unusual for a played copy of this age (1979)

item.name: Der Untergang von Pompeji
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Initial rating after 1 2-player game. Fun game if you enjoy tossing other's civilians into the vulcano...
Update after some more games: easy rules, still fun. It feels almost as light as a filler, but it's that's more fun than your average filler, and the tactics versus luck ratio works for me. Rating goes up... Goes down well with every one I played it with so far. People love to toss meeple into the volcano.
Nice short playing time as well.
Update after half a year: This one hits the table more often than expected of such a relatively "light filler". It's simple, but with plenty of tension. The good thing is that the second part is the fun part with lots of tension.
NL: Probeer zoveel mogelijk van je eigen burgers te redden voordat Pompeii onder de lava bedolven wordt. (Fase 1: zoveel mogelijk poppetjes op het bord brengen. Fase 2: ren voor je leven!)
item.conditiontext: Got a spare German copy new in shrink.

item.name: Di Renjie
item.comment: Deduction card game that plays different than other deduction games. Probably best with 3 or 4 players, maybe even with 2. 6 players is definitely too much. Rating with 6: max 6 (probably less actually..)

item.name: Diamant
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree Initial rating: Nice little "push your luck" filler. Fun if you're into that. Fast gameplay, good for starters or just a quick game. Definitely not a gamer's game, but good in bigger groups, the more the merrier, and the harder it gets to win on tactics...
Update after lots of plays: this one is definitely a winner with "non-gamers".
NL: Jij en je medespelers zijn op diamantjacht in de mijnen. Neem je je buit mee terug omhoog voordat de mijn instort of durf je die diamant die verderop ligt ook nog even mee te nemen?
Uitgelegd in 1 minuut, gespeeld in minder dan 15 en toch spannend.

item.name: Die 3 Gebote
item.comment:
This game is WAY more fun than Flussfieber!
You have to have the right kind of people for this though, it's definitely a party game best played in a loose atmosphere (friends, beer). And for non-native speakers: they need to understand the German text on the cards... Brilliantly simple, brilliantly fun.
UPDATE: bought the English version as well in oct. 13 to get it played more....
NL: Maf spel van Friedeman Friese (Funkenschlag/Foute Vrienden) en de Lamont broers (Shear Panic/Antler Island), waarbij je om de beurt een hogepriester bent, en de andere spelers als "leerlingen" de juiste rituelen moeten zien te ontdekken. Erg leuk met de juiste mensen. Dikke pret met 4 of meer spelers.

item.name: Die Aufsteiger
item.comment:
Nice game! Beautiful colourful wooden pieces. Good fun for casual gamers as well. Different enough for gamers to feel fresh and engaging.
Easy rules, short enough to be played as a filler, and deep enough too really enjoy as a gamer's game.
NL: mooi houten spel met blokkies. De bedoeling is om met je poppetje als hoogste te eindigen. In je beurt klim je met je ventje, en je mag max. 1 blokje verplaatsen. Je hebt 3 eenmalige hulpmiddelen: 2 ladders (1x kort, 1 x lang) en een "reserveringsblokje" voor je volgende beurt. Lastig EN erg leuk!

item.name: Die Siedler von Catan - Seefahrer Erweiterung
item.comment:
Kolonisten van Catan: de Zeevaarders Doesn't add much to the original. Way too expensive too (I have the 5-6 player expansion as well, which should have been included at this price)
Better spend your money on the Cities and Knight expansion (which really adds depth to the gameplay) or on a different game altogether.
Only reason I haven't sold it: I'm waiting on a friend of me who is willing to play both this and the Cities and Knights expansion, which could be fun.
NL: ben nooit echt fan geworden van deze Zeevaarders uitbreiding voor Kolonisten. Wil 'm nog wel een keer proberen in combinatie met Steden en Ridders.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Dinosaur Chess
item.comment:
Paid way to much for this thanks to transport cost, taxes and such, but at least I got another unique game...
Only played it once yet, but liked it.

item.name: Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment:
Played (and won!) a late prototype with 'final' wooden playing pieces, but no card artwork yet. (april '11)
Play was promising. Quite a lot of interaction, as usual with a Wallace game. I like the (guessing of) the various roles with different win conditions. There is definitely a luck factor with the disaster cards going on, but nothing too extreme.
The demons and trolls should get a more prominent role though, they never got in the game. (And we all wondered if it would have mattered at all.
Rating is for prototype version, will be upgraded if the 'neutral player parts' get a better role.
Update: bought the collectors edition. Plays good and still pretty fast with 4.

item.name: Disgrace & Favours
item.comment: Nice idea for a game, but it doesn's seem to work so well. The cards look nice enough, and we had fun reading the flavor text. But playing the game (4-player session, which should be good) wasn't as much fun as it should be with this kinda filler. And for some reason I'm just as succesfull (which means barely) when selecting a number as when I'm random rolling. Not a good sign.

item.name: Dive! Diver! Die!
item.comment: Sort of a cross of a party game, bluffing game and some dice throwing for results. Not bad, can probably be loads of fun with the right people. Didn't feel to urge to buy it though.

item.name: Divine Right
item.comment: Too long for what it is. Gameplay is too luck ridden, and storyline not captivating enough for the gamelength.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment: It's actually better than I expected from a 'Spiel des Jahres'. Gets the imagination going. Might even pick this up if found for dirtcheap. But probably not.

item.name: Dixit Quest
item.comment: More of the same.

item.name: Dobble
item.comment: Speed recognition game my son selected for me. I like to play it with him.

item.name: Dogs Do
item.comment:
Print 'n Play. Downloaded and played on the day we had to put our dear dog to rest. So we played it to remember her.
Nice thematic game for a print 'n play.

item.name: Dominant Species
item.comment:
Initial rating: Brilliant but tough game.
Rating will likely go up. If I manage to play it more. Takes longer than 180 minutes though. Our 5-player session lasted several hours.
Was already on buylist, stays there after play.
UPDATE: bought it. Just had to have it.

item.name: Doodle City
item.comment: Very lite dice filler. It's better than Yahtzee since it has the illusion of tactics.

item.name: Het Dorp
item.comment:
After 1 test session and 1 3-player session I already think I like it a lot more than Stone Age.
Although it's basically your average Euro worker placement cubepusher there is at least a hint of theme. And the choices don't always seem to obvious.
The 'aging' part adds a nice bit of variety.

item.name: Dos Rios
item.comment:
New in collection jan. 08 Bought from Lajos.
Nice concept & different gameplay. Although it's definitely a euro it feels different to the most euro's. Very underrated here, if you're into the 'screw your neighbour and everyone else' game this one should be on your radar if it's not already in your collection... Works fine with 2 too. Don't play it with 4 unless you're in for some chaos. The only time I played it with 4 the game ran too long and we used up all the dams 2 whole turns before the game ended....
NL: Erg leuk spel waarbij je probeert in een landschap te oogsten van vruchtbare landschappen. Landschappen zijn alleen vruchtbaar als 1 van de 2 rivieren erg langs loopt. Maar gelukkig kun je de loop van de rivieren beinvloeden met dammen. En eventueel je tegenstanders wegjagen...
Goed spel, leuk vormgegeven in een steeds wisselend bord.

item.name: Dr. Shark
item.comment:
Fun filler / party game. Original 'feel' concepts.
Nice to have played once.

item.name: Draco
item.comment:
Good looking dexterity game. Fun, but takes a little too long if you're unexperienced with it. And it's probably not the game you want to play so often you'll be really good at it. But it's nice enough to have in my collection.
Small box that's still at least 2 times too big. Components fit into a bag that could be taken along in a small bag.

item.name: Drako
item.comment:
Another winner from Adam Kaluzo. (K2 was my 'family game of the year' in 2010.)
When I read the rules I thought that Drako had some similar mechanism to K2: it's card driven, this time you start with a choice out of 4 cards.
But the gameplay is quite different. I like the assymmetricallity of the 3 dwarves versus the dragon. The game is very tense, and the theme comes across.
Oh and the game looks great too, there's plenty of detail on the dragon and the 3 different dwarves miniatures.

item.name: Der dreizehnte Holzwurm
item.comment: Another nifty cardgame from Herr Kramer.

item.name: DruidenWalzer
item.comment: Nice little tactical brainburner. Might be the most 'thinky' one of the 2 player Kosmos range. I like it.

item.name: Drum Roll
item.comment: Don't understand the fuzz about this one. It's just another one of those cube pushing worker placement game to me.

item.name: Duck Dealer
item.comment:
Luckily I was early enough @ Essen... And I'm glad to have found out it's worth the money!
Another brainbreaker in the Splotter tradition. Loads of stuff, lots to think about, so many possibilities... (The amount of chits is comparable with Antiquity)
Moaners will probably call it multiplayer solitaire, but I have to disagree: there's lot's of tension thanks to a constant urge to try to be the first to gain the big trade bonuses.
This game makes your brain hurt though, but in a good way...
The theme is ridiculous. But funny. I don't mind playing a twisted universe in which rubber duckies and blue paint are basic materials.
Just like any other Splotter game: NOT a game you should play with A.P. prone people. So far I played a couple of 2-player games in about 2 hours. Would like to play it with more so I'd have a little bit more time to think in between turns...
NL: Pittig economisch spel waarbij je continu op zoek bent naar gunstige routes en per beurt OF energie opspaart OF uitgeeft. Maar als je te lang wacht gaan je tegenspelers met de grote bonusbuiten aan de haal.

item.name: Duel in the Dark
item.comment:
Great looking game. It's the game in my collection about which I said: "no, no, I really won't become a weird beirdy wargamer. Look, it's got nice little 3d planes & clouds & all, no clipped chips anywhere"
Anyway, fun light wargame. Which is weird to say about a wargame...
NL: 2-persoons WWII luchtgevecht spel. Engelsen proberen een bombardement op Duitse grond. Prachtig uitgevoerd spel. Ook in je eentje te spelen.

item.name: Dune
item.comment:
New in collection sept 07. French version This is a great game. Get it if you can. Tension, strategics, diplomacy, it's all there.
NL: Gewilde klassieker, helaas niet meer te krijgen. Erg goed spel, met name qua interactie, wan- en vertrouwen.

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09.
Even though my first play didn't go that well (I only managed to score 1 measly point in the end), we all had great fun playing this game, meanwhile looking up the rules and all.
This is not a family style game even though the art might seem "cute". It's a hard game, that's not so easy, but full of atmosphere. It's really a must buy for everyone who liked the PC game Dungeon Keeper way back when. Can't wait to play it again.

item.name: Dungeon Lords: Festival Season
item.comment:
This expansion makes a 2 hour game into a 3 hour game. All the new stuff is neat, but basically if I have 4 players that are willing to play a 3 hour game I have plenty of games that I´d rather play.
This expansion just makes the game too long. Only for die hard Dungeon Lord fans. I thought it was nice to play once, but really don´t need to play again.

item.name: Dungeon Petz
item.comment:
Great looking worker placement game. Lots of stuff, various things to do. Nice game, if you can remember all the stuff. And like Dungeon Lords: Not the kinda game I'd play very often (partly due to setup time & explanation time)
I can see why this game showed up cheap in Essen one year after it's release. I don't really want to own it either, probably wouldn't get played at all.

item.name: Dungeon Run
item.comment:
Simple but fun. Works solo, but you can only play the first half of the game that way, and the most fun is the second part.
When played with more the game can drag quite a bit. I basically had fun playing this, but for the amount of fun this game takes too long (unless you really manage to play it in 60 minutes, which I have a hard time believing is possible).

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment: Fun medium/light battling in a dungeon coop. Despite luck factor the first D&D product I considered to buy. Fun tension.

item.name: Durch die Wüste
item.comment:
New in collection april 07 Nice looking 3d abstract with camels. As usual with a good Knizia game there are many things too keep in mind. Fairly easy rules, fun & fast to play.
Don't be fooled by the Go comparison, because in the end the amount of land is worth less than the oasis and color points. Better game with 3 players than with 2.
NL: Go met pastelkleurige kamelen? Daar lijkt het een beetje op, maar toch heel anders. Ook leuk met 2.

item.name: DVONN
item.comment:
First game I bought in the Gipf series. Nice brainteasing Othello with a twist. Liked it so much that I eventually bought the whole series..
NL: Goed strategisch/tactisch abstract spel voor 2 spelers. Heb inmiddels de hele Gipf-reeks gekocht waar dit er 1 van is.

item.name: Eat Me, If You Can.
item.comment:
Another one of these 'how much game can we get out of few components' the Japanese seem to excel at lately.
This is quite light 'I'll think he'll think that I'll think' stuff. Which can be fun with the right players, but it's more about the metagame than the actual game itself.

item.name: Eaten by Zombies!
item.comment: Fun Ameritrash. Well, if zombies are fun, that is.

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: Made it instantly to my 'want to buy' list after one game.

item.name: Egelrace
item.comment:
Egelrace - New in collection june 2008
Easy family style game, works better with more than 2. It's one of the simplest "Frank & Doris" game I have, good as a short "take that" filler. Mix of luck & tactics.
NL: soort "egel-erger-je-niet" race waarbij je elkaar niet eruit gooit, maar jouw egels bij voorkeur op die van anderen zet (zodat alleen jouw egels bewogen worden), en je andermans egels alleen vooruit wilt zetten als ze daarmee in een valkuil lazeren. Leuk tussendoortje. Vast ook leuk voor kids vanaf een jaar of 7.

item.name: Eiertanz
item.comment:
Eiertanz. New in collection may 2008
Fun kids dexterity game. Probably hilarious with drunk adults also.
NL: eierdans. Maf spel met rubberen eieren die je in je elleboog/nek/onder je kin/tussen je knieen moet zien vast te houden als je ze bemachtigd hebt... Behalve leuk voor kids ongetwijfeld hilarisch met de juiste club volwassenen.

item.name: Elfenland
item.comment: Played it two or three times. Years ago. Haven't missed it. Not a bad game, would play again if someone asked me to.

item.name: Elfer raus!
item.comment:
Mindlessly boring card game. Probably only useful if you're having a big hangover with boring company.
NL: Soort Patiencen voor meer spelers. Snap niet dat dit een populair spel in Duitsland schijnt te zijn.
Update: found out this game is lost after I had tried to trade it away. I'm wondering if it will turn up again.
item.conditiontext: Only played once or twice. As new.

item.name: Elk Fest
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09
Fun short dexterity game. Probably a lot of fun with kids too.

item.name: Emerald
item.comment:
New in collection july 08
Neat race & collect game with a dragon (and your opponents) as enemy.
Probably great fun with kids.

item.name: Eminent Domain
item.comment:
Race for the Galaxy in deckbuilding style. Just like RftG the artwork is nice and the interaction is quite low...
Towards the end the very low level of interaction get's raised (you start noticing individual advantages more and more), which is a plus. But it should have been that way earlier in the game.
Was nice to play it once. Wouldn't mind playing it again, but it didn't manage to get on my wish/buy/tradelist. I have a feeling that the replayability isn't high enough too.
If you want a more interactive deckbuilder with a S.F. theme: get Core Worlds.

item.name: En Garde
item.comment:
Played the new version at the Ducosim fair. Really feels like a duel.
Bought the original version. Small box & lot cheaper.
The new version looks gorgeous, but the stairs don't seem to stay in place good enough (can you actually place your dualeer on step nr. 1 without letting it fall off?) And it's a bit much for what the game actually is.
If you'r not so lazy as I am: The print 'n play version here in the files section will do just fine.

item.name: The End of the Triumvirate
item.comment:
This is the next step up for eurogamers: more theme, plenty of interaction, turn-angst, decisions, various possible strategies.
And still playable in about 90 minutes, rulewise fairly easy, so it's easy to get it on the table. Thumbs up!

item.name: Endeavor
item.comment: OK euro. Need to play again to see if initial rating goes up or down.

item.name: Entdecker
item.comment:
Initial rating: ok family game.
NL: "ontdekkings" tegellegspel voor 3-4 spelers van de maker van Kolonisten, dus niet heel ingewikkeld.

item.name: Erosion
item.comment:
Bought at Essen 2009
Initial rating after 1 play: man, finally a short Sierra Madre game. And it's not so hard to understand either.
I like this game that's tiny enough to fit in your pocket

item.name: Eruption
item.comment: This light 'take that' game is better than the average in the same category. The theme is tangible, the luck factor by drawing cards and tiles is pretty high, but it's enjoyable nevertheless. Actually, this game is more fun than it should be... Quite a feat.

item.name: Esels-Rennen
item.comment:
Funny family game with supercute donkeys. I have a weak spot for Doris & Frank games, and like this one.
Probably fun with kids too. It has a similar feel to Egelrace, but you have less sense of control, which works good with the stubborn donkey theme.
Nice inbetweenie, was glad to find a brandnew one at the Doris & Frank stand at Essen '08!
NL: leuk familiespel met schattige ezeltjes. Je moet ervoor zorgen dat ezels aankomen in de volgorde zoals ze op jouw geheime kaartje staan. Maar da's best lastig, want die stomme beesten gaan om de haverklap stilstaan.

item.name: Eurorails
item.comment:
Had to get another game in this series. After years of still not learning the names of the towns in India Rails this one should be more familiar.
NL: Treintjes-krijtjes spel. Dat klinkt ongetwijfeld heel suf, maar Heleen & ik vinden het leuk. Zie ook India Rails.

item.name: Evo
item.comment:
Dino hatching!
OK game with fun artwork. For "before mankind" themed games I prefer Ursuppe though.
Don't need it in my collection. Got plenty games I like better.

item.name: Evo (second edition)
item.comment:
I'll draw back this bullshit rating if the bullshit decision to split this entrie from the 1st edition is revoked.
It's the same bloody game!!!! Who gives a toss about the bloody artwork?

item.name: Evolution
item.comment: OK game. Nice artwork, enough player interaction & tension. I think it's a bit too expensive for what it is, but I'd play again.

item.name: Executive Decision
item.comment:
Sid Sackson game
As usual easy rules. Sort of bidding element economic game. Hasn't aged as well as Acquire. Not bad for a 1971 game though.
NL: oud economisch spel

item.name: Expedition
item.comment:
New in collection september 07
Initial rating after 1 play. Easy explainable game. Get rid of your cards by going past their location on the map with one of the 3 expeditions. Some screwage possible. Fun way to learn some geographical sites on the side.
Plays fine with 2. Might be a bit too long, but that's solvable by house rules (take less cards to begin with)
NL: aardig spel met makkelijke regels, waarbij je en passant nog geografische kennis op doet..
item.conditiontext: Very good condition, as new. National Geographic version. Cards have 3 languages: French, Italian, Dutch

item.name: Expedition Dino
item.comment: For kids the rating is higher. But I think it probably gets boring quickly.

item.name: Factory Fun
item.comment: Fun puzzlelike game. Enjoyable despite the 'multiplayer solitaire' aspects of it.

item.name: Falsche FuFFziger
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09
Need to play it more to really form an opinion. First play was fun, but mostly thanks to the players and atmosphere. Need to play again.

item.name: Famiglia
item.comment: Nice quirky card game for two.

item.name: Family Business
item.comment:
Basically a simple "take that" card game with a "death row" board. Quite luck dependant (card drawing), but with the right atmosfear and fake Italian accents it makes a real nice party game. With the right rowdy crowd this one is a blast, and I'd always want to play this. Definitely better with beer.
NL: Engelstalig kaarspel, waarbij de speldoos de "gangwar"muur is. Je bent een mafiabaas met 8 gangsters. Je probeert de gangsters van je tegenstanders te vermoorden. Dat is soms handiger als je samenspant, maar uiteindelijk is er maar 1 winnaar: de laatste overlevende...
Eigenlijk alleen echt leuk als je jezelf een beetje in de rol verplaatst, bij voorkeur met slechte Italiaanse accenten. Maar dan is het ook echt heel leuk. Dus alleen goed met de juiste spelers.

item.name: Faqir
item.comment: Ok kids game. Rating is adult rating.

item.name: Fast Flowing Forest Fellers
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 play with 5:
The new Friedeman. 1st play was disappointing. Felt too much filler and too low on tactics. Strategy didn't seem to be necessary.
