Update after 2 more plays with 2: I thought having a go at boards with more woodpieces floating around would be more fun. But it only gives the illusion of more gameplay.
Don't know why others are raving about this luck driven family filler. I usually like Friedeman's games, but this one doesn't get me. 60% luck + 25% take that + 15% tactics = onto the tradepile!
UPDATE: Traded away for Seenot im Rettungsboot (Lifeboats) which I like a lot more!
item.conditiontext: 1st (German) edition. Bought @ Essen 08. Cover signed by Frieseman (in green obviously) Played 3 times, looks as new.

item.name: Feudal
item.comment:
3M Bookshelf game. Good game considering it's age. Tactical/strategical abstract. Easy chess with plastic army figures. Fun enough to pull out every once in a while. Unlike stuff like Acquire not good enough to keep up with modern day games though.
NL: oud taktisch/strategisch spel met mooie figuurtjes. Soort simpelere/logischere variant van schaak met legerfiguurtjes.

item.name: A Few Acres of Snow
item.comment:
Yes, it has a learning curve. Yes, you're first (few) game(s) won't be going smooth.
Yes, I guess it's worth the effort.

item.name: Field of Glory: The Card Game
item.comment: Played my first session quite wrong despite we got half of the game explained by Martin Wallace himself... (forgot a quite important rule) so have to rate it after I played it the right way.

item.name: Fikkie en Zijn Vrienden
item.comment:
This one looks so cute, you really want to love it. It's basically a roll & move, with a tiny bit of secret information and searching.
My son likes it. It's currently one of his favorite games. Well, if I was his age I would like it too: cute dogs, sticking the bones into the dogs mouth is fun & kinda realistic as well.
It's actually one of his favorite games, starting when he was 4.

item.name: Fill or Bust
item.comment: Needs lots of beer and fun company. Then it's ok as a filler. But I'd rather play a better filler.

item.name: Filou - Die Katze im Sack
item.originalname: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Initial rating: Fast & fun trick taking bluff game. One of the best of it's kind I came across. It's the kind of game you still want to play for another go, even though it's already late...
Rating is for me higher than usual thanks to the very fitting theme of the game (sometimes you really buy "a cat in the sack" because you spend more than the trick is worth) and the very short playing time, combined with the huge amount of laughter it generated during my first couple of plays.
Update march 08 (after half year of play): for some reason this silly little game has become a late-nite favorite with a lot of my gamer friends. Rating goes up half a point for the incredible amount of fun I've had with this small little card game over the last couple of months.
NL: Erg grappig & kort kaartspel waarbij je probeert je tegenstanders te slim af te zijn. Tactischer dan je denkt na je eerste potje. Dikke pret.

item.name: Finstere Flure
item.comment:
Finstere Flure New in collection sept 07.
Bizarre race game. Simple rules but loads of fun to play. Usually lots of fun. Good stuff!
NL: Probeer als eerste 3 van je poppetjes langs het hongerige lopende monster naar de uitgang te krijgen.
Hilarisch door beglijdbare bloedplassen, wegduwbare rotsblokken waar je achter kunt schuilen en een ontzettend dom monster dat altijd naar het dichtsbijzijnde hapje (jouw poppetjes) loopt. Het monster kan door muren lopen, jij niet.

item.name: Fire & Axe: A Viking Saga
item.comment: Good game!

item.name: Fireball Island
item.comment: Fun with kids. Or once in a while with not so serious adults.

item.name: Firefly: The Game
item.comment: Good game, but takes a bit too long for what it is.

item.name: Fische Fluppen Frikadellen
item.comment:
New in collection april 07 I love the idea of playing this with up to 10-15 people on 2 or 3 different boards. Rating is valid for 7 players or more. Looking forward to playing this with more than 10 with 3 boards.
NL: Handel & verzamelspel. Unieke van dit spel is dat het pas echt leuk wordt als je 2 of 3 spellen combineert voor 6 tot 15 spelers. Dan moet ieder spel op een aparte tafel, en moet je tijdens het spel (op het juiste moment) van tafel wisselen voor de beste deals.

item.name: A Fistful of Penguins
item.comment: Neat little filler. Althought it's a dicefest (not my thing) I probably would have bought it at Spiel2011 if it hadn't already sold out on friday.

item.name: Five Fingered Severance
item.comment: Fun light game. Not so sure about replayability.

item.name: Fjords
item.comment:
Had to add this game to my Franz-Benno Delonge collection. (Small box, doesn't take much space on the shelf excuse...)
NL: 2-persoons leg & claim spel. Leuker dan Carcassone.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment:
After a couple of solo games, a 2-player session and a 6-player session:
The game feels good and thematically right. And looks good too. I enjoy it more than Pandemic.
Scalabiltiy: It's a lot harder with only 2 firefighters than with 6. So next time I'll play with more than 4 people I'll start at the intermediate level. Or play on the harder looking side of the board.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Urban Structures
item.comment: Got this together with the base game (Kickstarter) Nice for variations. Definitely not needed. At least not for your first 10 or so games.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment:
New in collection may 2008
Fast & fun filler.
NL: snel, eenvoudig en toch leuk tussendoortje.

item.name: The foreign King
item.comment: Great game in a small box. It's got more meat than the average euro and plays in less time. Good stuff.

item.name: Formula D
item.comment: Racing games always need the right crowd. This classic is ok, but there are other race games I prefer.

item.name: Formula Dé
item.comment:
18 oct 07. Essen buying spree
Classic racing game.
NL: Moderne klassieker: racespel, vooral leuk met meer spelers. Makkelijk uit te leggen, leuk & spannend om te spelen.
Tactisch spel omdat je de juiste versnelling moet kiezen, voordat je uit de bocht verliest of je brandstof op raakt.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Foute Vrienden Vette Feesten
item.comment:
New in collection july 07 Foute vrienden, vette feesten
After first play with 2: nice tongue in cheek humorous game, but should definitely be played with more people.
UPDATE: it's a blast with 5.
NL: Humoristisch spel waarbij iedere speler een aantal "doelen" in zijn leven moet halen. Het zijn niet de meest nobele doelen.
Niet geschikt voor religeuze mensen die niet van drank, drugs en sex houden.

item.name: Fowl Play!
item.comment:
Initial rating: Easy rules, fun to play, but not too easy to win. I like it, glad I found a copy. A fun game from Richard Breese.
NL: Leuk spel waarbij je als vos een zo goed mogelijk gevarieerd dieet van ganzen, eenden, kippen en kalkoenen moet zien te verschalken. Ingenieus telsysteem maakt het nog niet zo eenvoudig als het lijkt.

item.name: Francis Drake
item.comment:
Expected more from this game. Looks pretty good but gameplay is way too average for such an expensive game.
Basically your standard euro cubepusher in a fancy outfit. (Interaction is only indirect, just pointgrabbing without actual warfare et.)
Was on my 'check this game' on my 'potential buy' list. Degraded to 'was fun to play once' immediately after first play. Not worth the amount of money. You can get better games at half the price.

item.name: Frank's Zoo
item.comment: Fun filler. Like to play this with the right group.

item.name: Freeloader
item.comment:
Cheapass Party game. OK with the right people in the right mood. Takes a bit too long for what it is though when you're more in a game mood.
NL: thema is leuk: je bent een lamme uitvreter die probeert zo veel mogelijk zut van je nieuwe vrienden te lenen en te verzamelen. Wel leuk voor een keer, maar niet bepaald briljant want duurt net te lang.

item.name: Fresh Fish
item.comment:
Would like to find this older Friese game. It's a bit dry but fun. It's actually the only Friedeman game that comes close to the quality of Funkenschlag (Power Grid)
Update: found it & bought it! Glad to have found it. Probably the best tile-laying game I know.

item.name: Friday
item.comment: Not so sure yet. But it's fascinating to try to win.

item.name: Friedrich
item.comment:
Initial rating: Wanted to buy it after first play (and did so), so: Good game!
I like the different gameset up and winning conditions. Gives a fresh & exciting gameplay.
NL: 3 of 4 persoons spel, waarbij 1 persoon Friedrich speelt, en de rest tegen hem. Maar er zijn wel individuele overwinningscondities. Erg goed strategisch oorlogsspel.

item.name: Friesematenten
item.comment:
Yay, this one is fun! Good quirky card game in a good Friese style.. (which means plenty of screwage and fun)
Lots of game for the buck. Extra 0.5 in rating for being a good & fun game in the basic quick playing card format.

item.name: Friesematenten: Die Schattenmänner
item.comment:
This expansion really alters the 'basic' game. Makes it more chaotic and uncontrallable. Add it if you have players who love to find weird combo's and highly distracting bids. Don't add it if you're playing with controlfreaks who prefer strict Eurogames.
After the first 2 plays I guess it will depend on my mood (and the experience of other players with the basic game) if I will throw this one in or not.
+: it does bring out the interactivity more -: more randomness...

item.name: FrogFlip
item.comment: Kinda silly dexterity game. Short filler.

item.name: Full Metal Planète
item.comment:
Finally got this legendary game. It came at a price, but it is good looking & complete.
At my first play I was the only one who enjoyed it. The rest seemed to think it was nothing more than a Risk-like game.
I like the interactivity and the continuing threat of take overs.

item.name: Funkenschlag
item.comment:
Funkenschlag New in collection Dec.06.
1st impression: brilliant gameplay, plenty interaction.
Update: played it some more. Love this game. Best Euro in years. Very good balanced gameplay, gotta love that "catch-up" mechanic. Theme is more fun than it sounds. Points go up, only thing holding back the 10 is the constant calculating....
NL: Funkenschlag is een fantastisch spel. Moet je absoluut gespeeld hebben als je van strategische spellen houdt.

item.name: Funkenschlag
item.comment:
This first version of one of my favorite games is clearly not as streamlined as the version most people are familiar with. It still has some rough edges, and it takes longer than the newer version.
But being able to draw your own route is fun.
On the other hand: I've played the second edition more than 30 times, which I've probably wouldn't have done with this version. The board probably doesn't survive that many plays.

item.name: Funkenschlag - Erweiterung Brasilien/Spanien & Portugal
item.comment: Bought at Essen '09 The latest expansion boards for Funkenschlag. Not essential.

item.name: Funkenschlag - Erweiterung Italien/Frankreich
item.comment:
New in collection sept 07
Woohooo, more Funkenschlag fun!Since Funkenschlag is one of my favorite games, and after playing the additional Benelux map, I had to have this map as well.
Italy is harder than the normal map, so more fun. Initial rating after 1 go. Very keen on playing again, France map is good as well.
NL: alternatieve spelborden voor het Fantastische Funkenschlag.

item.name: Funkenschlag - Fabrikmanager
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09.
Initial rating: Finally again another good game by Friedeman Friese. It's not a clone of Funkenschlag, but there are some familiar mechanics that'll help you to quickly learn this game if you're a Funkenschlag (Power Grid) fan.
It's certainly different enough to get. And it works with 2 players as well.

item.name: Funkenschlag - Korea/China
item.comment:
Wow, this is different! Both sides of this map really change the gameplay in a challenging way. Thumbs up!
This is my favorite Funkenschlag expansion so far. I like both the Korea map with the 2 markets and the China map which is really "tight". Both maps give more possibilities for an already great game. Best expansion map sofar.
Oh, and by the way: my rating is for the game & gameplay only. I would rate it a 10 on political grounds for NOT including occupied Tibet. I will delete this comment as soon as those 2 brainwashed losers drop their "1" shill ratings.
NL: 2 uitbreidingskaarten voor Funkenschlag. Erg goed.

item.name: Funkenschlag – Erweiterung Zentraleuropa/Benelux
item.comment:
New in collection july 07 Oh joy, it's fun as well. Now I'm able to play in a familiar setting...
NL: alternatieve spelborden voor Funkenschlag.

item.name: Funkenschlag: Die Neuen Kraftwerkskarten
item.originalname: Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Yay, another Funky expansion to work with all the maps! Gladly donated a few Euro's for this. The first variant makes it a bit easier to get started, so that's a good one for newbies, and also for everyone who is already too set on known tactics...
NL: alternatieve Energiecentrales voor Funkenschlag. Maakt het spel toch weer anders.

item.name: Funkenschlag: Erweiterung Russland/Japan
item.comment: Another good map for Funkenschlag. The Japan map actually feels like changing the gameplay in a fun way. Russia map makes for a slightly tighter gameplay. (Probably better with 4 than 3)

item.name: Funkenschlag: Lagerhalle
item.comment: Not essential, but fun to drop into the stack.

item.name: Funkenschlag: Umspannwerk
item.comment: Nice twist. If this card turns up early in the game, it isn't worth much, but it'll definitely raise some cash towards the end of the game.

item.name: Fürsten von Florenz, die
item.comment:
Won my first game of this in a 3-player session. It seemed I was the only one liking it. (Must admit it felt a bit dry.) New in collection jan. 08 Bought from Lajos.
NL: Spel met veel keuzemogelijkheden. Goed voor strategen en flexibel ingestelde denkers & bluffers.

item.name: Fzzzt!
item.comment: Nice short & fast cardgame with lovely cartoony robot art. The "you MUST play a card" rule can create some nice surprises.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment:
Played a short version explained by the author @ Essen07. Fun game, but I hesitated at that moment to buy it. After sticking to my mind bought it @ Essen' 08, with the expansion.
Fun quirky spacerace game. Despite the light feel and strokes of luck (the dicerolls for the bad events) it's always fun to see other players spaceships being blown to pieces while you barely hang on...
NL: Je bent een kamikaze spacepiloot die een zelfgebouwd barrel door allerlei avonturen heelhuids moet zien te loodsen. Kwestie van goed bouwen, juist inschatten en een beetje geluk. Erg leuk.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: The Big Expansion
item.comment:
Galaxy Trucker playable with 5. And loads of other stuff...
NL: uitbreiding voor Galaxy Trucker

item.name: Game of Goose
item.comment: Had to increase my rating of this terrible game by one point since my wife was so stupid to show this crappy game to my 3 y.o. So now he wants me to play it with him. Which I obviously do. That's the category 'could be convinced' I guess.

item.name: A Game of Thrones (first edition)
item.comment:
Depite being more than 4 hours long there's not a dull moment in this game. Probably because it's the kinda game where you know you're gonna get stabbed in the back eventually, just not when (or where). This is probably the closest I can get to Diplomacy, which I'm really not interested in.
NL: Wie van de 4 of 5 spelers volgt de koning op? Je gaat er om knokken. Maar helemaal in je eentje redt je het niet, dus zul je al dan niet betrouwbare pacts met een deel van je medespelers moeten sluiten.
Spel met diverse variabelen en voor-/nadelen die wisselen per speler.

item.name: Gears of War: The Board Game
item.comment: Good tension for a coop. First play dragged a bit after we got some bad luck, but might have been by subpar play. Rating might go up with further plays.

item.name: Geistesblitz 2.0
item.comment: Fun speed game. I guess it's gotten somewhere on my wishlist now.

item.name: Genesis
item.comment:
Good abstract game that has more theme than the usual Knizia. I like the look of it as well.
Found out about it at Spiel 2010, played it with 5 people there and immediately bought it, just like most of my coplayers.

item.name: Genius
item.comment:
Genius Tempting abstract, even for newbies. Very easy to explain and loads of fun to play for a couple of games in a row. Plays fast too. It's the kinda game I'd gladly see overtake the usual crap at the usual gamestores, since it might go well enough with a usual crowd. So it has everything to become a classic in a way. You have to be in the mood to play an abstract though. Good abstract game for beginners too.
Update: After quite some plays and still too many beauties lying unplayed on my shelves the shine is wearing thinner on this one. Downgraded a point for that.
NL: leuk strategisch/tactisch legspel zonder thema. Makkelijk uit te leggen, leuk om te zien, voor de meer ervaren spelers kun je elkaar ook taktisch dwarszitten. Beetje te vaak gespeeld inmiddels, maar blijft zijn charmes hebben, en altijd prima voor een snel potje tussendoor.

item.name: Geschenke für den Radscha
item.comment: Nice family style tactical game with some strategical elements.

item.name: Ghost Stories
item.comment:
Initial play left me lukewarm, even though everyone was involved and did their best (and we won)
I guess it's too dry for me. Didn't 'feel' the theme.

item.name: Giganten
item.comment:
Looks very nice, might be interested Update: bought it...
Initial rating after 2 plays: Good Eurogame. Easy rules, plenty interaction, nice plastic bits.
Good combination of tactics, luck and bluff.
NL: Wie is de meest gehaaide oliebaron? Economisch spel met boortorens, treintjes en auto's en veel interactie.

item.name: GIPF
item.comment:
New in collection jan. 07. Although it looks less good than the other games in the series, I just had to have the game that gave the name to this great series of brainburners.
Only played the basic version yet, so there's more to come.
NL: strategisch 2-persoons abstract spel. Lijkt ergens wel op een soort 5-op-een-rij, maar dan WEL met hoge dosis strategie. Niet geschikt voor mensen die niet willen nadenken (of daar te lang over doen)

item.name: Glass Road
item.comment:
Well, at least this game did something right: It convinced me I've really become jaded at 'yet another eurogame that mechanically works well but where the theme is totally pasted on'.
While the game works I became kinda got disinterested while playing it, although it was allright playing it. Which is a good thing. Because it saves me so much time (and money, and shelf space!) by not being interested in at least 400 of the 600 bland eurogames that come out every year. It saves me at least a month of free evenings because I can't even be bothered anymore with even reading the rules.
I guess this is the game that really stopped me from being interested in yet another Uwe game. Might have loved it if I hadn't already played a couple hundred different games. Was allright to play once. Won't ask for it again, and probably would suggest strongly to play something else. I gues I would only play it if everybody else would'nt want to play something else. You know the category if you're jaded like me: great game for autists that like to optimize their soloplay while vaguely thinking they're interacting with other souls out there at the same table doing the same thing because the piggybacking mechanisms might force you to slightly consider the other players choices in actions.
(Don't get me wrong: Yes, I'll probably still like my occasional Agricola play, and a yearly Le Havre play, and a yearly multiplayer Bohnanza game, but that really is enough Uwe for me, thank you)

item.name: Glebdo
item.comment: The game looks great. It just doesn't play great.

item.name: Glebdo
item.comment:
I'm tempted to give this a 1, since a 3-player session didn't seem to work at all. Both vampires didn't have a chance to win from the Brigand player.
'Nice kitschy figurines' is the only positive thing I can say about this obscure game.
I should detract one more point for all the stupid 'german humor' crap in the rulebook, which makes it very hard to figure out how to play this apparently very simple game.

item.name: Glen More
item.comment:
Ok cubepushing/tilelaying game. Mishmash of mechanisms seen before (f.e.: player turn a la Thebes/Tinner's Trails/Red novemeber) in a new mix. but it doesn't feel 'fresh' to me.
Although the various tiles seem to be thematically related, it's still quite 'gamey' and dry. Especially the interaction level is way too low for me. Bit too much multiplayer solitaire.
Although it's not bad I have no need to buy this one. Especially not so good with AP prone people (downtime).
Several times during the game we got distracted by chatting nicely while someone was taking his turn.
Started out okay, when the game was over I felt I had already played it enough. Wouldn't mind sitting in if someone would really want to play this, but wouldn't suggest it. After a session with 4 players I'd rather NOT play this with more than 3. Although with 3 you seem to get another randomization with a dummy player, which I suspect is pretty sucky. And would definitely not play it with 5.

item.name: Gloom
item.comment: Lovely looking see-through card game with quirky theme. Good if you're in a storytelling mood.

item.name: Gloria Mundi
item.comment:
Not so good. Groupthink, randomness in cards that show up and seating order have too much influence on the outcome of this game.
Not a real fun experience in what should be a fun game. Glad I never bought this.
I might be convinced to try this again, but not with 5 (and definitely not 6) players.

item.name: Glory to Rome
item.comment: Better than San Juan and Race for the Galaxy. Get it if you can.

item.name: Go
item.comment:
Got into this game thanks to an University course, and got hooked. Afterwards I never understood how chess championships made it to news channels, as this game is far superior in game play.
Haven't played it in ages, since it's so much easier to explain Yinsh or Gipf...
Besides tactics and gameplay I really like the "handicap" which makes it possible to play with stronger or weaker opponents.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Go! Gorilla
item.comment:
Fun electronic kids game. Probably fun as a filler with not-so-serious adults too:Each game is only 6 minutes long. Recommended if you're into games like Loopin' Louie.
In Wolf's collection.

item.name: Goa
item.comment:
New in collection Jan.07 After first 2 plays: Good game, various tactics possible. Reminds me in a positive way of Puerto Rico (choices, choices....)
After some more plays: definitely a great game if you can stand many options and a constant shortage of money... I like it a lot. Unfortunately my girlfriend only wants to play this with me with at least 3 people in total, since she hates losing this one too much....
NL: Erg goed spel waarbij je telkens meer wilt kiezen of doen dan je kunt.

item.name: Gobblet
item.comment: New in collection jan 07. Nice wooden pieces & board. Brainy variant on Connect Four. Rules are easy, but gameplay is way more dynamic & intriguing. Nice game, possibly one of the best "under 10 minutes" games.

item.name: God's Playground
item.comment: The second Wallace for 3 players. Considering all the rules it wasn't as hard to play as I expected. Great tense game. Game can be played in a more cooperative way, or in a 'backstab to Poland' way. Or any way in between. Great stuff.

item.name: Goldbräu
item.comment:
Another really good game from Franz-Benno Delonge. Just like most of his other games this is a good game with loads of interaction. Good for family style playing and still enough game to please a hardcore gamer. Fun stuff. Added half a point for the (touch of) theme.
NL: Leuk spel waarbij je probeert het meeste geld met je bierkeet of brouwerij te verdienen. Taktiek en een beetje bluf in een goede combi.

item.name: Gone Fishin'
item.comment:
This might the first game I ever played. (It's the game I have the earliest memory off). It may well lie in the attic somewhere.
Update: found it. And offcourse my 3 year old likes it. Let's see how fast I can introduce a better game...
No, I won't click on 'own'. It's his now!

item.name: Graenaland
item.comment:
Initial rating: I guess this really is Vlaada's take on Settlers of Catan.
Has a steeper learning curve thanks to some original variants on known game mechanics. It's probably more of a gamer's game where you have to "sense" the game in a way. I'd really like to get to know this game better.
NL: Subtielere en beter uitgewerkt spel, geinspireerd door het uitgekauwde Kolonisten. In vergelijking daarmee zit hier veel meer "gevoel" in. Wat je dus moet leren ontwikkelen.

item.name: Grand Cru
item.comment: Good economical game. Tested at Essen. All testers wanted just to play a couple of rounds, but we got excited enough to not want to break up the game untill we finished it. Bought it immediately afterwards.

item.name: El Grande
item.comment:
One of the first "Eurogames" that got me hooked. Probably plays best with 4 or 5, because of the tower. (Don't you love to drop some of your knights into that tower quickly so the other players don't realize how many you put in there?) Haven't played it in quite some time because my gaming group likes other games better, but I'd love to play this one more.
Update: finally played it again, and I still love it after all those years! Screw your neighbour? Screw all your neighbours!
NL: Moderne klassieker. Probeer zoveel mogelijk invloed te krijgen in verschillende Spaanse provincies. Trek de koning naar je toe, of gooi wat van je pionnen in de toren om ze later taktisch ergens in te zetten.
Speel het veel te weinig, want ik vind 'm te gek. Ideaal matennaaierij spel.

item.name: Grave Robbers From Outer Space
item.comment: I like the theme, and most of the cards are reasonably funny. But this crappy take that game takes longer than it is funny.

item.name: The Great Dalmuti
item.comment: Card game. OK filler, will be fun with the right crowd.

item.name: The Great Fire of London 1666
item.comment: I had plenty of fun during my first game. And the setup is not so desastrous as people try to makey you believe.

item.name: The Great Zimbabwe
item.comment: A real splotter that plays in (less than) 2 hours and doesn't have a shitload of chits. Winner. Definitely worth the investment for me. On the same level as Indonesia, Roads & Boats, Antiquity, but in half the playing time, so I actually manage to get this one on the table. It even plays great with 2 (in about 90 minutes max). Scales pretty good.

item.name: Greed Incorporated
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09
Initial rating after 1 very entertaining play with 4: Another great Splotter game. Again different than their other games, but unmistakenly with the "Splotter touch". Less fiddly bits in this one.
The theme works perfectly. It's hard to have an overview over a company you're not a CEO of, and timing is as always very important.

item.name: Gulo Gulo
item.comment:
Fun kids game. Probably fun with drunk adults too...
NL: erg leuk behendigheidsspel voor 2 tot 6 kinderen of volwassenen. Kinderen zijn wellicht in het voordeel vanwege de benodigde kleinere friemelvingers.

item.name: Gunrunners
item.comment:
Another neat filler from Dr. Finn's games.
The 'delay' in getting the cards out the way you want them is a nice mechanism.

item.name: Haas en Schildpad
item.comment:
New in collection aug 07. Initial rating: I wish I played this at school, because then I'd might have thought math could be fun. Nice family racing game with interesting mechanics.
NL: Haas & schildpad. Tactisch racespel waarbij je behoorlijk moet uitkienen waar je uitkomt want rennen kost veel worteltjes. Stuk leuker dan de oubollige doos doet vermoeden.

item.name: Hadronen: Big Bang kaartspel 1
item.comment: Can't say I enjoyed this card game for physicist nerds. As the game didn't gave me some insight in understanding the structures I can't say it helped me getting more educated either...

item.name: Halali!
item.comment: Fun filler. Luck factor is pretty high in the beginning of the game.

item.name: Hallo Das!
item.comment: Kids memory game. I really don't like memory games. In Wolf's collection.

item.name: Hammer of the Scots
item.comment:
Initial rating: Only played 2 games in 3 years, but man, I really do like THIS wargame.
It's the first block (war)game for me, and I really like this gamesystem. Want to play it again.
NL: 2-persoons middeleeuws oorlogspel tussen de Engelsen en de Schotten. Erg goed.

item.name: Hamsterrolle
item.comment: Fun dexterity game. Good for adults too.

item.name: Hanabi
item.comment: Original card game! First session was a tense (& fun) one. Recommended. Rating is likely to go up after multiple plays.

item.name: Händler auf dem Forum Romanum
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09 after playing it at the hotel with the designer.
I think this is a great game. there is a "Wallace" feel about it, without being too heavy for the casual gamer. Good stuff! Try to get a copy, it's a limited edition.
Oh, I can't imagine why it only says 4 players on the box. We played it with 3 and it works just fine.

item.name: Händler von Genua, Die
item.comment:
Initial rating: Trading game for gamers. In my first 5-player game I seemed to be the only one who really enjoyed all the various options and flexible gameplay. I thought it was good fun for heckling gamers, they thought it was unnecessarily complicated. Game took a bit too long thanks too some slow negotiating though. So it's the kinda game you don't want to play with anyone except gamers...
NL: onderhandelspel waarbij vrijwel alles onderhandelbaar is, en waarbij er genoeg keuze's zijn om je bij je 1e spel over in verwarring te brengen over wat nou handig is, wat je nou waar voor moet betalen etc. Desondanks vind ik het een erg goed spel.

item.name: Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage
item.comment:
Very good 2-player carddriven wargame. I'm not much of a wargamer, but I really like this one.
Have to play it again to give it a serious rating, but feels 8-uppish.
NL: Spannend en mooi uitgevoerd strategisch-taktisch knokspel voor 2. Je moet er wel even voor gaan zitten (3 uur), maar dan heb je ook wat.

item.name: Hau La
item.comment:
Unique game. I've played a lot of good looking games, but this one has the nice side effect that you're actually creating something that looks like a piece of art while you're playing it. That's a very satisfying feeling.
The (abstract) gameplay itself is nice too.
If you come across this game I recommended you try it. It's special.

item.name: Havana
item.comment: 'Meh' pretty much sums it up for me. It's kinda ok. Don't need to play again. Wouldn't struggle too much if somebody really wants to play it though.

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment:
Heavier on the brain than Agricola, but less fun: to me it's a bit more multiplayer solitaire, since you're more busy working out how to get to all the possible goals than in Agricola.
But it has some of the same pros as Agricola: Nice buildup of tension through each round, planning stuff and the need to constantly adapt, etc.
So far I have played Le Havre 6 times in almost 6 years. Agricola got on the table 37 times in those years. Says enough.
Still a nice game, but there are so many better games out there that I wonder why this is in the top 10. But for some reason my wife likes this one better than a lot of games I prefer to it. Well, whatever.
NL: Pittiger spel dan Agricola van dezelfde maker. Ondanks een aantal vergelijkbare spelprincipes toch een totaal ander spel.

item.name: Hawaii
item.comment:
Here's another Eurogame that's enjoyable to play.
Pro: high 'passive interactive' factor. Replayability seems ok. Variety in choices, doesn't feel scripted like a lot of Euro's do.
Con: like most Euro's, action mechanisms are so much more important than the actual theme.
All in all: quite an ok game. I wonder how it will hold up.

item.name: De Hazelnootridders
item.comment:
Collectie Wolf. Memory achtig spel. Maar dan rond een roll, pickup & move bordspel.
Ik vind er echt geen klap aan ('2'), hij lijkt het wel aardig te vinden ('6'), dus gemiddeld een 4.

item.name: Hazienda
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree Nothing new, nothing original, but another high quality game from Herr Kramer with plenty of rivalry
NL: Goed spel van dezelfde maker als klassiekers als El Grande, Java, Torres etc. Je bent bezig om je Hacienda uit te breiden, en je veestapel. Ondertussen niet vergeten om ook voor water te zorgen en af en toe een markt te bezoeken.

item.name: Hegemonic
item.comment: Played the print & play version. Reminded me of Eclipse, but it feels different enough. It's more abstract and has less tech tree. Makes it easier to get on the table with not so experienced players.

item.name: Heimlich & Co.
item.comment: Wasn't as bad as I expected it to be. Ok family style game.

item.name: Hellas
item.comment: Little 2-player eurostyle wargame. Short, easy rules, better than most fillers. Might get repetitive. Rating will either go down or up after I find out if it is or not...

item.name: Hemloch
item.comment:
Ordered 16 may 2012, delivered in a week to Europe!
Another great smallbox game! Has some similarities to Omen, but plays quite differently.

item.name: Herders en Schapen
item.comment:
Kinda cute tile-laying game. Nothing special, bit more puzzly than Carcassone, like this better. Probably fun with kids.
NL: legspel a la Carcassone, maar ziet er veel leuker uit. Gekocht voor Wolf...

item.name: Hick Hack in Gackelwack
item.comment: Average filler. At least spreading the corn each round feels thematic.

item.name: High Frontier
item.comment:
Wow. My first game was a disaster. Got a rocket into orbit after an hour and a half. After a 4 hour game I finished almost last with only 3 points. Interesting experience though, and I hope I got at least the hang of it now.
Will rate this after my first 'proper' game....

item.name: Himalaya
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 4-player session without the advanced rules:
+ Fun & interactive. Feels fresh, even in 2013. Tense, we played with the suggested 1 minute timer, which makes it even more tense.
- The 'luck of the roll' (a 20-sided dice that decides which new villages get either resources or trade opportunities) seems to have quite a big influence.
Want to play it more to see whether you or the game has the biggest influence about who wins the game.

item.name: Hispania
item.comment: Tentative rating after 1 play. Might go up after playing Britannia a couple of times and then going back to this version.

item.name: Hive
item.comment:
Very good little 2 player game, attractive and easy to take with you. Good for playing in bars as well. I'd be interested in a multiplayer expansion as well.
Update march 07: after multiple games it's only getting better. Underneath the pretty playing pieces there's a great abstract game.
Update august 07: This game just keeps getting better. Another notch up in rating. March 08: After one year of playing, and loads of games, I dare to say this is THE modern classic abstract.
Update march 08: I guess this is my favorite abstract, just a notch above Yinsh because of it's easy "play it everywhere" nature. Probably my most played game. NL: misschien wel het leukste moderne abstracte spel voor 2. Door de insecten (en bijbehorende bewegingen) stukken minder abstract dan schaken, en een stuk leuker.

item.name: Hive: The Ladybug
item.comment: Not essential, but fun to drop in.

item.name: Hive: The Mosquito
item.comment:
New in collection nov 07. Finally!
The weird thing is: it doesn't seem to take the game out of balance as I supposed it would. Just add it with experienced players to have some more options. It's standard in my set now.
NL: uitbreiding voor Hive. De mug neemt als echte parasiet de eigenschappen over van het beest waar het aan ligt.

item.name: Höchste Eisenbahn
item.comment:
Rating is for playing with kids. Since you can play this on various levels ('easy' for kids and 'advanced' for adults for example) you can actually have some fun doing this.
As ususal with these small card games from Adlung there is a educational element: it trains in seeing similarities & differences. Recommended activity to play with kids.

item.name: Hol's der Geier
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Classic, basic trick taking game. Bit random, but nice for late-night or bar play.
NL: makkelijk kaartspel. Leuk als afwisseling voor bijv. Take5 en dergelijke.

item.name: Homas Tour
item.comment: Homas Tour is the original rare Dutch version of Um Reifenbreite. Minor difference is the "doping" card, that become the "cheating" card in Demarrage/Um Reifenbreite.

item.name: Homesteaders
item.comment: If you're into economic games with various options you should try this one. It plays great, there's enough (eurostyle) interaction, it looks cool and it doesn't feel scripted.

item.name: Hotel Life
item.comment:
Good and hilarious game. The fun is in the action cards that trigger great chain effects.
Too bad it's out of print. Loads of text require good knowledge of German, or a lot of prints (available here on BGG).

item.name: Het Huis Anubis
item.comment: Children's game, based on a Dutch TV-series. Not too bad for a kid's game, but not enough meat for grown-ups. Probably an 7 or 8 if played with your kids, but just a 4 with grown-up non-gamers. So a tentative 6 is being nice....

item.name: Hungry Hungry Hippos
item.comment: Wow, didn't know it was this old. Played it as a little kid. Got distracted quickly even then as it's only fun for 2 minutes. After that the frustration quickly changes to boredom.

item.name: Ice Flow
item.comment:
New in collection july 08
This IS a cool looking game! Love those blue-see-thru ice hexes. The bears (beaples?) are great too. In fact: the whole game looks very good. It's a very clear design that might make you think it's a simple kids game.
Don't be fooled: this is a good strategical game that might be the right "next step up" after lighter fare as Ticket to ride for newbies.
Very enjoyable, both for family as for gamers.
NL: prachtig uitgevoerd bordspel waarin je als eerste je 3 ontdekkers van Alaska naar Siberie moet zien te krijgen over ijsschotsen, met behulp van touw en vis (die erg van pas komt om de ijsberen die je onderweg tegenkomt af te leiden of op je concurrenten af te sturen)

item.name: Imperial 2030
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09.
Initial rating: great game! Played a (slightly shortened but complete) 6 player game at Essen '09, but that convinced me enough to immediately buy it. Second game with 6 took quite a couple of hours but liked it as well.

item.name: In a Grove
item.comment: Original game. Brainbreaker deduction & bluff filler. Not sure whether it's 'fun for once' or really nice. For now it's at least 'fun for once'.

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
item.comment:
4th Feld game I played, and probably the last for a while. Bland euro cubepusher. No correlation between theme and gameplay (we all know drought is gonna strike next semester, en we'll get invaded after that, right...)
Grab points here, chose this action first, because obviously someone else after you wants that action as well, so it won't be around for the next round, do this to avoid that, etc. Whatever. Yes, it all works, it's been thougt out nicely. But it's as soulless as all the other Feld's I've played so far.
Feld has become a 'game designer to avoid' for me now.

item.name: Inca Empire
item.comment: Good game! The kind of gamer's game you can actually get on the table.

item.name: Incan Gold
item.comment:
This is in the designers opinion (and mine) the same game as [b]Diamant[/b] with the addition of artifacts (which really doesn't change the game). I rate Diamant a 7. I'll remove this shill rating when the stupid decision that they have been separated here on BGG is turned back.
For now I'll just repeat my comment from Diamant here :
Nice little "push your luck" filler. Fun if you're into that. Fast gameplay, good for starters or just a quick game. Definitely not a gamer's game, but good in bigger groups, the more the merrier, and the harder it gets to win on tactics...
Update after lots of plays: this one is definitely a winner with "non-gamers".
NL: Jij en je medespelers zijn op diamantjacht in de mijnen. Neem je je buit mee terug omhoog voordat de mijn instort of durf je die diamant die verderop ligt ook nog even mee te nemen?
Uitgelegd in 1 minuut, gespeeld in minder dan 15 en toch spannend.

item.name: India Rails
item.comment:
My first crayon rail game. Picked this one because the coating of this board is easy to clean.
Even though there's not much interaction between players I really like this game. Can be a bit long, but sometimes me & my girlfriend manage two games in one evening.
If you're good at logistic planning you'll love this one.
I guess we wouldn't suggest playing this with more than 2, since there are plenty other games on my shelf that have more interaction, and I'm afraid that to the expected prolonged playing time the game might overstay it's welcome.
But strangely we still like it a lot more than I can rationally explain.
I hoped that by now I would have learned where all the locations are on the map, but I'm still hopeless. Guess I should have picked up the European or American version... (Update: got Eurorails as well)
NL: Treinspel. Lijkt onaantrekkelijk want het bord is niet heel mooi, het duurt best lang en ik kan niet zo goed uitleggen wat ik er nou leuk uitvind, maar Heleen en ik spelen het graag.

item.name: Indonesia
item.comment:
New in collection 23 july 08
Another heavy & long economic game by Splotter. Hardcore gamer stuff. I like it.

item.name: Industrial Waste
item.comment: Initial rating: Great optimizing game. Played it with 2 and 3 players, good fun.

item.name: Infinite City
item.comment:
Initial rating after one play: Too average
It’s a typical american style tile-laying game: explained in a few minutes, with 20 or so different tiles that do something (mainly screwy) to the other players once you play them.
The meaning of each tile is clear enough that you’ll know by heart after two or three games what they all do.
Nice sturdy tiles with good artwork on the tiles and the box. But the gameplay didn’t convince me enough. It feels like an ok “take that” screwage Ameritrash version of Carcassone. And I just don’t like Carcassone.

item.name: Innovation
item.comment:
Your first play might take long to digest all the cards...
This game seems to be either loved or hated. After two games I think I'm in the first category.

item.name: Insula
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 play with 5: more fun than expected.
I like the original artwork, the general atmosphere and the semi-cooperative aspect. I can't see anybody winning this game if they all work solo.
You have to work together for a certain amount to be able to win this game.
there is quite a luck factor in this game: drawing a tile, drawing a monster on certain tiles, drawing a curse if you're unlucky, rolling the dice each round, etcetera.
But despite the luck factor I've enjoyed the ride. Probably I would have bought this one at Essen '09 as well if I had spotted it...

item.name: Irondale
item.comment: Initial rating after 2 2-player games: good stuff, rating will hopefully go up after more plays.

item.name: Isis & Osiris
item.comment:
After my first play I wondered if I played it wrong. This can't be this boring and predictable? After 2 more plays I realised I was right the first time. I was amazed that I was able to sell it...
(it's really strikes me that this piece of utter boredom comes from the same designer as the tense Kardinal & König)

item.name: The Island
item.comment: Light game, but a lot of fun.

item.name: It's Alive!
item.comment:
Good fun filler with enough "meat" on it....
NL: leuk spel waarbij iedereen als een Frankenstein zijn eigen monster in elkaar probeert te krijgen.

item.name: Ivor the Engine
item.comment: Fun game, great artwork, nasty & interactive, but a bit too random (thanks to the cards and events) to be a long time favorite.

item.name: Jagdfieber
item.comment: Average filler card game. 'I think he'll play this so I'll play that' is all it's about. Would play once if someone suggested it in a pub, but that's about it.

item.name: Jambo
item.comment: My wife likes this one. Ok game.
item.wishlistcomment: Only interested in Dutch or English version.

item.name: Java
item.comment:
New in collection Dec.06. Beautiful looking game.I like this game better than Tikal. Action point system works quite good (although you always would like to have at least one action point more...). Works quite good with 2 players as well!
NL: Goed spel uit de "face"reeks van de heren Kramer en Kiesling. Ik vind de beste van deze 3 mooie spellen. Speel het veel te weinig.

item.name: Jenga
item.comment:
O.k., it's a party dexterity game, so it's mood dependant. But it can be very tense, and most of the time good for great laughs.
I really think this game is way to underrated. What's wrong with easy rules?
NL: Blokkentoren. Behendigheidsspel. Trek een steentje onderuit de toren en leg 'm bovenop. Verliezer is degene die de toren laat instorten tijdens zijn beurt.
Best spannend altijd. Goed spel met kids of om diep in de nacht met een biertje nog effe te doen.

item.name: Jenseits von Theben
item.comment:
The original time spend = steps taken mechanic, found back later in Tinner's Trails and Red November. Fun game. One might object against the luck factor of the draw of the tiles, but I felt it appropriate with the theme. Don't play it if you can't stand the luck factor.
And the biggest advantage: this is THE game for a gamenight if you want to bring your guests some drinks & snacks in between: just go dig for a couple of weeks!
Ordered it after 1 play. So I guess I like it... 21 jan. 08 New in collection.

item.name: Jet Set
item.comment:
Initial rating. Entertaining game. Play feels fast, even for 5. Good game where money is scarce.
One of the few games that scales well.
NL: Goed en vlot vliegtuigjes spel wat ondanks weinig regels toch lastig is.

item.name: Jet Set: Investor & Business Expansion
item.comment:
Got it at Essen '09.
Nice for a change. Makes the game easier, so I rather play without it...

item.name: Jockey
item.comment: Same box as Grand Prix.

item.name: Jungle Speed: Deluxe
item.comment: Fun dexterity game. Set on hyperspeed.

item.name: Junta
item.comment:
New in collection feb 2008
Initial rating after 1 play with seven:
This is a game with some rough edges, but with bucketloads of atmosphere. After one play it's clear why this is a classic, and at the same time I understand the naysayers (some clunky things, some rules lawyering). But I think the naysayers are either boring old farts, or got struck by onreasonable amounts of bad luck...
If you're in for a game with perfect rules and even chances, look somewhere else.
If you're in for a game with tons of atmosphere, excitement and the right amount of backstabbing, look no further! (yes, I usually like perfectly balanced Eurogames)
NL: Gekonkel in de bananenrepubliek. Erg leuk interactief spel, maar je moet er een avond voor uit trekken.

item.name: K2
item.comment:
One of the best games of Essen 2010.
Good 'family style' game that really captivates the theme! My first two plays were 2 and 4 player sessions, and the game scales well.
I also like the 2-sided board ('easy' and 'hard' side), and the double amount of weather cards (easier 'summer' and harder 'winter' cards) that will improve the replayability.
It's a challenging game, in both 'easy' games ('easy' board and 'easy' weather) a mountaineer died (we played without the rescue cards), so it will be pretty tough to win on the hard side with winter weather!

item.name: K2: Broad Peak
item.comment:
Bought at Spiel 2011.
Nice to have some variations in 2010's best family game.

item.name: Kaas Kasteel
item.comment:
Good kids game! Beautiful to look at. Even for adults there's fun to be had. One of the best kids games I own (I think it's more fun than Gulo gulo)
Great game to turn your little 'roll & move' or 'memory' kid into a gamer: It introduces the action point system nicely, and some nasty 'take that' mechanism by trying to trap other players mice.
For kids rating: add a point. For adults rating: drop a point.

item.name: Kahuna
item.comment: This has been in my collection for quite some years now, and has been played a lot. Although it's a bit one dimensional in strategy, it's still more fun than the average fast 2-person filler.The luck of the draw is easily outranged by playing skill. Players have to be matched in skill though, otherwise the better of the two will always win this game easily.

item.name: Kaigan
item.comment:
If it only would have a map of Japan where you could lay the 'discovered' tiles it wouldn't feel so abstract.
But all players (including me) were very enthusiastic after the first game anyway. Despite only having 6 cards to play it seems there are many different strategies/tactics possible.
Gameplay feels fresh. It's probably the best new 'indirect put plenty of interaction' game I've played in the last 2 years. Especially the first phase of each round feels very tense.

item.name: Kaiser
item.originalname: In the Shadow of the Emperor
item.comment:
New in collection Jan. 07 I like the different gameplay: the "aging" pieces, you mainly get points for conquering, not for keeping.
Have to play it some more to really know how much I like it.
NL: uniek spel waar je poppetjes in verouderen. Dus je moet op tijd trouwen en kindjes krijgen, en ondertussen tactische plaatsen innemen.

item.name: Kakerlakensalat
item.comment:
Stupid fun....
Kadootje voor Heleen.

item.name: Kapitän Wackelpudding
item.comment: Good fun dexterity game. Great for kids aged 6 and up. And drunk adults.

item.name: Kardinaal en koning
item.comment:
Kardinaal & Koning New in collection june 07 Good area control game. Feels very promising. Easy rules, will probably be not so easy to master. Various tactics possible.
NL: goed spel in de categorie "weinig regels, maar lastig te winnen."

item.name: Karibik
item.comment:
Initial rating after 2 games. Quick & nice looking auction game with pirates. Ok filler in a "I think he'll think that I want to do this" way.
Will probably introduce houserules to lower the amount of money needed to win the game to make it just a hair more exciting. Plays ok with 2, probably not so good (too chaotic) with 4.
NL: vlot en relatief eenvoudig spelletje waarbij je goed moet bedenken wat je tegenstander(s) van plan zijn. Aardig tussendoortje.

item.name: Karottenklau
item.comment:
This one is not so popular. It's not so intuitive. Mediocre kiddy game.
In Wolf's collection.

item.name: Käse Mäuse Chaos
item.comment:
Only played this 2 times with 2 players. Felt broken. Rating based on 2 players. It feels like it should be played with four. Want to play this more because it looks so great. But I'm not convinced if I'll ever like the game. Might be fun to play with kids.
NL: dit is misschien wel het mooist uitgevoerde spel wat ik heb, met 3d stoelen, muizen etc.
Maar ik heb geen idee of het nou leuk of toch echt niet zo best is. Heb het 1x met zijn 2-en gespeeld, maar het moet volgens mij met 3 of 4 gespeeld worden. En je moet op zijn minst van een beetje chaos houden. Er zit ook een hoge geluksfactor en in. Heb 'm ooit al met Heleen gespeeld, maar het is duidelijk bedoeld voor 4, of wellicht ook 3 spelers.
Je moet in dit spel muizen naar het juiste hol met moedermuis zien te krijgen, zonder dat de katten ze te pakken krijgen. Maar je weet in het begin niet welke muis bij welke moedermuis hoort, en zelfs niet welke moedermuis van jou is. Vooral geschikt voor kinderen vanaf een jaar of 6 vermoed ik. Wellicht dan zelfs het leukst.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Keep Running!
item.comment: Light filler with take that elements, nothing special but fun enough with the right group. The luck factor is too high to take it seriously as a game though.

item.name: Key Harvest
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Initial Rating after two 2-player games: Not as mean as Reef Encounter, in the same "medieval" style as Keythedral, and ingenious & thinky as well. It seems a bit dry at first, but there's plenty of backstabbing and strategy to this gamey game.
Rules are a lot easier to explain than Reef Encounter, but have the same kind of "feel" to it.
Good stuff, works great with 2 players, probably with 3 as well, wouldn't like to try with 4...
Oh, and I like the visual aspect that your player board gradually fills with the coloured fields.
NL: tactisch/strategisch spel dat goed in elkaar steekt. Zit meer in dan je in eerste instantie zou denken.

item.name: Key West
item.comment:
Euro cubepushing worker placement game. Quite abstract in gameplay.
Game is ok, but very 'gamey' There is no connection between the actions you take and what they supposed to mean.
5 is actually a 'high' rating. The only reason for this is that the gameplay is tense enough, there is enough interaction for an Eurogame. Would probably rather not play it again. Definitely don't 'need' it in my collection.

item.name: Keythedral
item.comment:
New in collection Dec.06 This is for me what Settlers of Catan should have been. Less random (no dice) and harder to master. I like the rule that you have to feed your farmers red wine in order to make them rowdy enough to destroy other players fences. Oh, and it's very neat that all the workers look different.
NL: Als mensen graag Kolonisten willen spelen: dit is het spel dat Kolonisten had moeten zijn! Weliswaar zonder kaartjesgeruil, maar ook zonder dobbelsteen, en verplicht met je ellebogen werken.

item.name: Khet 2.0
item.comment: Nice abstract with lasers.

item.name: Khet: The Laser Game
item.comment:
Lasers!
Cool abstract, bit too expensive. Would buy this immediately if I would find it at half price.

item.name: Khronos
item.comment:
Like it. It's a pretty fast and not so easy game. Plays well with 2 and 3, I like it best with 4. Probably too chaotic with 5.
I have the 2nd edition, so I really don't understand what all the fuzz about unclear rules is about. I find the rules pretty easy and straightforward.

item.name: Kill Doctor Lucky
item.comment:
Good fun party game. Can work hilariously with the right people. Using various ridiculous miniatures for players adds some smiles as well. First couple of rounds can be a bit boring if you don't use the spite tokens variant. And although it makes the game longer, I like the dog variant as well.
UPDATE: got the luxury version as well! Thanks Erik!
NL: Jij en je medespelers zijn te gast bij Dr. Lucky. Maar jullie haten 'm zo hartstochtelijk dat je 'm wilt vermoorden. Maar dat wil je natuurlijk perse zelf doen. En het kan alleen als niemand anders je ziet. Maar die Dr. Lucky loopt zo vlot door de kamers heen dat het best lastig is.
Leukste spel uit de Cheapass reeks: het spel is spotgoedkoop gemaakt en ziet er eigenlijk niet uit. Maar ik vind 'm wel leuk. Bord heeft 2 kanten (voor verschillende aantallen spelers)

item.name: Kill Doctor Lucky: Director's Cut
item.comment:
Good fun party game. Can work hilariously with the right people. Using various ridiculous miniatures for players adds some smiles as well. First couple of rounds can be a bit boring if you don't use the spite tokens variant. And although it makes the game longer, I like the dog variant as well.
UPDATE: got the luxury version as well! Thanks Erik!
NL: Jij en je medespelers zijn te gast bij Dr. Lucky. Maar jullie haten 'm zo hartstochtelijk dat je 'm wilt vermoorden. Maar dat wil je natuurlijk perse zelf doen. En het kan alleen als niemand anders je ziet. Maar die Dr. Lucky loopt zo vlot door de kamers heen dat het best lastig is.
Leukste spel uit de Cheapass reeks: het spel is spotgoedkoop gemaakt en ziet er eigenlijk niet uit. Maar ik vind 'm wel leuk. Bord heeft 2 kanten (voor verschillende aantallen spelers)

item.name: Kinderen van Catan
item.comment:
Only fun for kids. Luck driven washed down 'roll and move' version of Catan that hasn't got much to do with the original. Terrible game for grown-ups (rating 2), kids seem to enjoy it (rating 6-7).
Throw the dice, spin the board, everybody collects a piece if there is something there you don't already have. 3 different items: whoopie, place a house. First one to get rid of all houses and place the house with the green roof wins.
Although the board & pieces look ok, gameplay is totally crap because everything falls over all the bloody time. Man, I really dislike this poor rip off.
The plus side of this game: it makes you buy more (and hopefully better) games to play with your kid, because you hope he'll forget about this one.
Played with my son for the first time just before he became 3 years old. Unfortunately he still likes it after almost a year.

item.name: King of New York
item.comment: I think I prefer King of Tokyo.

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: Fun filler.

item.name: King of Tokyo: Power Up!
item.comment:
Decent expansion: adds some individuality to the different monsters, which is nice but doens't really change the rules.
But wow, that new panda is such a dud, no one in my group is willing to play with that stupid bear character.
Rating is for the cards only. I'll add them to every game once people got the hang off the basic game (which probably is after the first couple of minutes, but practically after the first game)

item.name: Kingdom Builder
item.comment:
Not bad, for a family style game. It's a typical Euro cubepusher with a theme painted on an abstract game, and there are not so much decisions to make. Which can be good with casual gamers I guess.
I'd even consider buying this if I found it dead cheap for playing with newbies or kids, because it feels less bad than Ticket to Ride. At least it has more replayability thanks to the different cards and maps. I can see why it won the Spiel des Jahres award.

item.name: Kingdoms
item.comment: Auf Heller und Pfennig, Nice filler, with enough tactics to warrant a couple of plays.

item.name: Kissenschlacht
item.comment: Stupid dexterity fun. Got to have it.

item.name: KLASK
item.comment: Brilliant dexterity game. At first you might think it's a more affordable version of Weykick. But it plays a lot more subtle than Weykick. Love this game. Best game I bought at Spiel 2015, and probably the best 10 minute game I have.

item.name: Kleine Gewitterhexe
item.comment: Bought for Wolf.

item.name: Koehandel
item.comment:
Koehandel. Fun filler card bluffing game. I'm kinda bad at this, but still fun anyway.
NL: erg leuk als iedere speler in de rol van Veemarkthandelaar kruipt. Goed blufspel.

item.name: Kohle & Kolonie
item.comment: Good economic gamer's game.

item.name: Kolejka
item.comment: Brilliant theme. Game works a lot better than expected. High on my wishlist after one play.

item.name: Kolonisten van Catan
item.comment:
Kolonisten van Catan Yes, maybe I should rate this one higher, as it restarted my interest in board games 10 years ago (bought the original German version way back). And it served quite well to get more people around me into boardgames.
For the first couple of years I had lots of fun with this, and would have rated it as an 8.
But I overplayed it (lots of people only wanted to play this game...) and got quite disappointed at the ridiculous amounts of expansions. Now the fun factor has quite gone for me. One of the few games that I'd rather not play anymore but still don't want to give a low rating (due to showing me the Euro-way)
I'm really not interested in playing this anymore (so I should rate it an 3) unless it's with the Citizens & Knights expansion. But after Puerto Rico, I rarely played that one either...

item.name: Kolonisten van Catan - Het Kaartspel
item.comment:
Kolonisten van Catan, het kaartspel Mmmm. Sometimes I like it, sometimes I don't. But I'd rather play this than the basic version of Settlers.
Don't like the downtime on this one. Guess I'm just bored too fast?

item.name: Kolonisten van Catan - Het Kaartspel - Ridders en kooplieden
item.originalname: Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Ritter & Händler
item.comment:
More cards. nothing really special.
NL: uitbreiding voor het Kolonisten Kaartspel. Doet me weinig. Zou 'm niet missen, dus overbodig.

item.name: Kolonisten van Catan - Steden & Ridders
item.comment:
Kolonisten van Catan: Steden & Ridders Yup, this is the expansion to own. Really adds depth in gameplay. And again "shame on you Klaus" for not including the 5-6 player parts.
Even though I think this is the best way to play Settlers, it's a bit too long for what it is, even with only 3 or 4 players. You can get better & tenser gameplay (for less money) nowadays...
NL: DE uitbreiding voor Kolonisten. Eigenlijk wil ik het niet meer zonder spelen...
Vond het vroeger fantastisch, maar ik heb tegenwoordig een kast vol spellen die ik minstens net zo goed of beter vind, en die stukken korter duren. Duurt dus inmiddels een beetje te lang voor wat het is. Blijft wel goed voor een gezellig avondje.

item.name: Kolonisten van Catan, De - Zeevaarders (uitbreidingsset voor 5 of 6 spelers)
item.comment:
Klaus, I want my money and shelf space back! Minus 1 point for this. (should have been included in the basic Seefarer expansion)
NL: uitbreidingsset om de Zeevaardersuitbreiding voor Kolonisten van Catan ook met 5 en 6 personen te kunnen spelen.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Kolonisten van Catan, Uitbreiding voor 5 of 6 spelers
item.comment:
Minus 1 point, since this "expansion" should have been included in the original (3-4 player) box.
NL: uitbreidingsset om Kolonisten van Catan met 5 of 6 spelers te kunnen spelen. Te duur voor wat het is.
(played this way at least 10 times before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: König von Siam
item.comment:
Initial rating after 2 plays with 2: Neat majority game, set in Thailand. Mechanics are different than most area control games. Feels like a hard one to master. "Deep" for such a short game.
NL: Mooi uitgevoerd relatief klein en kort strategisch spel zonder geluksfactor. Je probeert je invloed te vergroten in de partij die uiteindelijk Thailand het meest gaat overheersen. Verassend strategisch voor zo'n kort bordspel.

item.name: Kontor
item.comment:
New in collection may 2008
Although this game doesn't get much love here on BGG I'm interested in playing this one some more. Good 2-player game.
get past the introductional game, end get to play the advanced rules that come with the game for a tense game. Lots of interesting variants offered in the box as well.
NL: Wie is de gehaaidste handelaar in Amsterdam?
Prima 2-persoons spel..

item.name: Koryŏ
item.comment:
Maybe the best 'card game filler' from Essen 2013. Short sessions, and although there is luck in drawing the cards, it seems your decisions matter more.
The gamedesign is clever and clean: every round you draw one card less, and are able to keep one card more that you have played. I also like that the number of points for a 'family' is the same as the number of cards in that family.
And the best thing: choices become harder every round. Great filler that plays in little time. Recommended!

item.name: Kraków 1325 AD
item.comment:
Great artwork, fun cards.
But way too much luck for me in drawing the right cards to want to play it again.

item.name: Kremlin
item.comment: Original and fun. Can run a bit long, and it's hard to play well at first play. And there'll probably always be a certain chaos factor in this game, and the game can be unforgiving. So you'd better stay away if you're a diehard Knizia or Feld fanboy.

item.name: Kugelhund
item.comment:
Mediocre kids dexterity game. Not so easy. Probably best for 6+
In Wolf's collection.

item.name: L'Aéropostale
item.comment:
Good game, beautiful AND functionally good designed (which is a rare combination)
Enough interaction and theme, and I also like the ability to choose between shorter and longer scenarios.
I guess I should have picked this one up at Essen. I might have it their demotable had some free space...

item.name: Labyrinth
item.comment:
As a kid, I always wanted to have this.
The urge has left me...

item.name: Labyrinth
item.comment: ok kids game.

item.name: Das Labyrinth des Minotaurus
item.comment:
Played twice in Essen at the hotel with the designer. Nice "family style" game with 3 different phases that interact.
there seems to be plenty interaction, and the interaction between the 3 phases is interesting. It's just not my kinda game.
The box is very nice, the bits are ok (tiles should have been thicker), but for a game that get's sold for a lousy 7 euro's at Essen it's a hell of a bang for your buck.
Check it out, you might like it more than me.

item.name: Lancaster
item.comment:
Just like in Glen More by the same designer: The theme doesn't matter, it's a euro cubepusher, or worker pusher actually.
I like this one a lot better than the bone dry Glen More It's still kinda dry, but for some reason I enjoyed this one.

item.name: Las Vegas
item.comment:
I can see why people enjoy this light filler. It's just that I didn't feel the 'tension' in the first and probably only time I played this. So I think it's pretty boring.
Gets another point down for the 'box filled with air' factor. It should be very easy to play this with components pulled from other games everyone has lying around, so for me there's no point at all in buying this.
Update: played it again with a couple of my favorite players. Had more fun than during the first game. It's not really bad, but it's something you might pull out if you're in the mood for something really light and dicey.

item.name: Last Call: The Bartender Game
item.comment:
Fun filler. There's too little game in here for me, but I'm tempted to buy it because of the components (neat bottles and ice cubes)
Update: bought it 4 years later to play with my son, and as a filler.

item.name: Last Train to Wensleydale
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09
Initial rating after 1 play: Pretty tough game! Definitely not as "easy" as Tinner's Trail or Steel Driver.
Despite the quite fiddly set-up I enjoyed our first play a lot. Lot's of semi-familiar Wallace mechanics, but the game feels fresh. As always with Wallace it's very interactive.
I especially like the 3 different player orders. Keeps you on your toes.

item.name: Last Will
item.comment:
Allright for what it is: good working eurogame. Everything works together nicely. Wouldn't mind playing it again, but won't buy this.
It's basically one of those solitaire games that get's it's interaction from competition in choosing stuff from the same board.
Probably would have rated this higher if I would have 'felt' the theme more like some of my geekbuddies seem to do.

item.name: Leaping Lemmings
item.comment: I guess I expected a bit more from this one. Not a bad game, but not great either.

item.name: Lectio
item.comment:
Good game. It's a bit like poker without the bluffing (No, that's not necessarily a bad thing), played in rounds to get rid of your playing pieces.
The nice clacky stones do add to the gameplay, I'm enjoying playing this way more than I would with ordinary cards. Besides the fysical experience and looks: It's a lot easier to rearrange blocks than to rearrange cards for example.

item.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
item.comment:
Great game. Usually I don't like worker placement games, but I really enjoyed my first play of this one, probably because there's plenty of theme. And tough choices, enough possibilities etc.
Not so sure about the artwork, but didn't distract too much.

item.name: Legend: History of 1000 Miglia
item.comment:
I really had no fun at all playing this. It's more a simulation (with dice...) than a game, since the player with the best car will probably win.
Too much fiddliness for what it is. If you enjoy racegames better play the classic Speed Circuit. Or even Formula D / Motochamp / whatever.
Only for people that love simulations and/or are interested in old cars.
I can see the designer have put a lot of work in this, and it looks nice, so I hate to give this such a low rating, but I really rather not play this again.

item.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
item.comment: Mmm, not my kinda game. Ameritrash deckbuilder with a lot of downtime and boring gameplay. Should be convinced to try again, would probably try to avoid to play again. I'd rather play a 'standard' dicefest Ameritrash game instead.

item.name: Leonardo da Vinci
item.comment:
New in collection sept 07. Mike Doyle redesign version.
Initial rating after 1 full play: Glad my first session was with 2, this will be a hard one to win with 3 or 4...
It's quite a gamey Euro workerplace game. Nothing special. Actually kinda boring.
NL: uitvindersrace, gegoten in de typisch Duitse "ik zou meer willen doen dan ik kan" variant.
Ook ok te spelen met 2.
item.conditiontext: Only played twice.

item.name: Level X
item.comment: Fun fast filler

item.name: Level XI
item.comment: Ok variant, not necessary.

item.name: Levensweg
item.comment:
Yuck. I guess I have to be very drunk and/or sentimental to play this boring old game ever again.
(played ages ago, way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Libertalia
item.comment: I guess this can be a hit or a miss depending on the group you play it with. Ok game. Don't think I'd play this with more than 4.

item.name: Liberté
item.comment:
Initial rating:
And another one of those Wallace games that you have to play to learn. Fascinating gameplay, enjoyed this one as well.
NL: Spel van Martin Wallace (Age of Steam, Struggle of Empires) Deze keer is het thema de Franse revolutie.

item.name: Lift it!
item.comment: This is a hilariously funny dexterity game.

item.name: Light Speed
item.comment:
New in collection may 2008 Fast cheapass fun filler, plays in less than a minute, but counting points takes longer...
NL: supersnel & kort spel. Niet heel serieus, maar ook zo over.. Waarschijnlijk ook goed voor kids en voor dronkemansgelal.

item.name: Light Speed
item.comment: Probably the fastest playing game I have.

item.name: Lightning Reaction
item.comment: This is a blast.... Low replayability once the newness is over.

item.name: Linko!
item.comment: Fun card game.

item.name: Loco!
item.comment:
Little simple beer & pretzels game that can be a challenge.
NL: heel simpel maar tactisch tussendoortje. Supersnel kroegspel.
(played before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Logan Stones
item.comment:
Initial rating after a prototype play (with the final stones, not sure about rule changes):
Very disappointing game if you consider it's from the same designer as the brilliant game Hive. Even the mediocre Army of Frogs is way better.
It's just Rock Scissor Papers with nice clunky tiles, with the addition of a backside on the tile that flips around. Yes it's tactical. Not really strategical, and definitely not as exciting as you'd like it to be.

item.name: London
item.comment:
Good Wallace that's playable for more general boardgamers as well. As usual a good game system where money is always tight and loans are to be avoided.
One of the few 'multiplayer' Wallace games that are actually fun to play with 2 as well.

item.name: A Lone Banner
item.comment: Enjoyable dicy filler.

item.name: Longships
item.comment:
Good level of interactivity. There is a certain 'openness' in this game that I really enjoy.
Rules are pretty straightforward and logical once you accept that you influence the wind as a player...
It's in a way close to Serenissima, but I think I prefer this game better despite the 'home made' factor.

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment:
After playing it I knew for sure: had to have this game. It's a lot of stupid fun. Probably as much fun with adults as with kids. And that's a rare feat.
Oh, and if you're thinking of buying this game: don't buy the Bumblebee version, it's terribly build compared to this one.
[Update nov'09: got it in a mathtrade, woot]
item.wantpartslist: My toddler managed to lose 1 chicken... (I guess I have the 'reprint' version, don't know if the size is different between versions)

item.name: Lord of the Rings
item.comment:
Lord of the scripts...
Am I missing something? Was looking forward to playing this. Looks great, love the theme. But for me the game doesn't work. Way too scripted. One of those games I was glad it was over. Very disappointing.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
item.comment: Kinda like Stratego. Less bad though.

item.name: Lords of Creation
item.comment:
Lowered rating because of fiddly little counters for barbarians/civilized people, and the long & useless build phase. But basically still a nice idea. Game can sometimes be good fun.
Rules don't work good enough for 2 players though, experienced a 2-player game ending in Limbo.
(played 3 or 4 times before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Lords of Scotland
item.comment: Okeyish card filler. Works with 2. Not so special. Would not buy it again.

item.name: Lords of Vegas
item.comment:
Low complexity, enough ineraction. Reasonably fun.
But just not special enough to play it more, or even buy it.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: ok filler, probably find it cheap sometime

item.name: Lost Patrol
item.comment: Print & play version. Theme works quite well! Gets a bonus point for that. Fun dicefest with high luckfactor. Which I usually dislike.

item.name: Lost Valley
item.comment:
Initial rating: good game. Our first 3-player game went down so well we immediately wanted to play another one.
Good eurogame that has a theme that acutally fits the game.

item.name: Louis XIV: Ränkespiele am Hofe des Sonnenkönigs
item.comment:
New in collection april 07. Initial rating after first 2 plays with 2: After getting through the rulebook it plays a lot easier than expected. Second play went a lot faster than 100 minutes. Probably quite playable in 30/40 minutes once you know all the card effects. Before I discovered BGG I used to think it's a fun game to play with 2, now I just think it's a boring abstract. Maybe I should try this with 3 before I get rid of it. It probably gets too random /chaotic with 4 I presume.
Update: sold it.

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment:
The best '2-minute' game I know. Incredibly compact (only 14 cards) and fast, but still enjoyable.
Probably a good game to play with other players while your waiting for that A.P. player to take his turn. ('By the time we're done your turn is over')

item.name: LovePigs (Porcellini)
item.comment:
Initial rating: Played the game as a light childrens game with the designer. Innocent & fast that way.
Now I've read the 'real' rules here (my copy only has Italian rules...) I think it might be fun as well with drunk adults. Rating might go up if I play it this way.

item.name: Löwenherz
item.comment:
New in collection may 2008
Initial rating after one play: a lot better than Settlers. Nice balance in tactical versus strategical. If you try to play too strategic you lose...
Rating might go up after more plays.
NL lekker gemeen spel van de maker van Kolonisten. Landjepik, bieden, keuzes.

item.name: Luna
item.comment:
I was honestly surprised how disappointed this game got me. First of all, it's basically an abstract, since there's nothing that get's the theme across for me. And that wouldn't be so bad if the game was actually fun to play. It wasn't for me.
It's the same basic 'you want to do 3 things more than you can' and 'just make sure you do your orders in the right turn order' that I've seen in so many eurogames that I'm starting to wonder if I still like eurogames. When a game gives me that feeling it can't be a good sign.

item.name: M
item.comment: Decent abstract. Lot better than you'd expect (from watching the meh cover)

item.name: Die Macher
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree After almost 2 years I finally got to play this legendary game.
Initial rating: good game. Although I had expected a bit more. The final round seems to have a too big influence over the overall game. And there should be less dice-rolling, or more (to even out a bad roll) This first game with 5 took close to 5 hours, and for a game that long it should be a bit more thematic than pushing around cubes & betting... All the political porties are totally the same in this game, and although that's certainly a cynical thought I can understand, I think it's too far off reality to get the feeling you're really working on elections here by "trading" all the simplistic pro/contra views on issues.
I like the interactivity, and the way the tension slowly builds, we didn't have a dull moment. Basically the mechanics fit together nicely. But it just feels a bit too much of a long abstract with some luck thrown in.
But I'll certainly be willing to play it again to see if my opinion of this game improves.
NL: lang spel wat ondanks het oersaaie thema (Duitse verkiezingen) goed in elkaar steekt.

item.name: Machi Koro
item.comment:
Damn, this game is more fun than it should be.
Wanna wanna wanna!

item.name: Machiavelli
item.comment:
Nice little game. Fairly easy to explain. Works good with more people too. Easy to take along too, so makes for a good holiday/bar game.
It's one of those games that I rarely mention when somebody asks me what to play, but I usually still enjoy it when I play it. I like it better with 2 to 4 players than with more, I think the interactivity and tactical options are higher that way.
Rating used to be higher, have played this quite a bit since it came out. And it's usually suggested by someone who doesn't play much, so their turns take way too long. So when I play it I get a bit bored by other players spending too much time on their turn. Which tends to lead to too much tabletalk, so the game takes even longer...
This game is great fun when played in 45 minutes. Last 2 plays lasted 90 and 160. Not much fun that way.
NL: Tactisch/strategisch rollenkiesspel waarbij je als eerste 8 zo duur mogelijke gebouwen wilt bouwen in 5 kleuren. Doordat elke rol een ander foefje heeft moet je erg je tegenstanders in de gaten houden, anders wordt je snel vermoord door de moordenaar, of bestolen door de dief.

item.name: Machiavelli: De Donkere Landen
item.comment:
Expansion with 8 new character cards, doesn't change much to the original.
NL: uitbreiding voor Machiavelli. 8 nieuwe karakterkaarten + nieuwe gebouwen.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment:
My mood swings about this one. On the plusses is a nice looking, exciting card game. On the downside the ubergeekiness of a lot of the players, and the "collectible" commercial factor.
(played before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)
