item.name: Magical Athlete
item.comment: This game is more fun than it should be.

item.name: Magical Maze
item.comment:
Kids game. Also fun to play once (if in the right mood) after a couple of beers. Probably best with 3 or 4.
NL: Kinderspel met een tovenaar die een pot goud (magneetje) uit een onzichtbaar doolhof moet zien te loodsen.

item.name: Maharadja: Paleizenbouw in India
item.originalname: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
item.comment:
New in collection 2006. Played it with 3 & 4. Very balanced game, very interactive & good fun. If you're able to grasp the nature of the game, that is.... Screw your neighbor? Just screw everybody...
NL: Fijn spel waar je elkaar continu probeert voor te zijn...
Mooi om te zien ook.

item.name: Mahé
item.originalname: Die heisse Schlacht am kalten Buffet
item.comment: Simple dice rolling race fun. Rated as a game to play with kids.

item.name: Manhattan
item.comment:
New in collection august 07
Enjoyable family game, easy rules, quick setup, so good for a quick game as well. Nice mixture of some luck (card draw) and tactics. Next time I'll try the Godzilla variant as well.
3d wolkenkrabber bouwspel van de maker van Puerto Rico.
In 1 minuut uit te leggen: probeer in 6 steden zowel de hoogste als de meeste wolkenkrabbers te bouwen, waarbij je bij voorkeur steden van de rest afpikt.

item.name: The Manhattan Project
item.comment:
After one play it got on my wishlist. I usually don't like worker placement games that much. But this one I really like. Lots of interaction, not so much scripted play. It beats Caylus, Pillars of the Earth way behind in the dust.
The lack of "gaeturns" is great. Place your guys or get 'em back. And you have to watch the other players. The 'spionage' action keep you on your toes. Oh, and I really like the artwork. If you like worker placement games you have to check this one.

item.name: The Manhattan Project: Nations Expansion
item.comment: Fun little extra. Can't see why it isn't included in the basic game.

item.name: MaNiKi!
item.comment:
Maniki Nice quick filler. Love those animals. Kids game, but can be fun with grown ups as well.
Rating is valid for 5-10 minute play (just agree to play by time, or play less tiles), after that the fun rating probably drops too fast.
NL: Als dompteur moet je de 3 (houten) beesten zo snel mogelijk van de ene positie naar de andere commanderen.
Leuk voor een kort potje, bedoeld als kinderspel.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Manilla
item.comment:
New in collection dec. 07
Gorgeous looking family game.
NL: speculeren, handeltjes & gokjes met goederen die wel of niet gaan aankomen waar jij wilt. Van de maker van Dos Rios en Container.
Leuk spel met gok, bluf en gelukselementen.

item.name: Manimals
item.comment:
Fun kids game where you can learn a lot about animals. Good kids stuff that adults can enjoy too.
There are plenty of variants in the rules to cater to different playing groups.
Educatief kinderspel. En het is nog leuk en interesant ook!

item.name: Maria
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09 GREAT game! Although it's a 3-player game, it might even be better than it's predecessor Friedrich (which is a 4-player game).
So will the designer come up with a true 2-person game in this fashion next time? Sign me up for pre-order!

item.name: Martian Dice
item.comment:
It's pretty dumb, brainless & mostly luck.
But for some reason I like it, because it's pretty easy to have fun ending a game night with a riotous session of this.
The theme & artwork (dice) do help.
It's also a fun game to play with kids. Started to play this with my son when he was 4,5

item.name: Master Fox
item.comment: Fun kids game.

item.name: Master Merchant
item.comment:
Short tactical 'deckbuilder', with some unique features: all possible cards available from the start, 2 different end conditions, no real discards. Really plays in 15 minutes. I'd like to play it more. Seems have more possibilities/debth than most fillers.
Pro: quite interactive, open information, no randomness, tiny box. Con: artwork /card layout & typeface

item.name: Mastermind
item.comment:
Only reason I still have this is nostalgia.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Masterplan
item.comment: Nice abstract. Too bad the box is so big.

item.name: Mayan Sun, Aztec Destiny: 500 BC – AD 2012 – Beyond∞
item.comment: Rating is for family version. Would like to play the expert version.

item.name: McMulti
item.comment:
Fairly easy rules. Nice plastic bits.
I'd expected this old classic to play better, but our first and so far only game slowed down too much. Just because we rarely rolled doubles, which seems to be essential for the gameflow. Disappointing, because the idea is nice, the game looks great for it's age, and there should be enough tension rulewise.
Maybe I should just trade/sell this one.

item.name: Meander
item.comment:
Initial rating: Nice looking abstract. Fun to play, and potentially good, but would have been nice if the tiles wouldn't slide so easily when placed.
But there seems to be a big flaw: It looks like the little balls don't always follow the same route when placed again. This influences the outcome of the game way too much.

item.name: Medici
item.comment: Better than I had expected. Enjoyed a Knizia. That's not so common for me.

item.name: Medina
item.comment:
Underrated beautiful game. Starts relaxed, and get's tense along the way.
NL: Vind dit eigenlijk een klassieker. Simpel, maar toch mooi 3d ook. Je bouwt met zijn allen een oude stad terug op. Maar je moet wel op tijd paleizen voor jezelf confisceren.

item.name: Megastar
item.comment:
New in collection may 2008
Weird cardgame. Feels more random than it seems to be. Hard to give a rating after just two plays. I don't think it's top notch, but it's reasonably entertaining and there seems to be strategy.
NL: maf kaartspel waarbij je artiesten in de top3 probeert te krijgen.
item.conditiontext: Good

item.name: Mégawatts
item.comment:
This is a 'shill' rating, because it's my only means of saying 'screw this stupid system' where there are multiple entries of the same game. That's what we have 'versions' for.
This is the exact same GAME as Funkenschlag / Power Grid / Hoogspanning / whatever it's called in different languages.
The only difference is one side of the map. If you know Funkenschlag / Power Grid you know that there are loads of maps available. Including the one included here.
I love Funkenschlag, it's one of my favorite games. I'll edit my rating when the games is merged back again to where it belongs.

item.name: Meltdown 2020
item.comment:
Light fillerish game that looks good despite the sort of cheapish 'vehicles'.
In hindsight I'm glad I didn't pick it up. Not so good.

item.name: Memory
item.comment: My kid sometimes wants to play this. So that's when I play it.

item.name: Merchants & Marauders
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 2-player session: yeah, I like it. Captures a 'merchant / marauder' feel quite nicely.
Probably needs 3 players for the amount of interactivity I prefer, but even with 2 there's enough going on that captivates my attention.

item.name: Mesopotamien
item.comment:
New in collection july 08 One of my gaming buddies bought this quite a while ago, but we haven't played it yet (I'm usually the one who figures out the rules to games). It looks so pretty, and I could got it for cheap, so I bought one to figure out so we'll finally play this...
Turns out it's actually a nice Eurogame. Nothing really special, but enough interaction, gamelength is just right, plenty of possibilities. Good enough to enjoy and want to play again. Meanwhile the tiles and gameparts are definitely great to look at as well.
Update feb 14: after playing it again it was more fun than expected. Nice euro.
NL: Erg mooi uitgevoerd bordspel. Voor de spelletjesfreak niet super bijzonder, maar gewoon een prima spel, niet te lang, niet te kort, spannend, en genoeg mogelijkheden om te twijfelen hoe je het beste jezelf vooruit helpt en je tegenstanders dwarszit.

item.name: Message to the Czar
item.comment:
Feels like a slightly improved version of Barricade. Yawn.
Update: got rid of it.

item.name: Metro
item.comment:
All my friends seem to like this one better than I do. But at least this is more fun to play than Carcassone with beer and pretzels. Would rate it higher if I had something to do in between turns besides bitching at the other players for screwing up my routes.
Check the free computer version to see if you like it. It's actually pretty well made, and easier to play than the board version, but the A.I. is pretty tough. And the good thing: the computer isn't looking all over the board to see where the newest piece fits the best...
NL: Makkelijk snel legspel. Tegeltjes leggen om voor jou zo lang mogelijke Metro routes te maken. De routes van je tegenstanders mogen natuurlijk zo kort mogelijk...
Best veel mensen vinden 'm leuk, ik vind het hooguit wel aardig. Blijft in de collectie omdat Heleen en andere speelmakkers 'm leuk vinden.
Update Oct09: just played the new version (Cablecar) and remembered why I dislike the game. The new version has an improved shares variant which is actually a little better, but I still didn't like it. So I downgraded my rating for this more boring version even further.

item.name: Metropolis
item.comment:
Ok Sid Sackson classic.
Quite good for a 1984 game.

item.name: Metropolys
item.comment:
New in collection july 08
I don't understand all the fuzz about the artwork, I think it's beautiful. Good game too. Initial rating after two plays with 2. Quite strategic that way, and I really like the build mechanism that sort of works like the Ra bidding mechanism. Totally different game than Ra though
NL: Als stedebouwkundige tegen elkaar opbieden voor de beste plaatsjes voor je gebouwen in de stad. Goed doordenkspel.

item.name: Mexica
item.comment:
New in collection march 07 Completed collecting the Mask trilogy (or quadrology) with this.
Initial feel: better than Tikal, but not as good as Java.
NL: uit dezelfde serie als Tikal en Java. Mooi vormgegeven spel.

item.name: Micropul
item.comment:
Selfmade version, print & play. After first 2 plays: Great little abstract looking tile-laying game. I could easily rate this one much higher if I would consider the "for free" factor. I think everybody should give this a try, since it's so easy to make: Just print it out on heavy paper (I upsized it a bit, and printed it on one 200 grams sheet) Cut it with scissors, ready to play in 5 minutes. Makes an incredible small game to take anywhere (I'll definitely try this on a plane) Update: best free holiday game! Fun, tactical, fast. Rating goes up half a point.
Update: after 2 years: it's been in the top 3 of my most played games.

item.name: Middle-Earth Quest
item.comment:
Lots of mechanics acting together. A lot of familiar parts (encounters and favors (like clues) a la Arkham Horror, battle cards a la lots of games). It all seems to work fine but it doesn't feel fresh.
This could be a good game, but my first play (with 4) left me quite unsatisfied. Got pretty much stuck with 2 corruptions, Sauron kept on taking away my favors to get rid of them, etc.
For such a very long & thematic game I'd like to have a bit more control, otherwise it might just have been the usual Ameritrash. (And yes, the 3 heroes did communicate about what to do, it just didn't work out that way.)
Initial rating is how I feel about the game after just played it for the first time. (For what it's worth: I really like FFG's Starcraft and Red November. And I enjoy the thematic Arkham Horror)
It might have been this particular session as both the experienced players stated this was a curious game, but I don't feel the urge to play another 4 hour session of this when there are so many other long thematic games that I've enjoyed. Hence the low rating.

item.name: Mijnlieff
item.comment: For some reason I find this a tough game to play right.

item.name: Milestones
item.comment:
If I hadn't played so much games I might have felt this one was ok.
But now it's just another soulless euro multiplayer solitaire cubepusher. Quite meh.

item.name: Milestones
item.comment: meh. Bit boring filler that should be shorter for what it is.

item.name: Mini Funny Bunny
item.comment: Boring kids game. Gets old quick.

item.name: Minos
item.comment:
First play: Nice bits. Some Risk-like elements, but better gameplay. Actually felt like a nice mix of Settlers and Risk (Yes, that means I do prefer this to both..)
NL: ondergewaardeerd spel hier. Ideaal voor mensen die Risk en Kolonisten kennen en iets anders willen wat leuker is dan die twee spellen!
(played it once 2-player in 2005 or 2006, before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Mississippi Queen
item.comment:
Bought on Ebay incl. expansion. Yes, the boats are a bit fiddly and the numbers do let loose too easily, but besides that a fun family game.
NL: Stoombotenrace over de steeds langer wordende rivier. Onderweg moet je ook nog 2 moppies oppikken. Leuk spelprincipe.

item.name: Mississippi Queen: The Black Rose
item.comment: NL: uitbreiding voor Mississippi Queen, nu ook geschikt voor 2 en 6 spelers + extra (betere) opties: de zwarte "spook"boot die bestuurd wordt door de meest achterliggende speler en meer soorten rivier.

item.name: Moai
item.comment: Nasty game. In case you expect a casuel nice pretty Eurogame: Be prepared for death & destruction. You will make enemies during this game...

item.name: Molenspel
item.comment:
Played this as a kid against my dad. He always won. Not too sure if I'll like it now... If I remember correctly it's too hard to catch the runaway leader, and since this is a 2-player game I'll have to be convinced to play this again. I don't mind abstracts though, so I could be convinced.
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Mollenmania
item.comment: Fun kids game, enjoyable with adults as well. Does have a runaway leader problem: when someone has more moles after the first round, he's likely to win.

item.name: Monastery
item.comment:
After 3 plays with 2 I can only state that this game is still a lot harder than it seems.
Although the looks resemble Carcassone, gameplay has nothing to do with it, and it's certainly no family game. One "stupid" mistake can cost you the game.
But I think it probably needs to be played with 3 or 4 to live the full experience.
I really want to like this game, but it's hard having real fun when it feels this hard...

item.name: Monkey Dash
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09 after a play with the enthusiastic designer. Immediately played it later that night at the hotel.
Even though I lost both times I really enjoy this fun little game. The pieces look great, it plays fast, it's not too easy (as I found out), and I want to play it AGAIN.

item.name: Moongha Invaders: Mad Scientists and Atomic Monsters Attack the Earth!
item.comment:
Unique & slightly weird Wallace game. It's an Ameriweuro!
I'm glad I bought a copy, despite some familiar mechanisms this is an unique game, that gives loads of fun while playing it.

item.name: Mord im Arosa
item.comment: Fun game. Maybe a bit too long for what it is, but lots of fun.

item.name: Mordred
item.comment:
After playing it, I want it more. 'Easy' and quick Wallace. Probably plays well with 3 as well. Love the different end conditions.
Update: got it in a trade!
After 4 games: I like the concept of the game. As usual with an early Wallace it's not so smoothed out as his current Treefrog games. Games can turn out short or long, agressive or cooperative, depending on groupthink and dicerolls. Enjoyable game overall. One of those 4 session ran a bit too long, really should be played in an hour max. It's more a gamer's game than appears on first sight.

item.name: MotorChamp
item.comment: Tough racing game. I like it better than Formule D

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment:
Nice quick & fun deduction game with probably enough depth to last at least a couple of games. Must have for deduction fans. And got on my "must have" list after 1 play.
Still like it after a couple of plays more.
NL: Verassend goede 2-persoons "whodunit". De ene speler speelt de detective, de ander de moordenaar. Binnen 8 rondes moet de detective de moordenaar ontdekken, maar dat gaat niet vanzelf.

item.name: Munchkin Water
item.comment: This isn't a game. It's promotional bullshit.

item.name: Mundus Novus
item.comment:
Better than I expected. The fun in my first game got a bit spoiled by overly slow players (session took more than 2 hours!) so I expect the rating to go up eventually.
Update: after some more plays I think this game is not gettng all the love and attention it deserves here on BGG. It's fun to play, it's interactive, it's .... Let's just say this is actually quite a good game.
My 7 is actually quite a good rating for me. Might be other's 8 or 9.

item.name: The Mushroom Eaters
item.comment:
Man, this is probably the most wonderful game I bought at Spiel 2013. Immediately played it the next day and we a great time.
This is one of the most atmospheric games I've ever played.
The foldable board works brilliant together with the 3d glasses. It's the only boardgame I know where 3d glasses really add to the playing feel. There was no 'waiting on other players to take a turn' because I was happily gazing at the board in the meantime. I bet this game is as close to a trip as a boardgame can get. Most of us were giggling, gazing and behaving like we were actual trippers.... (we were sober and without any drugs)
Glad I was on time in Essen for the boxed version.

item.name: Mutton
item.comment: Bought at Essen 2009 from the publisher, who didn't have a stand but brought some games with him that people had asked about. Nice game, well produced. Good fun.

item.name: Mykerinos
item.comment:
Although I won my first play (2-player), it felt quite 'meh' afterwards.
Played it again against another Boardgamegeek. Cubepushing Yawnfest.
I've put it on my tradepile.
item.conditiontext: Very good, rarely played.

item.name: Myrmes
item.comment: Good gamers game. Plenty of theme, decisions etc. I like it.

item.name: Mystery of the Abbey
item.comment:
The beautiful board & pieces really add to the "Name of the rose" atmosfear of this "whodunnit".
I've played this a couple times over the years, but never got really excited about it. It might have been because it probably needs a certain kind of players to make this fun. Just didn't happen that way the times I tried it with people.
Since it doesn't hit the table that much, and I haven't played it much the last 4 years it's on my tradelist now.
NL: Tijdens je overnachting in het mooie klooster wordt een monnik vermoordt. Aan jou de taak om uit te zoeken wie van de 24 monniken het gedaan heeft. Prachtig uitgevoerd spel, waarbij je ook informatie van je medespelers krijgt.
item.conditiontext: Good. One of the six monkeeples is a miscast: it misses a tiny part. Nothing too serieus.

item.name: Mythotopia
item.comment: Enjoyed my first play, despite some missing wooden pieces. I think I like this one better than A Few Acres of Snow.

item.name: Namibia
item.comment:
Great brainburning game.
Your first game will be a learning game. Even if you're used to play gamer's games.
I think this game is currently pretty underrated here on the geek. I guess it made some brains burn too hard or made some visions too blurred?

item.name: Nemo's War
item.comment:
After losing my first 2 games very disgraceful I can only say: tough game!
Like the other Victory Point Games this is quite 'dicy' as well. I would have liked to have a bit more control... (dice don't seem to like me)

item.name: Neue Heimat
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09
Fun trickery bidding game with high screwage factor.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment:
Yeah! Dirty mining, kill 'm all space exploration.
NL: Space Uberrisk met grondstofmijnbouwmechaniek om meer legers te kopen.

item.name: Niets aan te geven.
item.comment:
Little bluffing game.
NL: Bluffen aan de grens...
In wisselende bezetting: 1 persoon is douanier, de rest komt er langs, al dan niet met smokkelwaar.

item.name: Nomads of Arabia: The Wandering Herds Game
item.comment:
Initial rating after one play: coming from the same company that brought us the great Jet Set I expected a bit more I guess.
It's not a bad game, but to me it feels too much luckdriven.

item.name: Notre Dame
item.comment:
Initial rating after first 2 plays: 6,5 Nice game in Puerto Rico / El Grande / Louis XIV Eurostyle. Works with 2 as well. Once you get the hang of it, it plays a lot faster than the usual gamer's euro. Theme is pasted on, but not as bad as the average Knizia. Doesn't matter to me that much (I can appreciate a good abstract as well) I like the nice looking modular board & artwork. The hardest decision is which card too keep and which too give away to your neighbour. That's the only real player interaction part as well, but it's a constant confrontation....
Revisited this game a couple of years later, and obviously my taste in games has changed, or this has aged really fast. Felt like an average slightly boring euro this time. Downgraded my rating. Glad I never bought it.

item.name: Nuns on the Run
item.comment: Ok filler that's actually a bit too long for what it is to be a 'fun filler'.

item.name: O Zoo le Mio
item.comment:
Short & fast family style game with easy explained rules. Still lot of tactics, and thematicly stronger than expected. What's not to like?
NL: Vlot kort dierentuin-opbouw spel voor 2 tot 4 spelers. Leuk met makkelijke regels.

item.name: Obstgarten
item.comment: Wolf's collection Beautiful looking game, good for toddlers. Not much of a game for older kids or grown ups, but it's a fun activity to play with young 'uns.

item.name: oddball Äeronauts
item.comment:
Initial rating after first 2 plays of the (pre kickstarter) Print 'n Play version (jan. '14):
Nice short & fresh feeling filler. Unique in the sense that you play the game totally in your hands, without needing tablespace.
I like how the 'discard' and 'recover' mechanisms work. Want to play it with more people.

item.name: Of Mice and Lemmings
item.comment: Semi hidden identities and some tricks make it an OK filler. We had fun playing a session.

item.name: Oh-Wah-Ree
item.comment: Mancala in a 3M bookshelf version

item.name: Old Men of the Forest
item.comment: This is a very disappointing game, even for a filler. There is only an illusion of control. Luck factor (initial hand) is way too high.

item.name: Olympus
item.comment:
Worker placement card game euro
First session with 5 took way too long. Probably thanks to a very AP prone player who needed to think every bloody time whether to follow or not, and what action to choose, or what card to play.
I guess I'll never play this game with 5 again. This game would be good if it took 90 minutes too play (as opposed to more than 3 hours for our session) Probably takes too long for what it is with normal players as well.

item.name: Omen: A Reign of War
item.comment: Played a solo '2-player' test game and a first two player session. Great little card wargame with nice balance of tactics and strategies for such a short game. Warning: tons of nasty battering possibilities. No game for wussies.

item.name: One More Barrel
item.comment:
Let's steal oil uhm no bring democracy!
Initial rating, immediately given enthusiastically after 1 play that took hours.
We all had such a blast playing this Weurogame.
It's a gamer's game, with all the good interaction and elbowing needed. And meanwhile with a great cynical politica/economical theme.
NL: Ellebogen en knokspel: onder het mom van democratie val je een land binnen om er zoveel mogelijk olie uit te slepen.

item.name: One Night Werewolf
item.comment:
Bizarre short werewolf variant. I like the cool looking (8bit style) & sturdy tiles and the miniature size. We played it with 3, had fun, but suspected it might be broken at that player amount. Probably best played with at least 4, I guess it's best with 5 or 6.
It's over before it outstays it's welcome, so I guess it's a nice inbetweenie or pub game. (A noisy background would be better than a silent room)

item.name: Onirim
item.comment: Not as good as I'd hoped it to be. OK enough to pass the time.

item.name: Operation
item.comment: Dokter Bibber. This used to be fun as a kid. UPDATE: Holy moly, they're still selling this just like I remember it! Iguess that means it's a classic...

item.name: Origins: How We Became Human
item.comment:
Initial rating after one (long) play:
Didn't live up to my expectation. Despite the scientific background, theories etc. it felt like way too much like average cube pushing and card drawing, especially after the first two hours.
Feels like there is not enough game in here to validate a 4 hour play. The randomness of the cards, luck of the draw and the dice play to big a role for me to have real fun at first play. the only reason I still rate it a 6 instead of something less is that I'm inclined to try it again to see if I missed something. So rating goes either up or down, but won't stay this way.
Oh, by the way: The design of the rulebook is a horrible mess: English and german bits thrown in a chaotic jumble. The rules themselves are not bad, but the way they are presented now is a nightmare for your eyes.
I'm really glad a geekbuddy tought me the game, would have been hard otherwise.
All the design mistakes that CAN be made WERE made. A doubtful honour.
Please Phil, let a designer look at your artwork and rulebooks and stuff before you put out your next game. It would make a difference.

item.name: Ortus
item.comment:
Initial rating: this is the kinda abstract game I don't like. Although I like the artwork on the box, and even the standard wooden player pieces look nice I just didn't enjoy this one at all. Played once in the basic and once in the 'real rules' version.
For an abstract game it feels the rules are not 'logical' enough. I prefer the simplicity and 'elegancy' of the gipf game rulesets.
And as far as the 'advanced' rules go: I'd much rather play Hive, because those rules make more sense to me. Too bad, would have loved to rate this game higher.

item.name: Outpost
item.comment: After playing the knockoffs (Sceptre of Zavandor & Phoenicia) I found out the original is the best one. Too bit it get's a bit too mathy, otherwise my rating could be higher. This is the first game where I can see an app to really come in handy...

item.name: Pachisi
item.comment: Brrr, why didn't this game just die?

item.name: Packeis am Pol
item.comment:
Although my girlfriend is not an abstract-lover, she' really interested in playing this one. One of the rare abstracts that you can play with 2 to 4 players.
NL: Met pinguins over ijsschotsen hupsen om de meeste vissen op te eten (en je tegenstander eenzaam op een onbereikbare ijsschots achter te laten)

item.name: Palastgeflüster
item.comment:
A game can hardly get smaller than this: basically a pack of cards (like Meuterer, Verräter, Kutschfahrt zum Teufelsberg etc.)
Short, interactive & fun. That's the way a filler should be. On the buylist after one play.

item.name: Palmyra
item.comment: Initial rating: euro tile laying game. Not a genre I usually like. But after playing it I think I want to play this one again, so hence the 7. Might increase to a 7,5 eventually. Enough (indirect) interaction.

item.name: Pandemie
item.comment:
For me this is a "family style" game: easy rules, short gameplay and "nice" (cooperative), so I hesitated quite a while before I bought it. But it's better than I thought it would be.
NL: meest toepasselijke spel van het moment: samen opbrekende virus epidemien onderdrukken.

item.name: Paris Connection
item.comment: expected a bit more from this one. It's ok, but nothing more than that. And the setup time is too long compared too gamelenght.

item.name: Paris Paris
item.comment:
O.k. area control game. Nothing special, nothing really bad. Bit too average in general.
The bus theme fits ok with the "grand tour" mechanism. Scoring mechanism are ok and not too 1-dimensional.
For gamers: The kinda game you don't mind playing, but won't suggest quickly either.
I added half a point since I played it with a "Schacht-hater" and I still thought it was allright ;-)
Add another half point if you're into "family" games with just enough screwage amount.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment: This really is not my kinda game. Too much luck based dice rolling. No deep decisions. All mechanics, didn't feel any theme.

item.name: Patience
item.comment: Only to be played when really bored, and nothing interesting to do around.

item.name: Peloponnes
item.comment:
Good economic euro with an ancient civ-lite theme.
Passed on it first time around: same old boring 'ancient' cover, artwork functional but dull, but after playing it at a geekbuddy I found out there's a neat game under the hood. Basically a cube pusher, but for some reason it doesn't bother me, since the various tiles seem to make sense.
What's special about this one is that it's pretty quick. I guess it's playable in 45 minutes.
Solo game works well too. And since the expansions make it playable up to 7 players this one could always be an option to get on the table.

item.name: Peloponnes Erweiterung
item.comment: The sea tiles make a nice addition, without changing the game too much. Good expansion. Rating same as base game.

item.name: Pentago
item.comment:
Played at Essen 2007. Nice quicky. The rotating board is a nice touch.
Ordered it jan. 08
NL: vlot 2-persoons abstract spelletje, uitgelegd in 10 seconden speelbaar in 10 minuten.
Soort 5 op een rij met draaibaar bord.

item.name: Perikles
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Initial rating: A typical Martin Wallace game in the sense that it's captivating & no downtime, various options, the possibility of temporary alliances, and the combination of wargame & strategic euro.
Or a non-typical Wallace because of the dice mechanism that's used to resolve the battles?
Good game, plays well with 3 (but is probably better with 4 or 5)
NL: Oorlogje voeren in het oude Griekenland. Ondanks de dobbelstenen niet bepaald op een cliche manier. Spannend spel.

item.name: Perudo
item.comment:
Perudo.
Dicegame slightly similar to what we call "pokerdobbelen"(poker dice), but with 5 dice and higher luck factor, so less fun.

item.name: Pharaoh Code
item.comment: Doing math under time pressure is not fun, and definitely not a game to me.

item.name: Phoenicia
item.comment:
Initial rating after 3 2-player games: nice 'civ-lite' card game, that's actually pretty low on theme. Theme fits better than the other 'Outpost variant' Zepter von Zavandor, and the rulebook is a lot better. Game plays faster too, so Zavandor can probably go on the tradepile.
Will have to play it with more to be sure how good it is.

item.name: Pick-a-Pig
item.comment:
Fun & fast filler. Set collecting, no strategies. It's also one of those 'you have to be fast' things, so definitely not recommended for A.P. people, strategists, and other people that only play 'serious' games.
I like it though.

item.name: Pickomino
item.comment: Dicy filler. Not so serious, luck driven dice game "can't stop" style. Not bad. But not keen on buying it.

item.name: Pico 2
item.comment:
Little fast playing card game by Doris & Frank.
In hindsight a predecessor to those hip japanese minimalist card games...
NL: supersnel klein kaartspel. Goed om 5 minuten wachttijd vermakelijk mee te vullen.

item.name: Pinguin Panic
item.comment: Ok kids dexterity game.

item.name: Pinguin-Party
item.comment: Good funny filler, easy rules, no luck. On my wishlist after one play.

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Really good looking dexterity race game. Feels like a tabletop version crossover between midgetgolf & bowling.
It's the kinda game that get's everyone enthusiastically howling, so it's fun at parties at well... Good for creating a great enthusiastic atmosfear. Results go down with beer, but the fun doesn't.
NL: Mooi uitgevoerd houten racespel waarbij je de "racewagens" met je vingers door de baan schiet. Oppassen dat je niet te hard schiet (vlieg je uit de baan of over de vangrail), maar wel hard genoeg om de rest voor te komen en te blijven.
Goed voor ontzettend dikke pret. Sjoelen voor deze eeuw.

item.name: PitchCar Extension
item.comment: You need this if you're a PitchCar fan.

item.name: PitchCar Extension 2
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree Extension for Pitchcar
NL: uitbreidingsset voor Pitchcar om langere banen te maken.

item.name: PitchCar Special Long Straights
item.comment:
Makes it easier to build big tracks, yay!
Pitchcar uitbreiding: 2 extra lange rechte stukken

item.name: PitchCar: Stunt Race
item.comment:
Height expansion for PitchCar. Cool thought, but way too expensive for what it is. I want wooden blocks for that amount of money! (Lower rating for crappy components)
NL: met PitchCar een grote brug maken. Cool!

item.name: Planet Busters
item.comment:
Ameritrash beer 'n pretzels game with high luck factor (cards drawing, very dicey)
I expected it to be better. Maybe the advanced game is slightly more fun?
Material is poor quality: drawing bag is too small, cards too flimsy.
item.conditiontext: Excellent. Was brand new. Only played once.

item.name: Plato 3000
item.comment: Nice card filler

item.name: Ploy
item.comment:
New in collection june 07 Space chess from the seventies. Looks kinda neat if you like plastic bits.
NL: 2-persoons schaakvariant met ruimtescheepjes. Makkelijk uit te leggen: Een beurt bestaat uit het vooruitzetten OF van richting veranderen van 1 van je speelstukken. Ze mogen zo ver vooruit als ze ribbeltjes hebben ( 1 tot 3)

item.name: Polarity
item.comment:
New in collection july 08
Weird magnetic dexterity game. Rating is low because of low replayability factor, but man it's an experience in itself. The sight of the hovering pieces combined with "feeling the force" is quite special in a boardgame.
Rating might go up if I'll start playing it with my son once he's old enough, or if it keeps bringing me fun by showing/playing it with people who haven' seen it, and enjoy this wonderful magnetic game as well.

item.name: Politico: The Fall of Caesar
item.comment:
From playing a 3-player simulation and 1 3-player game I suspect I'll be having a lot of fun playing this smart cardgame.
Great mechanics, good original game that plays fast. Thumbs up!

item.name: Poo: The Card Game
item.comment: Nice dumb fun in a pure take that card filler.

item.name: PornStar
item.comment:
Feb 07. Print 'n play. Played once with 2. Should be played with at least 4 players and a couple of beers. And probably less cards.
But kinda funny for the right rowdy mood. And there's quite a nice high "screw the other players" factor in this one....
Ranzig kaartspel (zonder vieze plaatjes hoor) waarbij je probeert zo goed mogelijk verkopende sexfilms te maken. En daarvoor pik je uiteraard de acteurs van je concurrenten voor in als je dat zo uitkomt.
Niet geschikt voor kinderen, niet leuk voor mensen die de humor van filmtitels als "Shaving Ryan's Privates" niet kunnen waarderen.

item.name: Power $truggle
item.comment: Best worker placement Euro of 2009. Buy it if that's your niche. Pretty damn good for the rest of us too if you like ton's of screwage in an Euro.

item.name: Power Grid: Northern Europe/United Kingdom & Ireland
Power Grid: The First Sparks
item.comment:
OK variant on Funkenschlag. Plays faster than the original. Cards are nice.
Update: gave away to a friend who likes it better than the original Funkenschlag/Power Grid

item.name: Das Prestel Nasenspiel
item.comment: Ok tile laying game. The 10 different noses are sometimes hard to distinguish, making the game harder (not a bad thing)

item.name: Princes of the Renaissance
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 4-player game: Very interactive! Loads of stuff going on, original gameplay. Want to play this more to find out about all the possibilities. Thumbs up!
NL: Origineel en goed spel van Martin Wallace (Age of Steam, Struggle of Empires) Deze keer is het thema de Renaissance tijd in Italie. Bieden, controle, verraad, etc, en dat allemaal zonder pion op het bord.

item.name: Project Kells: Sacred Hill, High Kings of Tara & Poisoned Chalice
item.comment:
Initial rating after playing the easy ("Sacred Hill") variant: Good looking abstract game, but it doesn't reach the awesomeness of for example the Gipf games.
2 bothersome bad points: The rules for all the "variants" (for which gamepieces are in the box) are only available online. So good luck if you're trying to read them in 20 years...
The "bridges" don't seem to have any function except making the game look better. But they're quite cumbersome to place when you have a big "kingdom", and are basically just a hassle to place. If I'd be enamoured with this game I probably wouldn't bother with them.
All in all it rates just a bit too high on the meh factor...
NL: mooi abstract spel dat middelmatig speelt.

item.name: Prophecy
item.comment:
First impression: This is the game Talisman should have been. This feels like a game where Talisman just feels like luck of the roll.
NL: avonturiersspel waarbij je al knokkend (met dobbelstenen & opbouw van ervaring) je karakter ontwikkeld tot een grotere vechtjas. Doel is eerder dan de rest een bepaald aantal bijzondere voorwerpen te verzamelen.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment:
Used to be one of my favorite games. I had been searching for a "Puerto Rico killer" for a couple of years before I found (and loved) Funkenschlag.
I wonder how it will age though, since the game tends to get a bit predictable with experienced players, and very much in favor of experienced players versus not so experienced players.
Contrary to some expert opinions there's still various ways to win. And the best part: there's hardly any downtime in this game, once people are used to the game...
NL: Al jaren een goed spel. Moet je zeker gespeeld hebben als je van bordspellen houdt.

item.name: Puerto Rico Het Kaartspel
item.comment:
Puerto Rico kaartspel New in collection jan. 08 Bought from Lajos. If you're in for Puerto Rico, but don't want the setup-time, this is an "almost there" alternative.
For me this game is totally obsolete after 2 years: it doesn't come close to the experience of Puerto Rico (the boardgame), and after I played Race for the Galaxy I never played this again.
Now I've found Glory to Rome which is way better than Race for the Galaxy, so where does it leave this?
Only reason for keeping this is I might take this along to holidays, bars etc. because I wouldn't want to take my rare Glory to Rome along. Oh, and it would do a nice job of being the gateway to this "multiple use of cards" kinda game.

item.name: Puerto Rico: Limited Anniversary Edition
item.comment:
Screwage turnaround.
This nonsensical rating will be removed as soon as the nonsensical decision to split this game from the regular version is revised.
No, it doesn't matter expansions are added. There is a versions system.

item.name: Punch!
item.comment: Homemade, print & play. (Rating without bonuspoints for value for money...)

item.name: PÜNCT
item.comment:
New in collection may 2008
Finally completed the Gipf brainbreaker collection!
Initial rating: how many games can Kris Burm invent with little rules? And again it's a nice abstract strategy game. First 2 plays make me long for more.
NL: abstract 2-persoons spel uit de Gipf reeks. En net zoals de rest uit de reeks een goed spel.

item.name: Pyramid
item.comment: Hmmm, I wanted to like this family style game with upright board, but it really felt too "meh" after first play with 2. It's probably fun with 5. Or with kids.

item.name: Quad
item.comment:
Nice little filler for 2.
NL: drie dimensionale versie van vier op een rij. Ook met meer dan 2 spelers te spelen. Klein spel wat er schattig uitziet.

item.name: Quarto!
item.comment:
New in collection june 08
2 player abstract with nice wooden pieces.
NL: kort abstract 2-persoons spel met houten bord en speelstukken. Het maffe is dat je per beurt de ander een stuk geeft om te plaatsen. Soort 4-op-een-rij, maar dan met 4 verschillende eigenschappen. Kost wat concentratie daardoor. categorie "grmpf, nog een keer" als je hebt verloren.

item.name: Queen's Necklace
item.comment:
New in collection sept 07 Initial rating: If you like Machiavelli (Citadels), you'll probably like this one as well. What do you mean, a girl's game? Don't you like to be mean in games? (I think I'll like this one better than Citadels)
NL: Kaartspel van de makers van Machiavelli. Anders, maar met net zo'n soort ellebogenwerk en gekonkel. Goed spel als je het leuk vind om elkaar dwars te zitten.

item.name: Quinamid
item.comment:
Interesting little abstract. Just as Gipf this is the kinda game Connect Four should have been.
Plays quite fast which also makes it a nice filler.
Comes in a wooden box. The wooden design of the game looks quite nice & inviting.Good design, nice brain burner, worth getting for fans of abstracts. The only flaw I could find is that the wooden levels lay loose on top of each other which makes gameplay just a little too fiddly for the general "Connect Four" audience.

item.name: Qwixx
item.comment: Yahtzee variant that is less crap than Yahtzee. Time killer. I usually don't have time to kill.

item.name: R-Eco
item.comment:
Fast & fun card game. For a card game it even has a decent amount of theme. Good quality cards and nice shiny box make this game even more fun to play.
NL: vlot kaartspel waarbij je probeert de beste recyclaar uit te hangen. Desondanks doe je soms aan illegaal dumpen als dat beter uitkomt. Goed spel.

item.name: Ra
item.comment:
In my opinion the best Knizia. Which might not say much, because in general I dislike Knizia games. But I find this one fun & exciting. And that's a pretty rare thing for me to say about a Knizia game.
It's a bidding game, but it has the tension of a betting game...
Usually a blast to play with 3 & 4 players. Not fun with 2, and not so much with 5.
Print out the player aid here on the geek, and it's easy explained & played with newbies as well.
NL: geweldig & spannend biedspel.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment:
New in collection jan. 08 Man, you have to get used to the all the cards and what they do. And there are a lots of cards, so in a way it's a steep learning curve. Good game though.
NL: 1 van de hypes van 2007. Kaartspel a la San Juan/Puerto Rico kaartspel, maar dan een stukje spannender en pittiger. Niet voor beginners.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
item.comment: NL: uitbreiding voor Race for the Galaxy. Nu ook met 1 of 5 spelers te doen. Meer kaarten, meer variaties.

item.name: Railroad Barons
item.comment: First testplay (with the new rules) was promising.

item.name: Railroad Tycoon: The Boardgame
item.comment:
New in collection july 07
Had to buy it. Now I need to buy a bigger table to play it at home.... Great game though.
UPDATE april 09: although I prefer (Age of) Steam to this, when we finally got our bigger gaming table this was THE obvious choice as first game to be played on it...
NL: De grote glimmende broer van Age of Steam van dezelfde maker, "mildere" versie.
Belachelijk groot spelbord (pastte niet op onze oude tafel), maar ziet er goed uit. En het is nog een prima spel ook! Voor iedereen die Ticket to Ride beu is en krijtjes treintjes spelletjes a la Empire Builder/India Rails etc. niet zo spannend vindt.

item.name: Railways of Europe
item.comment:
Finally. A board that fits on my table. Plays faster than the original too! Good stuff.
NL: andere kaart voor Railroad Tycoon. Veel geschikter voor kleinere aantallen spelers en minder grote tafels...

item.name: Rainbow Towers
item.comment:
Get's a relative high rating because my toddler can convince me to play this.
I'm looking forward to the moment he grows over this. For grown-ups this is an extremely boring and tedious activity.
I refuse to 'own' this. It's not a game, it's a bloody annoying activity.
Update: I'm really glad he's grown over this.
In Wolf zijn kindercollectie.

item.name: Rampage
item.comment:
After playing I didn't mind anymore that the game isn't cheaper.
This game is a winner for me. I guess it's a must have if you like dexterity games, it really is a lot of fun. To me it has all the Godzilla theme I want in a fun way. Even works as a two player. Although some of the cards are more effective with more players and you'll probably have more of a party atmosphere with more players I think there's more control with 2, because it's even possible to set up things for your next turn that way.
After the first game (which I won) my wife immediately demanded 'again'. Which she rarely demands.

item.name: Rattus
item.comment: OK & fairly short cubepusher. Decent combination of tactics & luck, enough decisions for the playing time. Just a bit average game.

item.name: Ready to Rock!
item.comment: What a crappy game. Won't be playing this piece of shit again. Why is it that sofar no one has ever come up with a good 'concert-game'?

item.name: Rebel Moon Defense
item.comment: Fun fast 'filler' that seems to have more 'depth' than the average filler. Sort of 'Duel in the dark' in 20 minutes. Similar gameplay in 2 fases. I think in Rebel Moon Defense the first phase is the most important.

item.name: The Red Dragon Inn 2
item.comment: Fun take that drinking game, last man standing. More a fun experience than a great game, but fun with the right crowd nevertheless.

item.name: Red November
item.comment:
Good cooperative disaster game! The more players, the harder it gets. The metagame fun is good on this one. You'll find yourself saying "I think I'll spend 7 time to fix this, that should be enough" Then you roll an 8 and everybody moans and asks why you are so clumsy.
NL: Met zijn allen zit je in een duikboot waarin van alles misgaat: er breken brandjes uit, ruimtes komen onder water te staan, raketten dreigen te ontploffen in de lanceringsbuizen, etc.
De reddingsploeg komt pas over een uur. Je moet het zien te overleven tot die tijd, dus ga je dingen fixen, al dan niet nadat je een stevige teug vodka hebt genomen.

item.name: Reef Encounter
item.comment:
New in collection june 07 Beautiful game, first play left me wanting to play more. But after 2nd play my girlfriend refuses to play this with 2 any more... So I guess I need to teach it to other players.
Initial rating will probably go up.
NL: mooi en lastig spel. Vind 'm briljant in elkaar zitten.

item.name: Regatta
item.comment:
Beautiful looking old game. The kinda game you'd play when you want to play 'relaxed'.
NL: Oud zeilspel, prachtig uitgevoerd met metalen zeilbootjes. Schijnt een goede zeilsimulatie te zijn.

item.name: Régents
item.comment:
Worker placement game with a hidden factor. Nice combination of rules makes for a slightly more original game than expected.
In a way it's an abstract cubepusher, so I understand if people that detest that don't like that. I usually don't like cubepusher, but for some reason this one clicked just enough.

item.name: Revolte in Rom
item.comment:
New in collection oct.07 Nice tactical 2-player game which has a nice balance in tactics & luck. There are dice, but for every single one of the 3 dice you roll, you have various options. I'd like to play this one more to see if my initial rating will go up or not.
Update after 5 plays: rating goes up. Thanks to various possible tactics. The dice prevent long term strategies, but it's a good tactical game.
6 years later: now Feld has become something of a eurohero, I'm afraid to say this is his only game that I'll get on the table once in a while, since my wife likes it as well. Still a decent filler.
NL: 2-persoons spel waarbij je elkaar in het oude Rome het leven zuur maakt met strijdpartijtjes. Vlot en leuk.

item.name: Revolution: The Dutch Revolt 1568-1648
item.comment:
It's long and it's fiddly. Luckily that doesn't bother me that much. All I say is that this is a great strategic game with plenty of suspense and interaction. One of the best long strategic games that I know. I like it better than Civilization...
NL: lang maar erg goed spel. Voor de liefhebber van strategische spellen een must om een keer gedaan te hebben.

item.name: Riff Raff
item.comment: Fun dexterity game. Combines the 'hamsterrolle' placing dexterity with a card/bluffing element. Great fun.

item.name: Rise of Empires
item.comment:
It's pretty rare I don't buy a new Wallace game blindly. I didn't buy this one immediately thanks to a well written review by a geekbuddy who stated the game was disappointing.
After playing the game once I don't feel disappointed, but not too WOW either.
Negatives: Gameplay feels a bit fuzzy. We didn't get the feeling of having a bit of control on the game. Or game with 5 took 4,5 hours, which is just an hour too long for what it is. But maybe it was the newness of the game, or the slowness of play.
Positives: As with all Wallace's, there are various interesting strategies/tactics possible. The new "what you do in turn A, you have to do in turn B" mechanic is frustratingly nice.
We did enjoy our play. I guess I might buy this one eventually when found cheap.
UPDATE jan 2012: got it 2nd hand. Let's see how long it takes before it gets played...

item.name: Roads & Boats
item.comment:
Damn, that box is BIG. Suddenly I really need more shelf space....
NL: Heb erg veel zin om dit lange economische spel te gaan spelen. Gelukkig kan het ook in je eentje...

item.name: Robin des bois
item.comment: Initial rating: Fun game with fairly easy rules. Enough interaction, cool bidding mechanic. OK euro by Vlaada.

item.name: RoboRama
item.comment: Fun game to play with my son.

item.name: Robosoccer
item.comment: Fun filler with lovely sculpts.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment:
Upgraded Yahtzee with a civ suggestion. Yup, only suggestion. Meh.
Ok, it looks nice. For a Yahtzee game.

item.name: Rommelkoffer
item.comment:
Not much of a game, but kids like it. And it's fun passing time playing this with your kid.
In Wolf's collection.

item.name: Rotterdam
item.comment:
Light filler eurogame. Takes way too long if played confrontational, because there are more possibilities for screwage than for getting your own ships where you want them. Probably only ment to be played in a overfriendly family way. Meh.
Although it looks quite nice, and the screwage card are fun, the game as a whole doesn't feels right, and way too random. I'd rather not play it again.

item.name: The Royal Game of Ur
item.comment:
Played once, will probably never play it again.
The ancient race variant might get kudos for, well, being ancient, but it's basically just a roll-and-move. The modern made up rules only make it a slightly more interesting game, but nothing great there either.
Only positive points: original "ancient" look, and the weird ancient d4 like dice. Best to be used for display use only. gets one point extra for that....
Too meh for me.

item.name: Rubbish Auction
item.comment: This is way more fun than you'd think it would be.

item.name: Ruhrschifffahrt 1769-1890
item.comment: Not sure yet if this heavy economic game suffers from runaway leader syndrome or not. Good game though.

item.name: Rumble in the Dungeon
item.comment:
Man, I really don't want to play this stupid 'game' again. Actually, I don't see it as a game, but as an activity.
Just like 'the original' Rumble in the house it's basically 90% luck and 10% bluff.
The only positive thing is the cartoony artwork.

item.name: Rumble in the House
item.comment: Light & fluffy. Not game here, there's basically only a (double) bluff factor and a lot of luck. Charming looks though. Probably best played after so much beers that you couldn't play anything else.

item.name: Rumpel-Ritter
item.comment:
Bought for Wolf.
Fun kids game. It's actually more an activity than a game since it's 99% luck, but kids like it anyway.
Playable with 2, probably more fun with 3 or 4. When we play with 2 we'll go for 3 coins instead of 2.

item.name: Russian Railroads
item.comment: Typical euro worker placement game. Bit too much solitaire but a lot better than the average worker placement game. Despite losing badly would like to try again.

item.name: S-Evolution
item.comment:
I wish this game was better than it was. It's basically a tricktaking theme with a pasted on theme that's absent in gameplay.
Didn't mind playing, but don't need to play again.

item.name: S.O.S. Affenalarm
item.comment:
Ok kids game. Too bad setup feels almost as long as the actual gameplay.
Replay value is low, otherwise rating would be higher. Probably works well as a mindless drunk pubgame for grownups to see who will pay for the next round....
In Wolf's collection.

item.name: Sail to India
item.comment:
What a brilliant little game. It's compact, got quite a nice gameplay and it's interactive enough (above the average eurogame). It even has got enough theme! I'm amazed how much game there is with so little components.
In a way it reminds me of cardgames where a card can be used for a variety of things, (Glory to rome, San Juan, RftG etc.) but in this game it's the cubes that really can be used for a variety of things, (but totally different than that standard euro 'trade this cube for another cube or point' kinda thing)

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment:
New in collection jan. 08
After just one play it's hard to give this one a rating. Good enough to want to play again.
Update nov 10: Never had the urge to play it again. Sold.
NL: Vooral een kaartspel waarbij je gebouwen, werkers en edelen verzamelt. Waarbij het handig is om goede combinaties te verzamelen, maar dat wil de rest ook...

item.name: Samurai
item.comment:
New in collection april 07 Nice looking board & pieces do help for the pasted on theme (yes, it's a Knizia). Easy rules, but quite some strategy involved. And it plays quick! (but prone for A.P.)
NL: tactisch & mooi uitgevoerd. Prima te doen in minder dan 45 minuten

item.name: San Marco
item.comment:
New in collection june 07 Initial rating after 2 games with 3. Nice Eurogame. Quite interactive, keeps you thinking during potential downtime. Will probably play pretty fast with experienced players.
The "fresh factor" that sets this one apart from other area control euro's: Starting player divides the cards into various portions of which he/she gets the last choice... Nice tension.
Update: after 2 more plays: this game is ideal with 3 players who like screwage with a tiny amount of brainwork. Love it.
NL: ideaal voor 3-spelers. Lastige keuzes, tactisch spelen.

item.name: Santa Cruz
item.comment:
Average family style game. Nothing bad, nothing new. Just your average eurogame. This designer has made better games in my opinion.
Feels like the next game to play after you've teached kids or newbies Kingdom Builder. At least it's less boring than that.
Stated more positively: if you like Kingdom Builder you'll probably love this.

item.name: Santiago
item.comment:
New in collection june 07 This game is no good unless played with 5. Then it's good fun: Lots of player interaction thanks to lots of possible tension and bribing opportunities. Makes for a tense and hilarious game with the right group.
Definitely rate this one at least 1 point lower with 4, and at least 3 points lower with 3...
NL: Spel waarbij je over alles mag onderhandelen terwijl je speelt. In ieder geval met zijn 5-en geweldig. Wil het niet met minder spelen.
Makkelijke regels. Lengte van het spel hangt af van hoeveel je de hele tijd onderhandelend ouwehoert.

item.name: Savannah Tails
item.comment: Ok short light filler. Nothing special but fun enough. The great thing about it, is that you clean it up while playing! Downside: Playing boards aren't too inspiring, to put it mildly.

item.name: Save Doctor Lucky
item.comment:
Have this one a couple of years now, and still haven't played it properly to the end. Just doesn't seem to be as much fun as Kill doctor Lucky
NL: het "tegenovergestelde" spel van Kill Doctor Lucky. Nu moet je hem redden van een zinkende boot die steeds kleiner wordt. Heb 'm al jaren, maar nog steeds niet uitgespeeld, want 'm vermoorden blijft leuker...

item.name: Say Bye to the Villains
item.comment: Different than other coop games. But it doens't come to the table often.

item.name: Schaken
item.comment:
Ancient Classic. But for some reason I've never really liked it. For a good 2-player abstract I feel the modern Gipf series are way more exciting. For ancient classics I'd rather play Go.
NL: Schaken. Ach. Ik speel veel liever Yinsh met je (of een ander spel uit de Gipf serie: Dvonn, Zertz, Gipf, Tamsk)

item.name: Schatz der Drachen
item.comment: Nice kids game. Memory with a twist. Probably an 8 for kids, and a 6 for grown-ups.

item.name: Schlacht am Buffet
item.comment:
This is more fun and trickier than it seems in the first round.
Too bad the box isn't smaller. (too much air)

item.name: Die Schlacht der Dinosaurier
item.comment:
Probably best to play with kids that like dinosaurs. I'd say this is a great looking game for kids as well with all the plastic dinosaurs that battle each other. The riders are pretty fiddly though, they keep falling of their dinosaurs if you don't glue 'm on.
Gameplay is pretty easy: play a card to move or attack with 2 of your dino's (you can only attack if you are next to each other). Your general can move along with any two dinosaurs and attacks pretty good too, and generally makes the game more tactical. But you really don't wanna lose that guy (I action less each round from then on)
Good game to introduce kids to multiple use of cards.

item.name: Schotten-Totten
item.comment: Fun filler. One of the few Knizia's I enjoy.

item.name: Scotland Yard
item.comment:
Catch the crook... still fun after all these years.
NL: Klassieker. 1 speler is de dief, de rest moet ;m zien te vangen. Maar dat is best lastig aangezien de dief alleen om de paar beurten opduikt. Semi-cooperatief spel.

item.name: Scrabble
item.comment:
For some reason people always start arguments with me playing this boring game before I stopped bothering quite some years ago. I can't help shuddering when someone says "Me too, I like Scrabble!" after I've told them I like boardgames.
Falls into the same category as Trivial Pursuit and Monopoly for me. -shudders again-

item.name: Scripts and Scribes
item.comment:
Great little game. Good for tense gameplay. I have 3 games from Dr. Finn, and I like them all, but this might be his best one so far.
There aren't that many short games that are great games. This is one of them.
Oh, and I really like the artwork. It fits the theme, and I like the "rough" imaging.

item.name: Scripts and Scribes: The Dice Game
item.comment: Good fun filler. Game plays quite different than the card game (AKA Biblios), so much I'm glad I own both.

item.name: Seenot im Rettungsboot
item.comment:
Democratic drowning... and yes that's fun. As long as you don't drown too much. Fun game if you're in the mood for 'democratic' backstabbing!
NL: Red je zeelieden van de verdrinkingsdood. En da's best lastig ondanks dat alles "democratisch" besloten wordt. Voor je het weet zit de reddingsboot met jouw mannen erin vol lekken, of komt het ding uberhaubt niet aan.

item.name: Sekigahara: The Unification of Japan
item.comment: Great wargame, I like it that it's quite possible to still come back after getting beaten bad in the beginning or middle of the game. Another big plus is that you don't have to look up all kinds of extra rules and little exceptions.

item.name: Senet
item.comment:
Nice looking ancient forerunner of backgammon. With sticks instead of dice.
The ancient origins of this game made it interesting to play it once. Definitely not interested in playing it again.

item.name: Serenissima (first edition)
item.comment:
New in collection july 08, finally played oct '10...
The mixture of trade and warfare is good, the ships are a nice (but fiddly) touch. Good game, but all in all the game takes a little too long for what it is. Guess it hasn't aged too well.
Update nov 10: Sold, since it otherwise probably wouldn't have been played again (my gamegroup didn't like it that much)

item.name: SET
item.comment:
Great little party game. Can be good fun & frustrating at the same time. Also nice to play in bars for rounds. But don't get too drunk or you start paying a lot (besides getting an early headache) I play this almost daily on the net.
NL: snel kort spel waarbij je je sufzoekt naar "sets" van 3 op 4 kenmerken overeenkomende of afwijkende kaarten. Onmogelijk om lang te spelen, want dan krijg je hoofdpijn. Wel leuk voor even tussendoor.

item.name: Shanghaien
item.comment: Nice fast filler. Good use of the dice as a selection mechanism. The kinda game my wife likes to play.

item.name: Shaun het Schaap: Keutel Alarm
item.comment:
Kids only. My 4 y.o. likes this.
Game gets boring after one play for me. Kids rating 6, adult rating 2, hence the average.
In Wolf's collection.

item.name: Shear Panic!
item.comment:
Initial rating: Love those sheep. My girlfriend wants this even more than I do. New in collection april 07. Rating is for 4 only though. Strange hybrid of party and serious game.
NL: Paniek in de Wei. Als je die koddige schapen ziet wil je het spelen. Moet je wel met zijn 4-en voor zijn. Niet zo leuk met 2.

item.name: Shipyard
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09
Initial rating: good game, rules and gameplay is easier than expected (you'd think different when you see all the different bits)
Deducted one point for bad quality control: it proved impossible to punch this game without tearing.

item.name: Shogun
item.comment:
New in collection july 07 Inititail rating after 1st game. Very mch a gamer's game. Finally played it after a year of shelf dust. 5-player game, so ideal condition. Came in last after a 4 hour game. Damn. Still enjoyed it, thanks to all the stuff that can be going on. So I guess it's good....
NL: Pittig spel, zit erg goed in elkaar. Terechte prijswinnaar. Baal er alleen van dat ik mijn eerste spel ontzettend verloor, wil het graag vaker spelen...

item.name: Shuffle Heroes
item.comment: It's got good art. Nice gameplay. But it's just not special enough.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
item.comment: So many choices. Tech tree was overwhelming at first play. Anyway, I really like it. Too bad it's always hard getting it on the table (best played with more than 2, and takes 3 hours. If not more.)

item.name: Siena
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree Initial rating: Interesting gameplay thanks to the mechanism that you can choose when to upgrade from farmer to merchant to banker.
It feels there truly are various ways to win this one. A lot better than it's reputation. Get the rewritten rules here on BGG.

item.name: Silverton
item.comment:
Good economic game. I enjoyed my first play a lot. Feels a slight bit like the gamers version of Empire builder games with fixed routes and a lot more mechanics. There is a certain luck factor (rolling dice to see how much stuff you get out of mines, and these mines can get depleted in the second turn!)
Not a game for casual eurogamers, thanks to the (to me very acceptable) luckfactor of the dice and long gameplay. Even the "short" game took us a little more than 2,5 hours with 2 players(which still is supposedly fast)
Would probably be fun to see how the board get's more crowded with more players, but then the downtime would probably increase as well. Still, curious to see how it plays with 3 (or maybe even 4, but no more)

item.name: Situation 4
item.comment:
Unique game, had to have it. Quite enjoyable considering it's age.
NL: combinatie tussen een puzzel en een bordspel. Vanaf 2 kanten leggen spelers tegelijkertijd "hun" versie van de puzzel aan van hun kant.
Maar zodra je bijvoorbeeld de "parachutebasis" hebt aangelegd kun je parachutisten in "vijandelijk" gebied laten landen en van daaruit verder aanleggen.

item.name: Sjoelen
item.comment:
I guess this is in the top 3 for "largest board games". Always have to have a go when I (rarely) come across one of these. It's a great dexterity game, and I'm sure I'm gonna buy one someday.
UPDATE: got a Homas board as a present!

item.name: Slush Fund
item.comment:
Fun card game with easy rules, but not so easy decisions while playing. Good with 2, even better with more.
Half point bonus for the realistic theme....
This game is an enjoyable ride. Get one while you can.

item.name: Sneaks & Snitches
item.comment:
OK filler. But not an 'automatic buy' if you're a fan of Vlaada's heavier games.
Actually, after getting this year's Vlaada batch of games (2010) and playing them made me untick my personal 'automatic buy button' for Vlaada games...

item.name: Snowdonia
item.comment:
Great game, lots of variety. There's enough challenge for everyone, it's interactive and thematically good.
Just had to buy it after first play. Everyone that complains about the game 'not being original' doesnt' get it. Love it. One of my personal top 3 favorite releases of Spiel 2012.

item.name: Snowdonia: Essen 2012 Promo Cards
item.comment: Same rating as base game. More stuff for a great game.

item.name: Socken Pfeffern
item.comment: Fun dexterity activity game.

item.name: Sorry! Sliders
item.comment:
Fun party game! Instant hit of the "let's play again" category. Sort of jeu de boules tabletop. Good for non-gamers too. Glad someone brought a copy over from the States. High rating for high fun factor.
NL: Jeu de boules-achtig bordspel. Dikke pret.

item.name: Space Alert
item.comment:
Yup, another hit from Vlaada. And again the gameplay is quite different from his last couple of games.
Very interactive and entertaining game. Just read the reviews.
Beautiful components, great rulebook (which is a true joy to read!)
NL: cooperatief spel waarbij je in een ruimteschip 10 minuten in vijandelijk gebied moet zien te overleven. Erg leuk, en erg interactief.

item.name: Space Hulk (third edition)
item.comment:
Too bad this game was made by a company run by assholes. Spoils it quite a bit.
The game itself is ok. Atmospheric Ameritrash. Not a great game, but can be tense.
item.conditiontext: New. In shrink.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
item.comment: My first 3 solo sessions were ok experiences. More fun with 2 though.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game: Space Marine Pack 1
item.comment: Marines seem to be a bit stronger.

item.name: Space Shooter Target Game: Toy Story 3 Edition
item.comment: My 5 y.o. loves the Buzz Lighyear gun. The game itself is quite average.

item.name: Speed Circuit
item.comment: Initial rating after one play: Fun classic game. Want to play this more, with the advanced rules (some luck is allowed). I have the original 3M version and only played the original no luck rules, curious about what the dice brings in tensity.

item.name: Spellbound
item.comment: Ridiculously overproduced. But it actually helps you to enjoy the game. I'd probably rate the game a 6 or 6.5 if it had an ordinary board & playing pieces.

item.name: Sputnik
item.comment:
Light but great looking abstract. This "Tamsk without timers" is probably best used as kids bait for abstracts.
Bits are lovely, and in Gigamic quality, so 1 point added for that.

item.name: Spuzzle
item.comment: Crappy kids game. Even my little son didn't enjoy this. Let it dust.

item.name: StarCraft: The Board Game
item.comment:
After 2 plays this big box of cool looking minis gets on my wishlist. Game looks great, lots of tension, tons of possible strategies.
If 4 grown ups get this excited by playing with little aliens it's a good game...
UPDATE: bought it, it's that good. Played it only 8 times due to gamelenght, but it's my favorite FFG game so far.

item.name: StarCraft: The Board Game – Brood War Expansion
StarCraft: Typhon Promotion
item.comment: This small planet is able to change the course of the game, so I guess it's nice to throw it in every once in a while.

item.name: Station Manager
item.comment:
OK train poker variant. Some nice "stab your back" mechanics added to make this worthwile. Contrary to popular opinion here: I like the minimalistic art, and I think it's a fully functional game.
NL: kaartspel voor 2 tot 4 spelers, met als basistelling de pokerdefinities, maar met wat extra spelfactoren.

item.name: Steam
item.comment:
As a boardgamejunkie I couldn't resist adding this to Age of Steam and Railroad Tycoon.
Great game. I like it better than Railroad Tycoon.
The split between money and points makes it more tactical. I'm not sure if I prefer the "grab some cubes" instead of rolling for it (like in Age of Steam) though.

item.name: Steam: Map Expansion #1
item.comment: Good expansion maps. I really like that you can play Steam in a meaningfull way with 2 or 3 players with these various maps.

item.name: Steam: Map Expansion #2
item.comment: Rating based on one play of Great Britain with 3, and one 2 player session of China. Both are really nice maps with lots of fresh possibilities.

item.name: Steam: Map Expansion #3
item.comment:
Played Singapore and Hokkaido as a testplayer. Loved these 2-player maps. On my buylist.
Update: bought

item.name: SteamRollers
item.comment: Steam with dice and without money. Not as good as the original but a lot easier to get on the table!

item.name: Steel Driver
item.comment:
In a way this game is comparable to Chicago Express: a relative 'easy' trains & stocks game, playable in an hour.
I like Chicago Express a bit better, despite the 'scripted' starting positions that Steel Driver doesn't have. Best in this category is American Rails though.
Anyway, Steel Driver does a great job as an '18xx for Ticket to Ride players' game. And I like it.
NL: trein/aandeelspel van Martin Wallace. Voor zijn doen relatief eenvoudige regels, en korte spelduur.

item.name: Stockers!
item.comment:
Early Wallace. Not so serious game. Nice idea, bad execution. This game really suffers from the difference between the art on the playing cards and the car cards. Colour print would have helped.
Probably will add color myself if I want to play it again. It's a shame really, because the game is based on a good original idea. It just isn't fun to play this way straight out of the box. Deducted at least half a point for the unfunctional (but cool looking) black 'n white artwork
NL: een van de eerste spellen van Martin Wallace. Leuk idee, maar door gebrek aan kleur op de kaarten frustrerend om te spelen.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment:
After two plays I didn't enjoy I'm already fed up with it. It all works, and there's indirect player interaction, but it just feels like a cubepusher to me.
There are better worker placement games out there. (Vanuatu for example)

item.name: Stone Age: The Expansion
item.comment:
Makes you play Stone Age with 5. Which is not such a good plan. Game takes way too long now.
The loose extra board laying on top of the normal board is quite annoying: it's too easy to displace it. And even the artwork looks like it's not inline with the original board.

item.name: La Strada
item.comment:
Filler type tile laying game. Better than Carcassone. (Which doesn't mean that much...)
It's fast, it's got easy rules, there is no luck. Ok game, didn't do that much for me.

item.name: Stratego
item.comment:
One of those games I liked as a kid. Someone gave me his copy in 2002. That copy is still unplayed on the "sentimental value only games" shelf.
(played looooong ago, way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Streetcar
item.comment:
Bought this as an alternative for Metro, which bores me.... Quite different gameplay though. Pity about the subpar game components. Mayfair should be able to provide better parts.
NL: Tramspel waarbij je eerst je route aanlegt, en dan gaat rijden.
item.conditiontext: Good

item.name: String Railway
item.comment: What a fun short filler, with unique gameplay. Wannahave.

item.name: String Railway: Transport
item.comment: Initial rating: probably the best of the current 3 string games. I like the 'steam' mechanism of delivering blocks.

item.name: String Safari
item.comment: Another fun 'string' game. Personally I like the railway game better, but this is fun as well.

item.name: Stronghold
item.comment:
Bought at Essen 2009, after hearing the game explained for the second time very convincingly by the designer.
After finally playing it: Nice tense game. As the defender of the castle you really get the feeling that 'the hordes' keep coming to destroy your castle. Even despite a couple of 'gamey' rules and the 'general cubes' that are supposed to be goblins & orcs etc.
Good stuff!

item.name: Struggle of Empires
item.comment:
Initial rating: Impressive! Although the rules seem quite easy, it's definitely not easy to play. Somebody wrote "complex, long & slow". All true, but for me not in a negative way.
It's quite complex, some of it thanks to the big amount of "alliance" & other special tiles. But it seems this game really fits together quite well & logically. It's definitely a long game, (longer than I usually want a game to last) but with no noticable downtime, since you're continously involved.
The first game went real slow, due to the complexity, trying to pick the best options, trying to adapt to what the other players do etc. But it all happens in a captivating way.
Played it with 6, first time for everyone, and everyone was very enthusiastic about this brilliant game and wants to play it again. Would have loved to just leave it on the table and play it again tomorrow...This is the first time I really wanted to give a 9 based on a first game.
Not something to be pulled off for a quick game, but definitely among the best choices if you're in for a gamers game that will last for an exciting evening.
My second game was a session with 7, with 2 newbies. It took 7 hours thanks to loads of A.P... But we had fun all the way.
Despite wanting to play this it took 3.5 years before I managed to play a third session, with 5 players, all experienced gamers. Much tougher.... Still a great game. Probably Wallace's best long game.
NL: erg goed strategisch lang spel. Regels lijken moeilijk, maar zitten best logisch in elkaar. Avondvullend spel. Nachtenvullend met 7.

item.name: A Study in Emerald
item.comment: Initial rating: First play with 4 took way too long, and was definitely not as much fun as it should have been. So it really outstayed it's welcome. Hopefully rating will go up after multiple plays.

item.name: Suburbia
item.comment: Good city builder. I probably prefer this over City Tycoon. The theme is integrated quite good in the tiles. Looking forward to playing this more.

item.name: Suburbia: Essen SPIEL Expansion
item.comment: Nice little geek addition.

item.name: Such a Thing?
item.comment: Fun filler. Wannabuy.

item.name: Super Race
item.comment: Mediocre yahtzee variant I bought for my son.

item.name: Supernova
item.comment:
Initial rating: Great looking game. Uberrisk in Space, without the Dice.
After first play with 3 I know this game should be played fast, otherwise it takes too long.
Fairly easy rules, fits together logically. Theme is there. Nice mix of strategy, tactics and a bit of luck of the draw (Battlecards, Tech cards)
Want to play it again, but not with A.P. prone people.

item.name: Sword and Sail
item.comment: Print 'n play. Played it a couple of times. Kinda Ok, nothing special. Quite small, so easy to take along. Fiddly bits though.

item.name: Symbioz
item.comment: Surprisingly good 'perfect information' game. Has quite some chaos, but in a fun way. Good game!

item.name: Ta Yü
item.comment:
New in collection june 2008 Got it discounted for half price, how could I possibly not be tempted...
Nice looking tile-laying game, or should I say river-laying game?
NL: riveieren leggen naar de overkant. jouw water wel laten aankomen, dat van de tegenstander niet. Mooie blokjes.

item.name: Taj Mahal
item.comment:
Typical Knizia: low on theme, high on tactics. Clever design, various ways to score, etc., but somehow doesn't really grab me. Would probably like it better if it was presented as the abstract game it is. Nothing really wrong with this game, but not very inviting either. Maybe would have worked better if the artwork wouldn't be so bloody bland.
Maybe I should give it another try before I put it on the trade pile.
UPDATE nov09: Despite looking nice in my Alea row I'm really not interested in playing this again (so many better games in my collection) so I mathtraded it away.
NL: Inginieus spel zonder echt thema. Zit goed in elkaar.

item.name: Take 5
item.comment:
Good game in pubs to decide who pays a round. I prefer to play it with 2-3 players. Gets too random with more, but can still be fun.
NL: Take 5 is een leuker kroeg kaartspel dan toepen. Spannend tot 5 spelers, grappig chaotisch met meer.

item.name: Tal der Könige
item.comment:
New in collection jan. 08 Bought from Lajos.
Initial rating:
Good Eurogame. I like the sneakiness of the blind bidding, stealing bits & taking over of incomplete pyramids. Not so good with 2, nice with 3, probably good with 4 player as well.
NL: Je bent een achterbakse piramidebouwer, die met bluf en jatwerk probeert de mooiste piramides te bouwen.

item.name: Talisman (third edition)
item.comment:
Initial rating after one play:
The first time I played this will very likely be the very last time as well, so I'd better give my rating now it's still fresh.
I don't like luck driven games, and this game definitely has too much luck for me. Roll a dice, choose between 2 places where to put your figure. Draw cards, roll another dice to see the effect, etc. To me it felt like 70% luck and 29% tactics. And maybe 1% strategy. Was nice to be able to play this. Had a reasonable good time playing thanks to a good crowd of 6. Too much downtime anyway with that amount of players.
Played with Dragon's Tower expansion, which only lenghtened the game more, and added more (bad) luck. Nice to have a bit more of 3d element in the game though.

item.name: Taluva
item.comment:
18 oct 07. Essen buying spree.
Beautiful looking & fairly short tactical game. Actually an abstract in disguise, but the glued on theme works for me. Works with 2-players as well, gets more cut-throat with more.
Playable in a "filler" time of 30 minutes with 2. Yes, it looks like Java, but it's a totally different game. I like it a lot.
Update after a half year and plenty of games: rating goes UP. Love to pull this one of the shelf for it's "light" feel, but fascinating gameplay.
NL: prachtig tactisch legspel waarbij je probeert voor je tegenstander(s) je 2 torens en 3 tempels te bouwen. En daar offer je af en toe eventueel een van je eigen hutjes voor op...
Vlot spel, met zijn 2-en in een half uur te doen. Blijvertje.

item.name: TAMSK
item.comment:
Love those sand timers... Quick brain burner for 2.
NL: Mooi 2-persoons abstract spel met zandlopers als pionnen. Supersnel.

item.name: Target Earth
item.comment:
Intial rating after one play: We had to look up stuff in the rulebook all the time. A good player aid for this game would have been helpfull.
