I like the theme and the coop way to deal with the trouble, I think this could be an exciting game. But after a hard session with allmost all of the dice going the wrong direction it looks a bit too much as a luckdriven dicefest with technology-path attached too it.
Not sure anymore I really want this game. There seems to be better stuff out there to scratch the same itch.

item.name: Targui
item.comment:
Risklike game that's better than Risk...
Rulewise easy "wargame" with player elimination. The random decision of rounds and playorder gives good turn-angst.
Played once in 2005 or 2006, before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list. Played it again in 2010 after buying hundreds of games and still liked it. Even though it's a dicegame which I'm not fond off.
NL: De betere en agressievere variant van Risk. Je bent een woestijnrover die met zijn kamelen de ander van het bord probeert te meppen. Vooral leuk omdat de speelvolgorde niet voorspelbaar is. Spannend, en nog gemaakt door een Nederlander ook!

item.name: Telestrations
item.comment: Not really a game, but a social activity. Can be fun with the right group though, we laughed when we did it. Would not be so keen to repeat though, fun probably wears out too quickly.

item.name: Tempus
item.comment: For a Wallace game this one is fairly easy to grasp. Although I prefer his heavier game this is a good game, and far better than his Lords of Creation.

item.name: Tennmac
item.comment:
Tennis simulation by cards. Real tennis rules apply. Has a "east-Germany" look to it, which I think is kinda fun.
There is a certain luck factor in the draw of the cards, but after a couple of rounds I found out that it's quite possible to play tactical.
Probably good for tennis fans. Which I am not. Hence the rating.
NL: Tennis simulatiespel met kaarten. Wel aardig maar niet zo mijn ding.
item.conditiontext: Good condition, complete. Probably looks the same new. It has a kind of "old" look about it.

item.name: Terra Mystica
item.comment:
Good looking, different factions mechanics work etc. It just should be more fun...
1st game didn't grab me as it should have. 2nd play felt quite better.

item.name: Terrain Vague
item.comment:
Took a while to find, took a while to get played. But despite high expectations it pulled it off.
This game is pretty high on interaction, high enough on theme, and I just love the quirky theme that has been translated well into the game.
Our first game left a thirst for more. I prefer this game to a lot of 'better worked out mechanics' or 'eloquent' curren eurogames.
Unique gem.

item.name: That's Life!
item.comment:
Simple filler family game. Rating is for 2 players. More fun with more (let's say 5.5). Got the expansion (Verflixxt Nochmal) for a slightly better game.
NL: makkelijk tussendoortje voor de hele familie. Prima geschikt voor mensen die Mens erger je niet of Ganzenbord willen spelen (wat ik weiger) mrt 2009: Heb de uitbreiding erbij gekocht zodat het een pietsje beter spel is. Hou het spel nog even om te kijken of Wolf het leuk gaat vinden.
nov 2014: Voor het eerst met Wolf gespeeld. Hij had plezier.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment:
Initial rating after 2 "simple" plays, and 1 nearly finished "advanced" plays: Very intriguing game! Smooth gameplay, loads of stuff to keep in mind, decisions to be made, etc. Can't wait to go for the full game. Very good.
Meanwhile played the advanced game a couple times more, and I think it's an excellent 2-player game. Curious about what the full game and more players might add.
NL: Civilisatie spel, zonder kaart. Maar het werkt desondanks erg goed! Erg gaaf spel. Duurt snel 3 uur, (tenzij je de beginners variant speelt) waarin je elke minuut geboeid bent.

item.name: Thunder Alley
item.comment: Got on my 'wannahave' list after one play.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment:
Draw cards Draw more cards Draw some more cards Lay route Repeat the above. Yawn.
Only fun for casual players. After a couple of initial plays it really started to lose it's shine for me, so I got the 1910 expansion. Didn't help much. Should I try the Europe or Marklin variant? I don't feel inclined. I'm just keeping this box long enough to see if my baby boy will like it someday, and get rid of it really fast once I find out he doesn't like it (anymore) either.
Update: sold. By the time my kids is big enough there will be plenty of games where I'd probably have some fun with.
NL: Mooi uitziend bordspel. Prima voor beginners. Voor de gevorderde spelspeler niet boeiend. Ik ben er behoorlijk klaar mee en speel het dus ook niet meer.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: USA 1910
item.comment:
New in collection july 07 The bigger (standard size) cards do definitely feel better . Wouldn't want to play without them anymore.
On the other hand: couldn't DOW included them in this size in the first place... Haven't tried all the variants yet, but it's nice to have a little variation on the original game. Kinda got too bored with that...
Update nov 10: sold Ticket to ride with the expansion.
NL: uitbreiding voor Ticket to Ride. Grotere kaarten, en nieuwe varianten. Maakt het weer net wat afwisselender.

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment:
New in collection Dec.06. Unfortunately with slight misprint. Solved nicely by Mayfair. March 07: Initial impression after two 2-person plays: Whoa, nice one indeed! Loads of possible tactics, catching up etc. Can't hardly wait to play this with more people.
Update: downgraded a point. For some reason I'd rather suggest and play other games. Still like it though.
Update: downgraded 2 more points. After buying 200 better games I think this game is bonedry and therefore boring. I'd rather play a good abstract than this "painted" abstract. Yeah, there's some turnangst, there's various tactics. There's just no fun. Put it up for trade.
Update: sold it.
NL: pittig spel met relatief eenvoudige regels. vind 'm goed qua regels, maar kwam niet zo vaak op tafel. Zou het komen omdat het bord niet zo mooi is? Of omdat het spel zo gortdroog voelt?
item.conditiontext: Good. 2 gameboards!

item.name: Tikal
item.comment:
Beautiful board, light enough as a step up for Settler players. It's a better game with the auction variant!
NL: mooi spel uit de "Face" reeks. Je gaat op expeditie in de jungle, op zoek naar oude tempels en schatten.

item.name: Timber Tom
item.comment:
WARNING: You'll be instantly screaming gimme gimme gimme after reading about this game and seeing the pictures.
Well, I did...and I can tell you, the game even looks better on your table.
Initial rating after 1 play with 2 (3 mountains): good mix of tactics, a hint of fate (the cards) and short-term strategy. It's more strategical with 2, that's why my girlfriend wants to play it with more.
I think it'll be even more fun with 3 or 4 too.
Added half a point because the game looks so inviting to play.
NL: Dit is wellicht het mooist uitgevoerde bordspel in de collectie. Moet je gezien hebben.
Spel is ook leuk: Soort 3d bergwandelracespel, waarbij je als eerste een aantal goudzakken van verschillende bergtoppen moet zien te krijgen en terug te brengen naar het basiskamp.

item.name: Timeline: Discoveries
item.comment: Not keen on trivia games.

item.name: Timeline: Music & Cinema
item.comment:
Not keen on trivia games. The Timeline series have a low replayability factor, as it is to be expected for trivia.
+ 0,5 for the music theme...

item.name: Tinners' Trail
item.comment:
After one play it rose immediately to nr. 1 on my wishlist. Yes, it's good. For a Wallace relatively easy to grasp, but still with lots of interaction and hard decisions.
It's one of my favorite Wallace games. (Struggle of Empires, Princess of the Renaissance, (Age of) Steam and Brass are my other favorites)
I'm lucky I eventually managed to buy the original Treefrog edition, because I think the redesigned box and board look gross in comparison.
item.wishlistcomment: I'm only interested in the Treefrog edition, not in the new Stinkers Fairytrail edition. UPDATE: paid too much money, but got me the 1st edition.

item.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies
item.comment: Small box with a good game in it. Fairly simple rules. But thanks to the 'follow' rule it's quite interactive and hard to play it good.

item.name: Titan
item.comment:
Man, did I get slaughtered on my first ply of this. Next time I'd better play this with 2 or 3 instead of 6... Well at least I know now what I did wrong. Want revenge!
NL: knokdobbelspel klassieker met de nodige regels.

item.name: To Court the King
item.comment:
Light dice filler. You roll to obtain cards, in order to get more cards and finally get to the King and Queen.
For a dice throwing game it has at least the suggestion of control. Need more plays to evaluate.
One BIG downer: It would be so much more fun / less frustrating to play it those bloody icons weren't so damned small. I actually even might buy an edition where the icons were more or less readable from more than a 2 inch distance.
Actually, might as well get rid of the art, the game's pretty much abstract anyway.

item.name: Toc Toc Woodman
item.comment: Silly but very addictive dexterity filler. Like it so much I bought some more as presents and for trades.
item.conditiontext: Brand spanking new, in shrink.

item.name: Toc Toc Woodman: Golden Axe Expansion
item.comment: Who doesn't want an extra axe? The game should ship with a couple of these.

item.name: Tokaido
item.comment:
It looks great, but I didn't enjoy my first (and probably last) play of this family style game.
It's supposed to get a 'peaceful atmosphere' but it's basically a 'get your pawn into the best position' combined with the time mechanic from Thebes/Tinner's Trails/Red November.
Very scripted and very boring.

item.name: Toledo
item.comment:
Bought at Essen '09.
Not too bad for a 'family style' game. Not on par with a regular Wallace game though.
I don't like the cheap look of the game (designwise)

item.name: Tongiaki
item.comment:
Tactical game with some luck, and some strategical options. Easy rules, nice screwage factor.
I like my games a bit more strategical (instead of mainly tactical), but the "move to other islands" mechanic is fresh enough to feel original.
NL: Eilandjes ontdekken. Relatief kort spel, bij voorkeur met 3 tot 5 te spelen. Zit grappig in elkaar.

item.name: Too Many Cooks
item.comment:
Okayish card game. Theme has absolutely nothing to do with the game.
Actually: I really dislike the bit of theme there is too it. I like my soup to be spicy. In this game the red peppers are the "bad" cards that "spoil" the soup.
I'd play it again if asked, but wouldn't ask for it.

item.name: Torres
item.comment:
I used to really like this one. Play feels quite abstract, but building towers looks nice. It sets up in less than a minute, hooray!
After a couple of years the shine has gone for me. Not bad though, nice "thinky" game for newbies as well.
Leuk 3d spel waarbij je je "eigen" torens zo hoog mogelijk opbouwt zonder dat je collega's bij je komen staan.

item.name: Totemo
item.comment: Nice colourful abstract.

item.name: Tournay
item.comment: Combomaking, but done in an ok way.

item.name: Traditional Card Games
item.comment: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/22251 ......

item.name: Trains
item.comment:
Great combination of a deckbuilder and a 'chicago express' style train game. High on my wishlist after one play. Prepaid for pickup at Essen 2012.
Yes, it works great with 2 players as well. My wife loves to play this as well.

item.name: Trans-Siberian
item.comment: Had a blast during my first play of this. Hence the initial 8. The weird thing about Harald's games is that they usually take a little longer, but are nonetheless rewarding due to the 'relaxed & fun' feeling they seem to exhale. And they're interactive, which is always good.

item.name: Transport
item.comment:
Initial comment after 2 plays: Nice looking tile-laying game. Reasonable mix between tactics and luck.
I like this game better than Carcassone due to the high 'screw your neighbour' fun factor.
Couldn't be bothered to buy it though, it's not THAT convincing. Hence the rating.

item.name: Travel Blog
item.comment:
Bought this one at Spiel 2010 because at time I believed every Vlaada game was good. This one convinced me he can make boring mediocre games as well.
Played twice in 3 years, and was glad to get rid of it. It's the kinda game that might have been 'allright' up 'till the 80's. Beyond 2010 it's just a family snorefest, despite the 'speed' element.

item.name: The Trial of Socrates
item.comment:
After enjoying Slush Fund I just had to have this. Fast, short but still "deep" enough 2-player game. I like it.
NL: 2-persoons, kleine oplage spel.

item.name: Tribune: Primus Inter Pares
item.comment: New in collection july 08

item.name: Trick of the Rails
item.comment: Original. You have to think 'around the corner' on this one.

item.name: Trio
item.comment:
Children's math game Played it as a kid. Not much fun. Can't remember ever liking it. Got it from my parents, apparently to help me get better at math. Bleh.
NL: rekenspel voor kinderen. Vond het vroeger minder vervelend dan rekenles, maar leuk is anders.
(played ages ago, way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: Triumvirate
item.comment:
Initial rating: Nice indirect trick taking 2-player. I like the components and the subtle bluffing possibilities. Not too sure about luck of the draw.
It probably takes a couple of plays before the game really grows on you. So rating might go up after more plays.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit
item.comment:
No, never again. In real life I really don't like people that blabber useless trivia, even less so in this piece of horrid nonsense that quite some non-gamers like to call a game.
One should never say never, but still I think I'll never ever will be willing to sit throught this again.

item.name: Trötofant
item.comment:
The only reason I don't give this an 8 or 9 is because you have to be in the right mood (with the right players) to be wanting to play this.
I stopped playing my first game after 5 seconds because I couldn't stop laughing.
Great fun for people that like stuff like Loopin' Louie.
Oh, and it's supposed to be a good kids game too....

item.name: Troyes
item.comment:
After one play I'm not sure if I'm gonna like it or not. Nifty & original mechanism, but it takes some time to see what you need to do. It feels quite indirect, and I can see why some people see it as 'too much work'.
Intriguing game though. Want to play again before I consider buying it.

item.name: Tumblin-Dice
item.comment: Fun party dexterity game!
item.wishlistcomment: Would prefer Nash version over Ferti version.

item.name: Turbo Taxi
item.comment:
Below par mediocre little filler, cross between Set and Metro.
Bought this because I hoped I'd like it better than Metro. I don't. But at least it plays faster (even more if you don't play all the times which is quite allright, just make it "best in 10 minutes")
And no, the fact that Friedeman Friese made this doesn't make it any better than it is, unfortunately.
NL: Soort puzzelspel, waarbij iedereen tegelijk zo snel mogelijk een route moet zien te maken. Wel aardig in de categorie: even iets doen in 10 minuten.

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 play: More, more, more!
Update after owning it 5 years and 3 years of not getting it on the table: dropped the rating by a point. I still like the game but it's appararently not so high on my 'suggestions' list.

item.name: Twixt
item.comment:
New in collection june 08. 3M Bookshelf version
I like this sort of short abstract, my girlfriend hates it. I guess I won't play it that often...
NL: oud abstract spel waarbij je ieder 2 (verschillende) overliggende kanten moet zien te bereiken. Door de korte speelduur ook leuk voor tussendoor. Zijn ook regels bij om het met 2 teams te doen.

item.name: Tycoon
item.comment:
New in collection june 07. Another Kramer Klassic, one of the ugliest looking games I own. Good game though. Rating would probably be higher if the game looked more appealing, so it would get more plays.
NL: Niet zo'n mooi spel in een spuuglelijke doos. Wel een goed competitief economisch spel, doet in de verte aan Acquire denken, maar dan met vliegtuigjes, hotels en fabrieken.

item.name: Tyros
item.comment:
New in collection sept 07
Small size Martin Wallace game. Not as simple as the rules seem to suggest...
Not as outstandingly great as Struggle of empires, or fun as Railroad Tycoon, but still a decent game with a nice level of trying to read each other's minds tacticwise.
NL: 3/4 persoons spel waarbij je in de oudheid de gebieden rond de middellandse zee probeert te overheersen. Relatief eenvoudige regels, maar wel strategisch/taktisch.

item.name: TZAAR
item.comment:
New in collection feb 08 new in collection
The newest in the Gipf collection. 1st edition!
NL: de nieuwste en laatste uit deze fantastische 2-persoons reeks.

item.name: Uchronia
item.comment:
Disappointing ripoff from Glory to Rome.
Pro: - Artwork looks good (comparable to the French edition of Innovation) - Basically the game has good mechanics (close to Glory to Rome)
Con: - It's a lot less fun, intuitive and interactive than Glory to Rome - Theme? What theme?

item.name: UGO!
item.comment:
Good trick taking card game. Couple of nasty twists to it, I like that.
The ugly box cover and bland artwork on the cards and board makes the game look like a game I'd normally wouldn't consider trying/buying, so don't let that misguide you.

item.name: Ultimate Warriorz
item.comment: This game is fun to play with my son (7). He likes it a lot.

item.name: Union Pacific
item.comment:
New in collection jan. 07 After first 2 plays: Exciting, because of the constant tension: should I play track and expand my hand, or play stock NOW because dividend may be next? The game can have a feeling of unfairness with the official rules, (2nd game had 2 dividend payouts in the same turn which caused a runaway leader, never to be caught again) but is nevertheless fun enough to pull out for casual gamers.
NL: Trein en dividendspel. Spannend door de continue onzekerheid op welk moment er uitbetaald gaat worden. Moet je eigenlijk met minimaal 4 mensen spelen. Spannend met 5. Als iedereen een beetje doorspeelt.

item.name: Upon a Salty Ocean
item.comment:
Good euro. Theme fits the game, so it doesn't feel like a standard cubepusher. Money is tight initially, and the indirect interactivity is quite strong during the whole game; you really need to watch what you're opponents are doing.
Liked the first game, a bit less enthusiastic after a 2nd play. Might end up buying this one in a discount, despite owning too many euro's already...

item.name: Urban Sprawl
item.comment:
Good game. Yes, it's a bit long, and it's actually way too long if players A.P. too much, which can spoil the pleasure.
There can be massive swings in the game, just like in Dominant Species. It all seems thematically apt though. I can see why people don't like this game: especially players that need a feeling of control might get frustrated. But I feel you can learn how to adapt to the game and play it well, so I like it and want to play again.

item.name: Urland
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Just had to get Ursuppe's "next phase". It's certainly different enough. One game is not enough to give it an objective rating. Enjoyed playing it though. Second play with 3 didn't work as good as with 4. Probably best with 5. Rules don't feel so logical as with Ursuppe. Not as much fun as Ursuppe either, but still ok.
NL: Tactisch spel met oertijd thema. Soort vervolg op Ursuppe. Het is de tijd dat de beesten vanuit het water het land opgaan. En jouw beesten moeten natuurlijk in de survival of the fittest in grotere getale overheersen. Met behulp van de juiste handige genen en andere strategien lukt dat wellicht, tenzij de vulkaan uitbarstingen of paniekaanvallen in je nadeel werken.

item.name: Ursuppe
item.comment:
Ursuppe New in collection april 07. Very, very good & fun game. The theme is hilariously appropriate and surprisingly relaxing for "a cut-throat struggle for food" game. Very easy to imagine yourself floating along in the primordial soup, hoping that you'll be able to surpass your companions in this basic struggle for life. With the right players even the downtime is enjoyable in this one.The only disadvantage: takes a bit too long with basic rules. Easy solution: shorten the point path & the number of windrose cards.I'll probably always want to play this with 4.
NL: Hilarisch, tactisch & strategisch. Je hebt een roedeltje domme microbes die een beetje ronddobberen en spartelen in de prehistorische oersoep. Ze overleven op de drollen van je medespelers. Klinkt uitnodigend toch?

item.name: Uruk: Wiege der Zivilisation
item.comment:
Sort of "Civilization-lite" card filler.
Not as good as Through the ages and such, but a reasonably good game that plays in less than an hour...

item.name: Valkuil
item.comment:
Used to play this as a kid. Can't remember REALLY enjoying it even back then.
Bought it for 50 cents at a fleamarket in april '14 for my 6 year old son. So far he likes it.

item.name: Vanuatu
item.comment: Finally a good worker placement game! Together with Manhattan Project the only worker placement I really like. It's tight, tense & very interactive, that's how I like games. Made it to my wishlist after one play.

item.name: Vegas Showdown
item.comment: More fun than I had expected it to be. Despite the luck factor (when will what cards show up)

item.name: Verflixxt nochmal
item.comment:
18 oct 07 Essen buying spree
Expansion for That's Life. Adds a bit of tactics, now playable up till 8 players. Still so-so for 2 players. Haven't played it with more players yet, will only propose it to non-gamers to make this "better variant of pachisi" a bit more of a game.
NL: uitbreiding om het dobbelspel That's life (Verflixxt) op een wat hoger nivo te tillen. Brengt net dat noodzakelijke vleugje taktiek in het spel. (Makers van het spel hebben oa Java, Tikal, Torres en Maharaja gemaakt)
Maakt het nog steeds geen goed spel voor 2. Wellicht wel aardig voor meer (met de uitbreiding kun je het tot 8 personen spelen)

item.name: Verräter
item.comment:
New in collection june 08 I think I like this game better than Machiavelli/Citadels which it inspired. Only downside is that you have to play it with 4. No more, no less.
NL: 4 persoons kaartspel (evt.3) waarbij je partij kiest voor 1 van 2 strijdende partijen. Maar vooral voor jezelf...

item.name: Villa Paletti
item.comment:
New in collection Jan. 07 Fun dexterity game! Jenga with more rules...
NL: leuk behendigheidsspel waarbij je eigen pilaren steeds een verdieping hoger moet zien te krijgen.

item.name: Vinci
item.comment:
New in collection dec. 07, finally played in april '10, way after descendant Small World got popular...
Easy rules, interactive wargamish kinda game. Fun to play.
NL: beschavingen ontstaan en gaan weer onder. Het is aan jou om het juiste moment te kiezen om je huidige beschaving te laten ondergaan en een nieuwe te starten.

item.name: Vinhos
item.comment: Great game! Thematic euro with loads of decisions. Pretty thematic for an euro as well. Plays great with 2, that's a bonus!

item.name: Vino
item.comment:
Our first game with 5 was severely hurt by the fact that we had let one player get a monopoly in one of the grapes, and one of the provinces. He managed to get ahead early that way, without a way for us to catch up. Despite this the game seemed to take ages to finish. Several players really disliked this first game so I guess I'll have a hard time getting this one back on the table again to find out wether the game is truly broken or that the rest of us made a big mistake.
Our guess is that 5 players is too much, probably a lot better with 4. Prices for all the grapes were continously negative influenced.
the game still felt like it could be fun, but having to play this 90 minute game for 3 hours took away the fun.
UPDATE: unlikely that I'll be able to put this on the table since my gaming buddies are negative about this game, so I mathtraded it away.
NL: wijnboer spelen in Italie.

item.name: Vlotte Geesten
item.comment: Fun speed game. In my son's collection. He's better at it than his mom!

item.name: VOC! Founding the Dutch East Indies Company
item.comment:
Quirky game. Strategics mixed with blind sailing. Very odd. Fun to play though. It's hard to see strategics when you're busy sailing blind by the way.
Splotter has made better games, but this one is quite funny to play.

item.name: Volle Scholle
item.comment: Fun filler. After the first play (3-player) one of the weekly team immediately wanted to play it again. And yet again...

item.name: Wadi
item.comment:
Initial rating after 1 play at a Ducosim fair:
Nice looking tactical game. Easy rules & short play. Very enjoyable with a decent amount of backstabbing...
Probably would have bought this one if I had less games on my shelves: almost no downtime, it's quick, it looks nice. Although it's probably better (especially for gamers) to not use the different ending placement rules.
(and no, I'm not blind, nor a friend or relative of the designer)

item.name: War of the Ring (second edition)
item.comment:
Protest rating. Cut the crap in dividing games in different editions. That's what versions are for.
There are now 3 different entries for the same game. That's 2 entries too many.
This rating will be removed ONLY when it is decided to put the entries together again. No use in PMing me, sorry.

item.name: War of the Ring Collector's Edition
item.comment:
Screwage turnaround.
This nonsensical rating will be removed as soon as the nonsensical decision to split this game from the regular version is revised.
No, it doesn't matter expansions are added. There is a versions system.

item.name: War on Terror
item.comment: Risk for the politically incorrect.

item.name: Wasabi!
item.comment:
Original theme. Simple rules. Great sturdy cardboard pieces. Beautiful artwork.
First play with 2 was a bit so-so. Second play with 3 was a slightly better but still unsatisfying. We found out afterwards we played one rule wrong, so finally played a 3rd game with 3 to see if the game is really so "fillerish" as it seems. It is. Up for trade.
UPDATE: traded away
NL: mooi uitgevoerd spel waarbij je als potentiele topkok zo snel en goed mogelijk bepaalde "recepten" moet maken. Ziet er geweldig uit, maar ik vind er niet veel aan. Ruilen?
item.conditiontext: Played 3 times, looks as new. Components bagged.

item.name: Washington's War
item.comment: Took some turns to figure it out, but then it´s quite an ´easy´ wargame, without being shallow. For me it´s comparable to games like Hannibal or Hammer of the Scots: asymmetric, very interactive battling with plenty of choices without too many rules.

item.name: Waterloo
item.comment: Yes, it is good. I'm very enthusiastic after my first two plays.

item.name: Way Out West
item.comment: Opinions seem to differ about this game, but I had good fun during my first play of this cowboy-Wallace.

item.name: Welt der Abenteuer
item.comment:
Rating is for adults playing with kids. For kids the rating is at least a 7.
Voor Wolf gekocht als Sinterklaaskado. Hij speelt het graag.

item.name: WeyKick
item.comment: Expensive, but fun. Played it at Essen 07.

item.name: WeyKick On Ice
item.comment: This one is even slightly better than the original Weykick. Would buy it if it were a bit less expensive.

item.name: Wiggling Cow
item.comment: Out of 5 of 6 Haba kids games we played at Spiel 2011 we thought this was the most fun.

item.name: WildLife
item.comment:
Good game to play with 6. That's a scarce commodity. Not a fast game, but certainly good screwage times to be had with the right group.
NL: meerderheidsspel van de maker van El Grande.

item.name: Wir sind das Volk!
item.comment: Initial rating: 8 - good game. Rating will probably go up after several plays.

item.name: Witch's Coming!
item.comment:
Another one of those quirky tiny Japanese card games.
Amazing how these Japanese designers come up with so many game ideas using so few cards. This one has 18 cards: 2 of them work as a game timer 5 are 'the board' (5 two sided houses) 5 are twosideds lantern that keep witches away temporarily 6 are the actual playing cards (3 witches, 3 kids)
Each turn one of the 2 players (the witch) plays 5 of the 6 playing cards on the houses, the other player (villagers) has the option to put any amount away or not. Object of the game is to get the 3 cards of your kind (witches or villager kids) in a house.
And the game works! There is a huge luck factor in the game, but it's still fun to play with kids. For me it's a nice deduction/bluffing intermission game. (It plays in 10-15 minutes.)
I love playing it with my son. (6 y.o.)

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment:
Party games should be fun. I don't have any fun playing this, hence the low rating.
In a way similar to Trivial Pursuit but a bit less annoying. I really hate Trivial Pursuit, so it's definitely not my kinda game.

item.name: Wiz-War
item.comment: Nice oldie. Fun & light.

item.name: Wreckage
item.comment: Possibly great. For a 6 year old, that is. Reasonable looking components. But what's with the terrible gameplay that begs you to cheat so the game will end sooner? Bought it & got rid of it within a month. Yes, that's a personal record.

item.name: Xanadú
item.comment:
Neat card game. The symbols on the card are a bit weird and too small, so there's a lot of looking over the cards.
Nice game, although it could do with better symbol design. I like the way the cards feel, there is something unique to it.

item.name: Yahtzee
item.comment:
Old time filler. Won't play this unless I'm really really really bored and don't have anything better to do.
NL: Gaaaaaap. Svp niet suggereren. Als je mijn gezelschap niet leuk vind mag je ook gewoon iets voor jezelf gaan doen of weggaan...
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from showing up on my unplayed list)

item.name: YINSH
item.comment:
Great masterpiece abstract game, too bad it's only for 2 players.
From all my games in the Gipf series this one get's pulled out the most.
NL: Misschien wel het beste 2-persoons abstracte spel uit de fantastische Gipf reeks.

item.name: You Must Be an Idiot!
item.comment: Another Trivial Pursuit variant that I do not like.

item.name: Yspahan
item.comment:
Initial rating: Good game, better than expected. I've read all the reviews, and thought: "guess it's just another nice, entertaining, but average euro, I'll let this one pass by". But after sitting in on a session, I decided to buy it anyway.
Why? Because it's actually better than the "average euro": it plays fast despite lots of options, there is enough player interaction, and it has a nice lot's-of-dice-but-not-so-much-luck mechanic that's feels new instead of a rip off (closest thing I recall is the dice mechanism used in Roma, and even that one isn't close)
Cons: It's pretty low on theme, combined with the "various possibilities to gain VP's" that make it sound dull. So I still have to see how I rate it in a year. Sounds a bit like a good Knizia, doesn't it?
Having the same cubes for goods, "special houses" AND your personal point counters at least don't hide the "cube pushing" feel games like this have. So it's kinda honest in it's themelessness....
NL: Vlot spel, tactisch, niet te moeilijk en toch leuk.

item.name: Yunnan
item.comment:
This is one of those 'nothing really wrong with it' games that just doesn't engage me enough.
If I'm in a bad mood I'd say it's another soulless feeling worker placement eurogame.

item.name: Zack & Pack
item.comment: Fun fast filler.

item.name: Zeeslag
item.comment:
Used to play this as a kid. Should have left it at my parents house, because it's only collecting years of dust on a shelf now...
NL: Zeeslag. Alleen nog in mijn collectie vanwege historisch besef en sentimentswaarde..
(played way before I joined BGG. Logged 1 play in 2006 to keep it from my unplayed list)

item.name: ZÈRTZ
item.comment:
New in collection april 07. added the 5th of the Gipf series to my collection.After first 2 plays: whoa, this one will take some training as well...
NL: Nog zo'n goed 2 persoons abstract spel uit de Gipf serie. Plaats balletjes op het steeds kleiner wordende bord.

item.name: Zombie Dice
item.comment: OK filler with nice dice.

item.name: Zombie State: Diplomacy of the Dead
item.comment:
Better than I expected it to be. Yes, on the outside it seems too much 'multiplayer solitaire' and 'luck driven'. Despite I usually despise that I want to play this game again.
Just don't expect a simulation. Ever seen a zombie movie with a fantastic script with no flaws?
This game is fun to play with the right players, and there is a surprisingly lot of stuff you can do to influence the game. We had a great time with it.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment:
Good looking game. Should be good for gamers & newbies.
Too boring/average for a 'boardgamer'
UPDATE: traded for Graenaland
item.conditiontext: Got a spare new German copy in shrink

item.name: Zopp
item.comment: Good fun dexterity football game.

item.name: Zulus on the Ramparts!
item.comment:
Lost my first game horribly! Won my 2nd one. Nice tense game on both occasions.
This one player tiny wargame in a ziplock is more luck driven than I usually like. Still fun to play though.

item.name: Містеріум
item.comment:
I like this a lot more than Dixit, which feels slightly similar in the main deduction mechanism.
Or actually: I don't like Dixit, but I do like this one. But it can be pretty hard/frustrating to play the ghost.
